story:
Short Summary 

Thank you for taking the time to learn more about this project. The creators realized that no one was creating any content paying homage to 90s. As a result, we have created a series to hoping to inspire, laugh, and revel in a time that was a big influence for our generation. What makes Mary Contrary stand out amongst other timepieces is the tone of familiarity while magnifying the irony of the issues that were on the cusped of the solutions within the next decade. Secondly, like you the creators understand that characterization is everything to building great content.  

In the end, we were not only inspired by each other but, also by a period of time that seems like only yesterday. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking you to make our project reality by helping us fund the pilot. If the Pilot is not made then we will refund your money. 

  • We are hoping to raise 20,000 to help fund the actors, equipment, and services for the pilot.

  • Here's what your contributions will help us cover:

    Crew costs

    Camera rental

    Lights rental

    Sound Equipment

    Costumes

    Location Rental

    Food

    Production Insurance

    Music Licensing

    Editing and Post-Production costs

    Publicity/Marketing Costs

  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating doesn't work for you right now, no worries! You can still support Mary Contrary. A like, comment, retweet, or post can really help us get the word out. 

Thank you so much for joining us on this adventure!

story:
WHO WE ARE :

SARA is a fond lover of Literature, Languages, People, Psychology, Travels, Art & Absurdity. 

She has been spending her whole life looking for something between serendipity, magic, enthusiasm and randomness that is not really identifiable yet. 

She has never been sure to find it, but she still believes that to keep searching is and will be worthy.  

Quoting Bobby Kennedy that quotes George Bernard Shaw “There are those who look at things the way they are and ask why? I dream of things that never were and ask why not?”

She is strongly persuaded that God Prefers Atheists can suggest a different way to approach religious themes and hopefully inspire to go through life with a more relax attitude.

ENRICO is a dynamic kind of guy, with a true passion for filmmaking, photography, anthropology, adventure traveling, art and cultural interchange. 

He likes to call himself a citizen of the world and can hardly stay in the same location for more than a few months on a row, even if he does love being based in London for its multiculturalism.

He never gets tired of searching for beauty in all its forms combining a dreamy attitude with a down to earth approach to life. At the end of the day the most important thing in life is not to take ourselves too seriously and always have a laughter ready.

He believes God Prefers Atheists will help the world bond together and see life and religion in a more cheerful way.

 

WHAT WE DO :

God Prefer Atheists is a web series narrated in the form of a TV sit-com style, divided into 7 chapters in representation of the Seven Holy Sacraments of the Church. 

The story describes a family conflicts and everyday life by humorously re-interpreting facts from the Holy Bible focusing on the creation of Humans and the figure of God. More specifically, the trait- d’union between the different episodes is the troubled Father - Son relationship that God and Jesus experience. These two are the main characters that will come across different events through time and space following Bible’s chronology until reaching an unexpected epilogue. 

This web series is a narration in which a grotesque and humorous style, sometimes extreme and brazenly, encounters a delicate pastel cinematography, curated in the slightest details, almost as if to act as a contrast and metaphor of the contradictions inherent in the story itself.

Many are the events taken from the bible, but revisited in satirical terms, such as man's creation, baptism, crucifixion, and resurrection. Choosing to use actors in flesh and bones, rather than other techniques such as animation, lies in the fact that we wanted to represent what has always been painted as divine in a totally earthly way, close to us and to the idea of ordinary men.

 

WHY WE DO IT :

God Prefer Atheists is a metaphor intended to represent the abuse of power and the manipulation of the masses perpetrated over the centuries by the Church. The purpose of this project is not to offend the above-mentioned institution, but simply to bring it to a more earthy level showing how, in the end, they are just the sordidness of the single human beings to compromise and contaminate the values at the base of the institution itself and the messages that they convey. 

The idea that inspired us in writing this series is the common vision of how the Church has been created and how it has been managed more as a true business than as a form of faith and love. The end of the story, moreover, provides an important point of reflection regarding the approach with the superiority intrinsic in the concept of God himself to whom men must constantly look at in order to find the final Salvation. The confession of God and his consequent resignation show that in order to reach a more meaningful truth and a deeper sense of life, it is necessary to examine one’s conscience and question it with utmost honesty. The answers that every human being seeks cannot come from the outside nor from above and can not be imposed by others - as the Church suggests - but they can only be sought and found in the depths of each human soul.

 

CHARACTERS :

 

GOD 

God is the main character of the serie.
The narrative timeline spans from the events starting with his divorce, passing through the creation of the humans, the beginning of the Church until finally reaching his examination of conscience that will lead to a deep repentance and his resignations.
His profile corresponds to an eccentric intergalactic billionaire entrepreneur, fond lover of laziness and beer with very weak interpersonal skills. God sees himself like a self-made man; he is particularly proud of his achievements and success as well as very jealous of his own spaces, freedom and omnipotency. Not much incline to relationships compromises, he pleasantly avoids any kind of emotional responsibility that may arise.
The only other living being he has a real connection with and to whom allows entering his “comfort zone” is Holy Spirit -his cat-, who’s very independent and therefore easily manageable. He is also the only creature God shows feeling some kindness towards.
At the time of the story, God’s biggest issue is his only -and unwanted- son Jesus, who happens to live a very depressing life failing to keep up with his father’s big expectations. His ex wife’s Sathàna tricked him during the divorce agreement and he ends up with the sole custody of the 6 years old boy.
In fact, by getting rid of his wife, God hopes to be able to resume his old habits represented by cold beers on the sofa and lazy afternoons spent with his cat, instead he finds himself with the burden of growing up a very introverted son with whom he has never really built up a relationship. Being his only heir, however, God hopes that, through his own example, the son can become like him and turn into a strong and successful man. Unfortunately, God’s expectations are denied by the facts showing Jesus as incapable of socializing and integrating, extremely sensitive, absolutely devoid of paternal countenance and of any kind of charism.
During the course of the events we witness an escalation of loss of control by God caused by a growing frustration over the attitude and behaviour of his son.
Finally, God decides to invest in the growing organization created by the humans and called “Church” by paying the apostles to promote his name and persuade the humans to adore him with the triple purpose of nourishing his vanity, gaining incredible amounts of money and getting revenge on his ex-wife by infesting the Earth with fanatics.

HOLY SPIRIT 

Narrator’s voice and God’s cat, besides being his favorite creature in the whole Universe.
He is the silent companion of God’s daily routine because he is the only one able to provide him with some good vibes. He shows no affection to anyone other than God and he has very little sympathy for Jesus as he empathizes with his owner’s conflict with his son. Holy Spirit also represents the heavy hand of God; in fact, whenever Jesus exceeds the limit, God sends Holy Spirit to Earth as a warning to his conduct. He will be the only one in charge of God's inheritance.

JESUS 

Jesus is the fruit of the failed marriage between God and Sathàna.
He is an introverted baby, extremely sensitive and naive. Traumatized by a cold and absent mother and a father distracted by his own omnipotence, Jesus grows up in a silent, emotionally arid and devoid of sociality environment. At an early age he discovers his passion for percussion and, with his drumsticks, spends most of his time clanking on any surface that he can find, caught in an attempt to become the greatest drummer in the whole universe and to obviate the inner and external silent that scares him. The only people who have ever proven to be affectionate to Jesus are God’s housekeeper Mary and her sweetheart, Joseph -God’s gardener- so sorry to see a child so isolated and ignored. Besides the affection of his father's employees, the only beings Jesus falls madly in love with are the humans, created by God in order to distract him from his obsession for percussions. Despite, humans will mistreat Jesus and take advantage of him, he will always keep perceiving them as his only true friends.
He is the only character in the series that goes through a metamorphosis: in fact, we see him 6 years old in the first episode, adult in the second, third, fourth and sixths during his permanence on Earth where from being an introverted and lonely kid he turns into a hippie party animal with a solid social life full of friends and followers and, finally, reincarnated in Kurt Cobain in the seventh episode when, thanks to his father’s pettiness, he has to face again the impossibility of realizing his true real nature.
He will commit suicide in on onrush of sadness and envy after seeing the reflection of Dave Grohl in the mirror, leaving just a letter full of grief to his father.
Jesus is the true victim of the story and represents the scapegoat on which everyone projects his own faults and frustrations.

SATHÀNA - GOD’S WIFE 

Sathàna is God’s wife. Capricious, spoiled and annoying, she represents what the Church has always identified in the Devil. She is a petty woman who has taken advantage of him trying to make the most out of their divorce. After a troubled matrimony, the woman’s only desire is to start over a new life and get rid of her so hard to handle and complex son Jesus. Through a trick she manages to ensure Jesus under God’s sole custody and obtain the property of the whole planet Earth, her favorite holiday resort. God has always hated the Earth as it was the place where he was obliged to spend all his holidays. However, well aware of the affective value that the planet represents for his wife, it turns into a good starting point for revenge and that’s the reason why he will infest it with humans.

ADAM & EVE 
Adam & Eve are the first humans created by God in the desperate attempt to distract and entertain his son Jesus.
Being created in God’s image and likeness -drunk in addiction- they embody all his worsts sides. Therefore, Adam and Eve are two stubborn insolents with no respect at all who do not recognize anyone's authority including God himself, thereby triggering his anger.
They spend their time sunbathing, drinking cocktails, and lazing around without denying to subjugate Jesus to any of their requests and to use him to provoke God's wrath and continually challenge his omnipotence, as in the apple episode.
As a result of their disobedience they will be exiled to Earth.

JOSEPH & MARY 

Joseph & Mary appear in the first episode respectively as the gardener of God’s home with the passion for fishing and Jesus’s nanny and God's housekeeper.
They both present a docile, obedient and obliging character.
They feel such an extreme pity and affection for Jesus as a child that they will be the chosen ones to go with him to Earth as his fictitious parents.

Joseph will go through difficult times when he will finally realize to be obliged to grow up the son of someone else and, after meeting with the Three Wise Men on the night of Jesus' birth and having received a good amount of hallucinogenic substances, he will get lost in the desert leaving Mary by herself with the child.

Henceforth we will no longer see Mary expect for a few frames at the time of Jesus’s crucifixion when she cries her son by the foot of the cross.

PETER 
Peter is the alter ego of Jesus and is the devout servant of God.
An all-round obedient and ambitious but with zero personality and subjugated by power.
God is proud of his adoration and for this he entrusts him with His personal and important tasks, certain of his total fidelity. Peter heavily envy Jesus because he would like it to be him the designated heir instead of a useless child unable to bring forth the possibilities being offered. Following all the troubles caused by Jesus on Earth, Peter is sent there as an infiltrator among the 12 disciples in order to reaffirm God's authority.
In order to be more in control of the situation he then becomes Jesus' confidant and gains his trust. In fact, as soon as Jesus dies, Pietro inherits the role of leader of the 12 apostles. Peter will then become the first Pope of the Church and vice God that will continue serving him faithfully until the day of his resignation.

MARY MAGDALENE 
Mary Magdalene is the daughter of the High State Official Pontius Pilate and one and only love of Jesus. She is an absent-minded girl who essentially wants to have fun and aims at who offers her more.
Despite her father cannot stand all the boys buzzing around her, especially that longhair hippie of Jesus, Mary Magdalene keeps taking advantage of him, and, after the resurrection, she convinces him to take her to God’s place. Once living at the Mansion, when Jesus shows the first signs of post-Earth depression, she is be the first trying to dissuade him from the idea of returning there but with no success. Finally, having obtained immortality by God, she quits Jesus at the very last minute as she prefers going hitchhiking throughout the Universe.

JUDAS 

Judas is one of Jesus disciples and his fellow drinking buddy. We meet him for the first time during a rave in Palestine and then we see him again during the last supper when we find out he is secretly having an affair with Mary Magdalene. After leaving Jesus completely wasted at the tavern, he bumps into two of Pontius Pilate's guards while he’s going back home with Mary Madgalene. The guards mistaken him for Jesus and want to bring him in to Pilate in order to have him executed. Terrorized, Judas, in order to save himself, reveals to the guards where to find Jesus of Nazareth.

SUPPORTING CHARACTERS 

KING HEROD 
A ruthless king who cannot have heirs. He commands the murder of all male babies of his kingdom, in the grip of one of his tyrannical sprints.

THREE WISE MEN 
Three hipsters freaks in search of lysergic experiences in the desert.
While in hallucinogenic delirium they find Giuseppe, who smokes and moans outside the stable where Jesus was born. They are really moved by the state of the poor man and will share with him part of their drug stockpile.

JOHN THE BAPTIST 
John the Baptist is a regular raver. He appears in the 2nd episode during a party in Palestine where he meets Jesus in delirious conditions. Moved by compassion, he tries to help him recover by repeatedly soaking him in sea water.

12 DISCIPLES (future Catholic Church preachers) 
Considered by Jesus as his family, the 12 are lost souls without a home or a job, who find in Jesus a sustenance because of his wealth and the miracles he performs. After Jesus death by crucifixion, they find themselves with no money therefore are easily bought by Peter and God and will agree to promote the doctrine of the Catholic Church in exchange for a high monthly salary and material goods (wealth).

PONTIUS PILATE 
Pontius Pilate is a High State Official, n love with his uniform and the power that it gives him. Extremely jealous of his daughter, he hates all the guys around her, especially the hippie hiccups like Jesus. He loves to establish his authority and therefore punishes Jesus to death, who has repeatedly challenged him by falling in love with her daughter.

 

THE STORY

 

EPISODE 1 - MATRIMONY 

The episode opens on God’s office where, in the presence of his wife, he is signing the divorce papers. The scene is seen from the perspective of the Holy Spirit -God’s cat- who enters the room and walks towards God’s feet where it starts rubbing on. Once convinced to be finally free from his annoying ex wife, God realizes that he had not paid enough attention to the terms of the divorce clauses and, not only his wife has obtained the total property of the planet Earth, but he is also finding himself stuck with the sole custody of his son Jesus obsessed by one and only dream: becoming a drummer. Without any desire to be a Father, God finds himself drunk during his first face to face dinner with his son. God is puzzled by the child’s behavior and does not understand why he is so introverted, and asocial and he feels already exasperated by Jesus’ obsession for percussions. In the grip of desperation and extreme drunkenness, he tries a way out to distract Jesus from drums by creating some creatures with some random materials found in the kitchen.

The very next day he releases humans in his garden -also called Eden- which is full of beautiful fruit trees and has a huge swimming pool in it. Once in the garden, God warns the humans about the terrible punishments they will face should they eat from the Apple Tree of the Knowledge of the Good and the Evil - which is his sole solemn property- and introduces them to his son. 

Jesus is ecstatic and begins showing clear signs of improvement by socializing and playing with Adam & Eve. Actually, the latter are two extremely hedonistic people with no respect at all for authority and in practice they just use Jesus to mock him or force him in doing all the forbidden and funny things. Pretty soon, through a trick, Eve convinces Jesus to take an apple from his father's forbidden tree. Right after, Peter runs to God in order to report the fact. God goes mad and immediately convenes his son together with Adam and Eve in his office. 

Once in the presence of God, the two humans blame Jesus without even giving him the possibility to speak or defend himself. Suspicious about Adam and Eve’s behavior, God asks for the consultation of a special witness: the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil. Following the revelations made by the Tree, he establishes to exile humans on Earth with the dual purpose of punishing them and bothering the ex-wife. 

Jesus is super saddened by humans departure. In fact, even though they have betrayed him, he still considers them as the only friends he has ever had so he starts begging his father to bring them back. 

After many negations from God, Jesus escapes running in the garden in search of his nanny Mary. She is in the stable with Joseph, the gardener, where Jesus enters in tears interrupting one of the rare moments of love effusions they got the chance to exchange during working shifts. Joseph is super pissed off but Mary can not deny comfort to this little lonely child. 

The scene ends with a nativity scenery showing a donkey, Joseph, Mary and Jesus crying inside the manger full of hay. 

EPISODE 2 - BAPTISM 

Following the dramatic scenes of Jesus and his constant requests to rejoin him to his beloved humans, God sends him to be reborn on Earth where humans are already populating the planet, also sending Mary and Joseph in the shoes of his fictitious parents. Meanwhile on Earth, King Herod, embittered by his inability to generate heirs, decides to deprive anyone else of this possibility by having all the male children of the Judaea kingdom killed and also obliging the just arrived Mary and Joseph to escape in the middle of the desert, where Jesus is reborn. 

Meantime, the Three Wise Men -who are wandering in the desert on their camels in search of lysergic experiences- arrive to the hut where Joseph and Mary are hiding. They are about to knock on the door when they hear someone heavily complaining about the clear worsening of his working conditions. Crouched they move closer and they find Joseph wallowing in self pity and full of rage as he does not look kindly upon the possibility of risking his own life, being forced to live in a constant escape and raising a son that is not his without even getting a salary increase from God. Opium, Mescaline, Hallucinogens are the gifts that the Three Wise Men leave to the poor Joseph moved by his desperation.That same night Joseph swallows all of the substances received by the Three Wise Men and walks into the desert vanishing without a trace. 

In the next scene we see a 25-year-old Jesus. We find him at a rave party in a beach in Palestine with some of his friends: it is obvious that he has exaggerated so John the Baptist soaks him many times in sea water in order to have him recovered. Meanwhile, Jesus is screaming disconnected 

sentences, self-proclaiming himself as the son of God, invoking the Holy Spirit and promising eternal life and paranormal powers to anyone who would follow him. 

Many begin kneeling at his feet. 

EPISODE 3 - CONFIRMATION 

The scene opens on God sitting in his office. He has had Peter called in order to get some explanations concerning what is happening on Earth. His right hand man reports the situation to him: Jesus keeps screwing it up and is breaking all the rules God imposed to him such as not to reveal his true identity, maintaining a low profile, and for nothing in the world mentioning the name of God. On the other hand, however, many humans begin to believe every word Jesus says and are starting to associate in order to idolize him. Caught up in vanity and pride, God decides to send Peter on Earth to better observe this new movement and to deliver an important message to his son: he must go to rehab to detoxify himself or else he will be sent right back home. 

Once in the rehab center, Jesus is obliged to attend group therapy. Here is where he meets some of his future apostles and Mary Magdalene, whom he deeply falls in love with. Jesus establishes a relationship of friendship and complicity with his new fellows which is so deep and strong that they all design a plan to escape together. Once left the rehab, they go immediately back to their old habits. 

As soon as the Father gets to know of Jesus’ breakout and conduct, God orders to Peter to infiltrate into his son’s group of adepts in order to study the situation from within. Therefore, Peter goes to Earth accompanied by Holy Spirit and the two of them appear at one of the party organized by Jesus. Peter knocks at the door, a disciple opens and, in the middle of a super chaotic situation the cat is passed by one apostle to the other until finally ending in Jesus’s arms. At this point Holy Spirit stares at him, heavily hisses and and meows right to his face in order to remind him who is the one and only solemn master of the Universe: his Father. 

Closing on the frightened expression of Jesus who has too well understood the message that God sent him. 

EPISODE 4 - EUCHARIST 

The scene opens on Jesus throwing little stones on Mary Magdalene’s window to invite her to the trattoria for a supper. Unluckily, when the window opens, an enraged Pontius Pilate comes out commanding Jesus to leave his daughter in peace once and for all, and never try to approach her any more or else he will have him crucified. 

Meanwhile, the apostles are impatient at the tavern waiting for Jesus to come. He arrives alone, out of breath and saddened by the discussion with Mary Magdalene's father. After a couple of hours Jesus -well drunk already- is ecstatic as, at last, he feels accepted and at home with the apostles who represent his closest friends of his everyday life and revelry. Usual situation of chaos and delirium during which Jesus is yelling random stuff around. 

Suddenly a figure with covered face comes in and approaches the table, revealing Mary Magdalene that managed to escape from her father’s control. Jesus is super happy to see her until he notices something going on between her and Judas. In the grip of alcohol, he starts screaming “I’ll tell you the truth, one of you will betray me." Apostles laugh at him. He keeps screaming “Truly I tell you, this very night, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.” After all of his drunks fellas left, Jesus remains alone at the trattoria where the host tries to kick him out. Meanwhile Judah, who sneaked off with Mary Magdalene through the back door, runs into two of Pontius Pilate's guards. Mistaking Judah for Jesus, the guards want to bring him in Pontius Pilate’s presence to have him sentenced. Judas is terrorized and, in order to exculpate himself, reveals to the guards where to find Jesus. The guards enter the tavern and arrest him. 

Once Jesus is in chain in front of Pontius Pilates, this latter condemns his to death as previously promised. While together, Pontius vents his hate on Jesus; in fact he can not bear that a spineless hippie like him might have so many adoring followers just by saying of being the son of a phantasmal Universe tycoon while Pontius has had to earn the esteem and respect of the citizens only after many years of service to the State. Also, he makes cruelly fun of Jesus by turning the knife in the wound and waving his daughter's perpetual infidelity. Jesus is desperate and sobs no stop: "It's not right, I do no harm to anyone, it is not my fault!”. While moving toward his washbasin, Pontius Pilate replies: “Stop being a sissy.!I wash my hands of this and if you truly are who you brag to be, let’s see how your mighty and powerful father God will react. “ 

Closing on split screens of both Pontius Pilate and God washing their hands. 

EPISODE 5 - HOLY ORDERS 

The scene opens on Mary weeping at the foot of the cross. 

Right after, we see the 12 disciples on munchies at the kebab shop. A villager comes in and tells them all about the sad facts happened to Jesus. The disciples react in a somewhat indifferent and confused way, as they are still lethargic after the previous night out at the tavern. They then make a toast to their friend, especially regretting not being able to enjoy his money and to take advantage of him anymore. 

Meanwhile, God observes his son’s crucifixion thanks to Peter's live broadcast to his private TV. Peter stands a few meters from the cross and meticulously describes the situation to God, who shakes his head in disappointment for this son unable to live without looking for troubles. Furthermore, through his cheap magic tricks, he belittled his power and infamously sullied his name for which reason God decides to let Jesus stew in his own juice. 

Subsequently, God instructs Peter to go to Earth and become the leader of this growing movement -called Church- in order to redeem God’s image, extend his dominion over the inhabitants of the planet and seize the umpteenth chance to piss his ex wife off infesting her new home with worshiping fanatics. Therefore, Peter gathers the 12 disciples together and proposes to them to work for God preaching his name and his law in exchange of a monthly high fixed salary. The apostles fall from the sky and totally confused ask Peter what exactly they should be preaching, since they’ve always been just partying with Jesus and they have never experienced deep conversations. Peter brainwashes them by handing them a copy of the Lord of the Rings and urging them to read it all and believe to every single word without questioning or asking questions. 

[TO BILLBOARD] 

THE UNQUESTIONABLE PROOF THAT J.R. TOLKIEN WAS THE ONLY ONE TO BE ABLE TO INTERPRET CORRECTLY THE ORIGINAL VERSION OF THE BIBLE. 

EPISODE 6 - ANOINTING OF THE SICK 

The episode begins with Jesus that, after his death and resurrection, has been taken back into his Father’s house. We see him standing by his bedroom’s window, staring off into space (the void) while listening to the song Creep by Radiohead on a loop. As the song plays he experiences flashbacks of the happiest moments spent on Earth with his 12 disciples. Suddenly, we start hearing heavy footsteps in the background. Right after, the door opens violently and God comes in roaring like a lion and cursing against his son. After yelling at Jesus, God exits the room slamming the door behind him and goes down to the kitchen in order to have breakfast. Here, he bumps into Mary Magdalene and they have a brief conversation about Jesus in which he asks for clarification about his son’s state of mind. Mary Magdalene, then, asks what exactly is the Church. God explains that it’s the tool through which he perpetually gets richer thanks to the royalties on his own name which is already become an unbeatable global brand. 

While Mary Magdalene is having breakfast, God makes himself a mojito and goes out in the garden to smoke his cigar. He then calls Peter and when he arrives he asks him for an opinion about the new business of the Church. Peter presents him with a business plan, explaining all of his goals for the upcoming centuries and proposing himself as the head of the Church and God's deputy as well as his eyes on Earth. At this point God nominates him first Pope. Peter is ecstatic and before leaving, he suddenly remembers having something to show him. He pulls out a gigantic book -the Bible- from his purse and gives it to God explaining that humans have written his story completely overcoming events and adding details that have never occurred. God is shocked and asks for the book reading a few lines. They both end up laughing-out-loud. 

Subsequently the scene moves in Jesus’s bedroom where is listening depressing music with Mary Magdalene who in a mocking tone asks him why with all his super powers he still needs his Father permission to go back to Earth. Jesus sorrowfully answers he can only appear in the form of a ghost into someone’s dream but he’s not able to go physically back on the Planet. 

In the next scene we are back on Earth where Judah, in his bedroom, is having a nightmare. He suddenly wakes up and finds Jesus barefoot by the window wearing a white tunic and staring off into space as usual. A brief confrontation between the two follows and this is the only time when Jesus, destroyed and in rage because of the double betray of his friend, shows a bit of character. Judas however, realizes pretty soon it’s only a ghost when Jesus fails to punch him in the face passing him through. Judas bursts into a loud laughter and Jesus is once again defeated. 

Meanwhile, Mary Magdalene snitches on Jesus with God about the getaways of Jesus to Earth and his random apparitions to the disciples. God cannot take it anymore and decides to send Holy Spirit to Earth to pick his son up. So the cat goes to Earth and finds Jesus in a state of deep shock outside the window of some of his former disciples now turned into brainwashed smoke preachers. 

In the final scene we are back to God’s Mansion while the Father is scolding Jesus and imposes him an ultimatum commanding him to be careful this time as there won’t be a second resurrection. Right after, Peter comes in and passes a note to Jesus. He opens it and finds a message from Mary Magdalene who explains that she is breaking up with him because she had obtained immortality from God and she wants to go traveling throughout the whole Universe. Before leaving his father, Jesus asks where he would end up in case he should die. God looked at him vaguely with a resigned expression and walks away. 

We close on Jesus back on Earth this time reincarnated in Kurt Cobain. 

EPISODE 7 - PENANCE & RECONCILIATION [CONFESSION] 

The scene opens on Earth in Kurt Cobain’s bathroom where Jesus/Kurt is all curled up writing a letter in order to give vent to his depression. A few extracts of the letter are shown. As soon as he has finished writing, Jesus gets up and slowly approaches the sink in order to brush his teeth. He finds drumsticks in the glass together with the toothbrush. Then, while brushing his teeth, he looks into the mirror and sees Dave Grohl's reflection brushing his teeth with a drumstick and looking at him with a grungy grin. 

This represents for Jesus the straw that breaks the camel’s back of his dissatisfaction and unhappiness. After having spent his childhood begging his father to get him the drums in order to become the greatest drummer in the universe -his recurring dream- and after having convinced him to send him back to his beloved Earth, he finds himself tricked again by his father that had him reincarnated in one of the greatest singers of his century. 

Once his brain pictures the image of Dave Grohl in the mirror -Nirvana’s drummer and future frontman of the Foo Fighters- Jesus will see a flashback running through a lifetime of failure. Tired of having to fight constantly, he closes his eyes... 

SUICIDE - black screen, background sound of gunshot. 

In the next scene we are back to God’s Mansion. God is in his room, in front of the mirror, in a state of complete shock: he has Jesus/Kurt’s suicide letter in one of his hand and he is aware of having to deal with a hard mea culpa.
Long monologue of God who finally realizes how all the bad things happened until that moment have been caused by his intolerant and boastful attitude and defects. While God is experiencing a severe examination of his conscience, flashbacks of all the suffering he caused are shown. 

Subsequently, the scene moves to God Mansion’s Garden. It’s a splendid sunny day, all the characters are there, standing still while God passes through the garden with a six pack of beer in his left hand and a wicker bag from which a huge beach umbrella and some philosophy books appear. At this point, touched and prideful, God looks at his employees for the very last time and says goodbye to all of them. In the meantime, Peter enters the scene running out of breath. As soon as he sees his Boss he understands the situation and starts begging him to remain, while God is opening his beach umbrella. Before taking flight God turns to Peter and, by using the most seraphic tone, he reassures him that everything will remain the same and he will not have to worry as the office and his own position have been already taken in charge by the most competent one. Peter looks at him with an astounded expression as he can not imagine anyone more competent than himself. God begins his Mary Poppins style ascent by using the beach umbrella and throws a last glance at Peter yelling: “PETER... GET A DAMN LIFE!” 

Peter starts running towards God’s office: once arrived, he opens the door straight and finds Holy Spirit on his owner’s desk with a couple of cats guarding the room. 

The scene closes on a big close up of Holy Spirit that meows while yawning. 

THE END 

 

APPENDIX 

SOMETIME LATER 

The scene opens on God pouring some beers behind the counter of a beach hut.
On the other side of the counter two young atheists are seated. They criticize the Catholic Church and question the existence of God. Then, they turn to him in order to ask if their opinions are disappointing him.
Solemnly God looks at them in silence, then he raises his beer mug to the sky and proclaims seraphic: -“Who me? I prefer atheists!”-
Everyone bursts out laughing loud while rising up and toasting the glasses.
Closing on God that - with a voice broken from laughing - says : -“Next round is on me!”- 

 

WHAT YOU ARE CONTRIBUTING FOR :

This campaign is aimed to raise 15,000 $ in order to fund the production of the pilot episode for our web serie God Prefers Atheists.

All the actors except the main character (God) will star friends of us and people from our circle of connections. Enrico's background in film will help in this as he already has a crew who he's been working with for many years and that will deliver the best work possible. 

We will mostly need funds to build up a budget for locations, transportation and logistic, scenography and stage design, costume design and make-up, editing and post-production.

We will be constantly updating the campaign informing on each single expense we will face in order to be as much straight forward as possible. 

We estimated a budget of 15,000 euros on top of the 3,000 euros personal funds we already have on a side for the project, resulting in a final total budget of 18,000 euros.

Our final aim is to produce a professional high-end pilot in order to then find a TV channel or a production company interested in financing the rest of the episodes of the first season (6).

We also do have in mind the idea to create a follow up second season in the future.

Our crew for the filming will consist of:

1 Director

1 AD and script supervisor

2 Cinematographers

1 Editor

1 Graphic artist

1 Post production and colourist designer

1 Costume designer

1 Key make-up artist 

1 Production designer

1 Production sound mixer

1 Boom operator (sound grip) 

1 Music composer

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you can’t give any money, we absolutely value your contribution!

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by emailing it, harassing your family members, talking to your friends about it, sharing on social media.

More about the project in our Facebook & Instagram pages.
story_txt: WHO WE ARE :SARA is a fond lover of Literature, Languages, People, Psychology, Travels, Art & Absurdity. She has been spending her whole life looking for something between serendipity, magic, enthusiasm and randomness that is not really identifiable yet. She has never been sure to find it, but she still believes that to keep searching is and will be worthy.  Quoting Bobby Kennedy that quotes George Bernard Shaw “There are those who look at things the way they are and ask why? I dream of things that never were and ask why not?”She is strongly persuaded that God Prefers Atheists can suggest a different way to approach religious themes and hopefully inspire to go through life with a more relax attitude.ENRICO is a dynamic kind of guy, with a true passion for filmmaking, photography, anthropology, adventure traveling, art and cultural interchange. He likes to call himself a citizen of the world and can hardly stay in the same location for more than a few months on a row, even if he does love being based in London for its multiculturalism.He never gets tired of searching for beauty in all its forms combining a dreamy attitude with a down to earth approach to life. At the end of the day the most important thing in life is not to take ourselves too seriously and always have a laughter ready.He believes God Prefers Atheists will help the world bond together and see life and religion in a more cheerful way. WHAT WE DO :God Prefer Atheists is a web series narrated in the form of a TV sit-com style, divided into 7 chapters in representation of the Seven Holy Sacraments of the Church. The story describes a family conflicts and everyday life by humorously re-interpreting facts from the Holy Bible focusing on the creation of Humans and the figure of God. More specifically, the trait- d’union between the different episodes is the troubled Father - Son relationship that God and Jesus experience. These two are the main characters that will come across different events through time and space following Bible’s chronology until reaching an unexpected epilogue. This web series is a narration in which a grotesque and humorous style, sometimes extreme and brazenly, encounters a delicate pastel cinematography, curated in the slightest details, almost as if to act as a contrast and metaphor of the contradictions inherent in the story itself.Many are the events taken from the bible, but revisited in satirical terms, such as man's creation, baptism, crucifixion, and resurrection. Choosing to use actors in flesh and bones, rather than other techniques such as animation, lies in the fact that we wanted to represent what has always been painted as divine in a totally earthly way, close to us and to the idea of ordinary men. WHY WE DO IT :God Prefer Atheists is a metaphor intended to represent the abuse of power and the manipulation of the masses perpetrated over the centuries by the Church. The purpose of this project is not to offend the above-mentioned institution, but simply to bring it to a more earthy level showing how, in the end, they are just the sordidness of the single human beings to compromise and contaminate the values at the base of the institution itself and the messages that they convey. The idea that inspired us in writing this series is the common vision of how the Church has been created and how it has been managed more as a true business than as a form of faith and love. The end of the story, moreover, provides an important point of reflection regarding the approach with the superiority intrinsic in the concept of God himself to whom men must constantly look at in order to find the final Salvation. The confession of God and his consequent resignation show that in order to reach a more meaningful truth and a deeper sense of life, it is necessary to examine one’s conscience and question it with utmost honesty. The answers that every human being seeks cannot come from the outside nor from above and can not be imposed by others - as the Church suggests - but they can only be sought and found in the depths of each human soul. CHARACTERS : GOD God is the main character of the serie.The narrative timeline spans from the events starting with his divorce, passing through the creation of the humans, the beginning of the Church until finally reaching his examination of conscience that will lead to a deep repentance and his resignations.His profile corresponds to an eccentric intergalactic billionaire entrepreneur, fond lover of laziness and beer with very weak interpersonal skills. God sees himself like a self-made man; he is particularly proud of his achievements and success as well as very jealous of his own spaces, freedom and omnipotency. Not much incline to relationships compromises, he pleasantly avoids any kind of emotional responsibility that may arise.The only other living being he has a real connection with and to whom allows entering his “comfort zone” is Holy Spirit -his cat-, who’s very independent and therefore easily manageable. He is also the only creature God shows feeling some kindness towards.At the time of the story, God’s biggest issue is his only -and unwanted- son Jesus, who happens to live a very depressing life failing to keep up with his father’s big expectations. His ex wife’s Sathàna tricked him during the divorce agreement and he ends up with the sole custody of the 6 years old boy.In fact, by getting rid of his wife, God hopes to be able to resume his old habits represented by cold beers on the sofa and lazy afternoons spent with his cat, instead he finds himself with the burden of growing up a very introverted son with whom he has never really built up a relationship. Being his only heir, however, God hopes that, through his own example, the son can become like him and turn into a strong and successful man. Unfortunately, God’s expectations are denied by the facts showing Jesus as incapable of socializing and integrating, extremely sensitive, absolutely devoid of paternal countenance and of any kind of charism.During the course of the events we witness an escalation of loss of control by God caused by a growing frustration over the attitude and behaviour of his son.Finally, God decides to invest in the growing organization created by the humans and called “Church” by paying the apostles to promote his name and persuade the humans to adore him with the triple purpose of nourishing his vanity, gaining incredible amounts of money and getting revenge on his ex-wife by infesting the Earth with fanatics.HOLY SPIRIT Narrator’s voice and God’s cat, besides being his favorite creature in the whole Universe.He is the silent companion of God’s daily routine because he is the only one able to provide him with some good vibes. He shows no affection to anyone other than God and he has very little sympathy for Jesus as he empathizes with his owner’s conflict with his son. Holy Spirit also represents the heavy hand of God; in fact, whenever Jesus exceeds the limit, God sends Holy Spirit to Earth as a warning to his conduct. He will be the only one in charge of God's inheritance.JESUS Jesus is the fruit of the failed marriage between God and Sathàna.He is an introverted baby, extremely sensitive and naive. Traumatized by a cold and absent mother and a father distracted by his own omnipotence, Jesus grows up in a silent, emotionally arid and devoid of sociality environment. At an early age he discovers his passion for percussion and, with his drumsticks, spends most of his time clanking on any surface that he can find, caught in an attempt to become the greatest drummer in the whole universe and to obviate the inner and external silent that scares him. The only people who have ever proven to be affectionate to Jesus are God’s housekeeper Mary and her sweetheart, Joseph -God’s gardener- so sorry to see a child so isolated and ignored. Besides the affection of his father's employees, the only beings Jesus falls madly in love with are the humans, created by God in order to distract him from his obsession for percussions. Despite, humans will mistreat Jesus and take advantage of him, he will always keep perceiving them as his only true friends.He is the only character in the series that goes through a metamorphosis: in fact, we see him 6 years old in the first episode, adult in the second, third, fourth and sixths during his permanence on Earth where from being an introverted and lonely kid he turns into a hippie party animal with a solid social life full of friends and followers and, finally, reincarnated in Kurt Cobain in the seventh episode when, thanks to his father’s pettiness, he has to face again the impossibility of realizing his true real nature.He will commit suicide in on onrush of sadness and envy after seeing the reflection of Dave Grohl in the mirror, leaving just a letter full of grief to his father.Jesus is the true victim of the story and represents the scapegoat on which everyone projects his own faults and frustrations.SATHÀNA - GOD’S WIFE Sathàna is God’s wife. Capricious, spoiled and annoying, she represents what the Church has always identified in the Devil. She is a petty woman who has taken advantage of him trying to make the most out of their divorce. After a troubled matrimony, the woman’s only desire is to start over a new life and get rid of her so hard to handle and complex son Jesus. Through a trick she manages to ensure Jesus under God’s sole custody and obtain the property of the whole planet Earth, her favorite holiday resort. God has always hated the Earth as it was the place where he was obliged to spend all his holidays. However, well aware of the affective value that the planet represents for his wife, it turns into a good starting point for revenge and that’s the reason why he will infest it with humans.ADAM & EVE Adam & Eve are the first humans created by God in the desperate attempt to distract and entertain his son Jesus.Being created in God’s image and likeness -drunk in addiction- they embody all his worsts sides. Therefore, Adam and Eve are two stubborn insolents with no respect at all who do not recognize anyone's authority including God himself, thereby triggering his anger.They spend their time sunbathing, drinking cocktails, and lazing around without denying to subjugate Jesus to any of their requests and to use him to provoke God's wrath and continually challenge his omnipotence, as in the apple episode.As a result of their disobedience they will be exiled to Earth.JOSEPH & MARY Joseph & Mary appear in the first episode respectively as the gardener of God’s home with the passion for fishing and Jesus’s nanny and God's housekeeper.They both present a docile, obedient and obliging character.They feel such an extreme pity and affection for Jesus as a child that they will be the chosen ones to go with him to Earth as his fictitious parents.Joseph will go through difficult times when he will finally realize to be obliged to grow up the son of someone else and, after meeting with the Three Wise Men on the night of Jesus' birth and having received a good amount of hallucinogenic substances, he will get lost in the desert leaving Mary by herself with the child.Henceforth we will no longer see Mary expect for a few frames at the time of Jesus’s crucifixion when she cries her son by the foot of the cross.PETER Peter is the alter ego of Jesus and is the devout servant of God.An all-round obedient and ambitious but with zero personality and subjugated by power.God is proud of his adoration and for this he entrusts him with His personal and important tasks, certain of his total fidelity. Peter heavily envy Jesus because he would like it to be him the designated heir instead of a useless child unable to bring forth the possibilities being offered. Following all the troubles caused by Jesus on Earth, Peter is sent there as an infiltrator among the 12 disciples in order to reaffirm God's authority.In order to be more in control of the situation he then becomes Jesus' confidant and gains his trust. In fact, as soon as Jesus dies, Pietro inherits the role of leader of the 12 apostles. Peter will then become the first Pope of the Church and vice God that will continue serving him faithfully until the day of his resignation.MARY MAGDALENE Mary Magdalene is the daughter of the High State Official Pontius Pilate and one and only love of Jesus. She is an absent-minded girl who essentially wants to have fun and aims at who offers her more.Despite her father cannot stand all the boys buzzing around her, especially that longhair hippie of Jesus, Mary Magdalene keeps taking advantage of him, and, after the resurrection, she convinces him to take her to God’s place. Once living at the Mansion, when Jesus shows the first signs of post-Earth depression, she is be the first trying to dissuade him from the idea of returning there but with no success. Finally, having obtained immortality by God, she quits Jesus at the very last minute as she prefers going hitchhiking throughout the Universe.JUDAS Judas is one of Jesus disciples and his fellow drinking buddy. We meet him for the first time during a rave in Palestine and then we see him again during the last supper when we find out he is secretly having an affair with Mary Magdalene. After leaving Jesus completely wasted at the tavern, he bumps into two of Pontius Pilate's guards while he’s going back home with Mary Madgalene. The guards mistaken him for Jesus and want to bring him in to Pilate in order to have him executed. Terrorized, Judas, in order to save himself, reveals to the guards where to find Jesus of Nazareth.SUPPORTING CHARACTERS KING HEROD A ruthless king who cannot have heirs. He commands the murder of all male babies of his kingdom, in the grip of one of his tyrannical sprints.THREE WISE MEN Three hipsters freaks in search of lysergic experiences in the desert.While in hallucinogenic delirium they find Giuseppe, who smokes and moans outside the stable where Jesus was born. They are really moved by the state of the poor man and will share with him part of their drug stockpile.JOHN THE BAPTIST John the Baptist is a regular raver. He appears in the 2nd episode during a party in Palestine where he meets Jesus in delirious conditions. Moved by compassion, he tries to help him recover by repeatedly soaking him in sea water.12 DISCIPLES (future Catholic Church preachers) Considered by Jesus as his family, the 12 are lost souls without a home or a job, who find in Jesus a sustenance because of his wealth and the miracles he performs. After Jesus death by crucifixion, they find themselves with no money therefore are easily bought by Peter and God and will agree to promote the doctrine of the Catholic Church in exchange for a high monthly salary and material goods (wealth).PONTIUS PILATE Pontius Pilate is a High State Official, n love with his uniform and the power that it gives him. Extremely jealous of his daughter, he hates all the guys around her, especially the hippie hiccups like Jesus. He loves to establish his authority and therefore punishes Jesus to death, who has repeatedly challenged him by falling in love with her daughter. THE STORY EPISODE 1 - MATRIMONY The episode opens on God’s office where, in the presence of his wife, he is signing the divorce papers. The scene is seen from the perspective of the Holy Spirit -God’s cat- who enters the room and walks towards God’s feet where it starts rubbing on. Once convinced to be finally free from his annoying ex wife, God realizes that he had not paid enough attention to the terms of the divorce clauses and, not only his wife has obtained the total property of the planet Earth, but he is also finding himself stuck with the sole custody of his son Jesus obsessed by one and only dream: becoming a drummer. Without any desire to be a Father, God finds himself drunk during his first face to face dinner with his son. God is puzzled by the child’s behavior and does not understand why he is so introverted, and asocial and he feels already exasperated by Jesus’ obsession for percussions. In the grip of desperation and extreme drunkenness, he tries a way out to distract Jesus from drums by creating some creatures with some random materials found in the kitchen.The very next day he releases humans in his garden -also called Eden- which is full of beautiful fruit trees and has a huge swimming pool in it. Once in the garden, God warns the humans about the terrible punishments they will face should they eat from the Apple Tree of the Knowledge of the Good and the Evil - which is his sole solemn property- and introduces them to his son. Jesus is ecstatic and begins showing clear signs of improvement by socializing and playing with Adam & Eve. Actually, the latter are two extremely hedonistic people with no respect at all for authority and in practice they just use Jesus to mock him or force him in doing all the forbidden and funny things. Pretty soon, through a trick, Eve convinces Jesus to take an apple from his father's forbidden tree. Right after, Peter runs to God in order to report the fact. God goes mad and immediately convenes his son together with Adam and Eve in his office. Once in the presence of God, the two humans blame Jesus without even giving him the possibility to speak or defend himself. Suspicious about Adam and Eve’s behavior, God asks for the consultation of a special witness: the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil. Following the revelations made by the Tree, he establishes to exile humans on Earth with the dual purpose of punishing them and bothering the ex-wife. Jesus is super saddened by humans departure. In fact, even though they have betrayed him, he still considers them as the only friends he has ever had so he starts begging his father to bring them back. After many negations from God, Jesus escapes running in the garden in search of his nanny Mary. She is in the stable with Joseph, the gardener, where Jesus enters in tears interrupting one of the rare moments of love effusions they got the chance to exchange during working shifts. Joseph is super pissed off but Mary can not deny comfort to this little lonely child. The scene ends with a nativity scenery showing a donkey, Joseph, Mary and Jesus crying inside the manger full of hay. EPISODE 2 - BAPTISM Following the dramatic scenes of Jesus and his constant requests to rejoin him to his beloved humans, God sends him to be reborn on Earth where humans are already populating the planet, also sending Mary and Joseph in the shoes of his fictitious parents. Meanwhile on Earth, King Herod, embittered by his inability to generate heirs, decides to deprive anyone else of this possibility by having all the male children of the Judaea kingdom killed and also obliging the just arrived Mary and Joseph to escape in the middle of the desert, where Jesus is reborn. Meantime, the Three Wise Men -who are wandering in the desert on their camels in search of lysergic experiences- arrive to the hut where Joseph and Mary are hiding. They are about to knock on the door when they hear someone heavily complaining about the clear worsening of his working conditions. Crouched they move closer and they find Joseph wallowing in self pity and full of rage as he does not look kindly upon the possibility of risking his own life, being forced to live in a constant escape and raising a son that is not his without even getting a salary increase from God. Opium, Mescaline, Hallucinogens are the gifts that the Three Wise Men leave to the poor Joseph moved by his desperation.That same night Joseph swallows all of the substances received by the Three Wise Men and walks into the desert vanishing without a trace. In the next scene we see a 25-year-old Jesus. We find him at a rave party in a beach in Palestine with some of his friends: it is obvious that he has exaggerated so John the Baptist soaks him many times in sea water in order to have him recovered. Meanwhile, Jesus is screaming disconnected sentences, self-proclaiming himself as the son of God, invoking the Holy Spirit and promising eternal life and paranormal powers to anyone who would follow him. Many begin kneeling at his feet. EPISODE 3 - CONFIRMATION The scene opens on God sitting in his office. He has had Peter called in order to get some explanations concerning what is happening on Earth. His right hand man reports the situation to him: Jesus keeps screwing it up and is breaking all the rules God imposed to him such as not to reveal his true identity, maintaining a low profile, and for nothing in the world mentioning the name of God. On the other hand, however, many humans begin to believe every word Jesus says and are starting to associate in order to idolize him. Caught up in vanity and pride, God decides to send Peter on Earth to better observe this new movement and to deliver an important message to his son: he must go to rehab to detoxify himself or else he will be sent right back home. Once in the rehab center, Jesus is obliged to attend group therapy. Here is where he meets some of his future apostles and Mary Magdalene, whom he deeply falls in love with. Jesus establishes a relationship of friendship and complicity with his new fellows which is so deep and strong that they all design a plan to escape together. Once left the rehab, they go immediately back to their old habits. As soon as the Father gets to know of Jesus’ breakout and conduct, God orders to Peter to infiltrate into his son’s group of adepts in order to study the situation from within. Therefore, Peter goes to Earth accompanied by Holy Spirit and the two of them appear at one of the party organized by Jesus. Peter knocks at the door, a disciple opens and, in the middle of a super chaotic situation the cat is passed by one apostle to the other until finally ending in Jesus’s arms. At this point Holy Spirit stares at him, heavily hisses and and meows right to his face in order to remind him who is the one and only solemn master of the Universe: his Father. Closing on the frightened expression of Jesus who has too well understood the message that God sent him. EPISODE 4 - EUCHARIST The scene opens on Jesus throwing little stones on Mary Magdalene’s window to invite her to the trattoria for a supper. Unluckily, when the window opens, an enraged Pontius Pilate comes out commanding Jesus to leave his daughter in peace once and for all, and never try to approach her any more or else he will have him crucified. Meanwhile, the apostles are impatient at the tavern waiting for Jesus to come. He arrives alone, out of breath and saddened by the discussion with Mary Magdalene's father. After a couple of hours Jesus -well drunk already- is ecstatic as, at last, he feels accepted and at home with the apostles who represent his closest friends of his everyday life and revelry. Usual situation of chaos and delirium during which Jesus is yelling random stuff around. Suddenly a figure with covered face comes in and approaches the table, revealing Mary Magdalene that managed to escape from her father’s control. Jesus is super happy to see her until he notices something going on between her and Judas. In the grip of alcohol, he starts screaming “I’ll tell you the truth, one of you will betray me." Apostles laugh at him. He keeps screaming “Truly I tell you, this very night, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.” After all of his drunks fellas left, Jesus remains alone at the trattoria where the host tries to kick him out. Meanwhile Judah, who sneaked off with Mary Magdalene through the back door, runs into two of Pontius Pilate's guards. Mistaking Judah for Jesus, the guards want to bring him in Pontius Pilate’s presence to have him sentenced. Judas is terrorized and, in order to exculpate himself, reveals to the guards where to find Jesus. The guards enter the tavern and arrest him. Once Jesus is in chain in front of Pontius Pilates, this latter condemns his to death as previously promised. While together, Pontius vents his hate on Jesus; in fact he can not bear that a spineless hippie like him might have so many adoring followers just by saying of being the son of a phantasmal Universe tycoon while Pontius has had to earn the esteem and respect of the citizens only after many years of service to the State. Also, he makes cruelly fun of Jesus by turning the knife in the wound and waving his daughter's perpetual infidelity. Jesus is desperate and sobs no stop: "It's not right, I do no harm to anyone, it is not my fault!”. While moving toward his washbasin, Pontius Pilate replies: “Stop being a sissy.!I wash my hands of this and if you truly are who you brag to be, let’s see how your mighty and powerful father God will react. “ Closing on split screens of both Pontius Pilate and God washing their hands. EPISODE 5 - HOLY ORDERS The scene opens on Mary weeping at the foot of the cross. Right after, we see the 12 disciples on munchies at the kebab shop. A villager comes in and tells them all about the sad facts happened to Jesus. The disciples react in a somewhat indifferent and confused way, as they are still lethargic after the previous night out at the tavern. They then make a toast to their friend, especially regretting not being able to enjoy his money and to take advantage of him anymore. Meanwhile, God observes his son’s crucifixion thanks to Peter's live broadcast to his private TV. Peter stands a few meters from the cross and meticulously describes the situation to God, who shakes his head in disappointment for this son unable to live without looking for troubles. Furthermore, through his cheap magic tricks, he belittled his power and infamously sullied his name for which reason God decides to let Jesus stew in his own juice. Subsequently, God instructs Peter to go to Earth and become the leader of this growing movement -called Church- in order to redeem God’s image, extend his dominion over the inhabitants of the planet and seize the umpteenth chance to piss his ex wife off infesting her new home with worshiping fanatics. Therefore, Peter gathers the 12 disciples together and proposes to them to work for God preaching his name and his law in exchange of a monthly high fixed salary. The apostles fall from the sky and totally confused ask Peter what exactly they should be preaching, since they’ve always been just partying with Jesus and they have never experienced deep conversations. Peter brainwashes them by handing them a copy of the Lord of the Rings and urging them to read it all and believe to every single word without questioning or asking questions. [TO BILLBOARD] THE UNQUESTIONABLE PROOF THAT J.R. TOLKIEN WAS THE ONLY ONE TO BE ABLE TO INTERPRET CORRECTLY THE ORIGINAL VERSION OF THE BIBLE. EPISODE 6 - ANOINTING OF THE SICK The episode begins with Jesus that, after his death and resurrection, has been taken back into his Father’s house. We see him standing by his bedroom’s window, staring off into space (the void) while listening to the song Creep by Radiohead on a loop. As the song plays he experiences flashbacks of the happiest moments spent on Earth with his 12 disciples. Suddenly, we start hearing heavy footsteps in the background. Right after, the door opens violently and God comes in roaring like a lion and cursing against his son. After yelling at Jesus, God exits the room slamming the door behind him and goes down to the kitchen in order to have breakfast. Here, he bumps into Mary Magdalene and they have a brief conversation about Jesus in which he asks for clarification about his son’s state of mind. Mary Magdalene, then, asks what exactly is the Church. God explains that it’s the tool through which he perpetually gets richer thanks to the royalties on his own name which is already become an unbeatable global brand. While Mary Magdalene is having breakfast, God makes himself a mojito and goes out in the garden to smoke his cigar. He then calls Peter and when he arrives he asks him for an opinion about the new business of the Church. Peter presents him with a business plan, explaining all of his goals for the upcoming centuries and proposing himself as the head of the Church and God's deputy as well as his eyes on Earth. At this point God nominates him first Pope. Peter is ecstatic and before leaving, he suddenly remembers having something to show him. He pulls out a gigantic book -the Bible- from his purse and gives it to God explaining that humans have written his story completely overcoming events and adding details that have never occurred. God is shocked and asks for the book reading a few lines. They both end up laughing-out-loud. Subsequently the scene moves in Jesus’s bedroom where is listening depressing music with Mary Magdalene who in a mocking tone asks him why with all his super powers he still needs his Father permission to go back to Earth. Jesus sorrowfully answers he can only appear in the form of a ghost into someone’s dream but he’s not able to go physically back on the Planet. In the next scene we are back on Earth where Judah, in his bedroom, is having a nightmare. He suddenly wakes up and finds Jesus barefoot by the window wearing a white tunic and staring off into space as usual. A brief confrontation between the two follows and this is the only time when Jesus, destroyed and in rage because of the double betray of his friend, shows a bit of character. Judas however, realizes pretty soon it’s only a ghost when Jesus fails to punch him in the face passing him through. Judas bursts into a loud laughter and Jesus is once again defeated. Meanwhile, Mary Magdalene snitches on Jesus with God about the getaways of Jesus to Earth and his random apparitions to the disciples. God cannot take it anymore and decides to send Holy Spirit to Earth to pick his son up. So the cat goes to Earth and finds Jesus in a state of deep shock outside the window of some of his former disciples now turned into brainwashed smoke preachers. In the final scene we are back to God’s Mansion while the Father is scolding Jesus and imposes him an ultimatum commanding him to be careful this time as there won’t be a second resurrection. Right after, Peter comes in and passes a note to Jesus. He opens it and finds a message from Mary Magdalene who explains that she is breaking up with him because she had obtained immortality from God and she wants to go traveling throughout the whole Universe. Before leaving his father, Jesus asks where he would end up in case he should die. God looked at him vaguely with a resigned expression and walks away. We close on Jesus back on Earth this time reincarnated in Kurt Cobain. EPISODE 7 - PENANCE & RECONCILIATION [CONFESSION] The scene opens on Earth in Kurt Cobain’s bathroom where Jesus/Kurt is all curled up writing a letter in order to give vent to his depression. A few extracts of the letter are shown. As soon as he has finished writing, Jesus gets up and slowly approaches the sink in order to brush his teeth. He finds drumsticks in the glass together with the toothbrush. Then, while brushing his teeth, he looks into the mirror and sees Dave Grohl's reflection brushing his teeth with a drumstick and looking at him with a grungy grin. This represents for Jesus the straw that breaks the camel’s back of his dissatisfaction and unhappiness. After having spent his childhood begging his father to get him the drums in order to become the greatest drummer in the universe -his recurring dream- and after having convinced him to send him back to his beloved Earth, he finds himself tricked again by his father that had him reincarnated in one of the greatest singers of his century. Once his brain pictures the image of Dave Grohl in the mirror -Nirvana’s drummer and future frontman of the Foo Fighters- Jesus will see a flashback running through a lifetime of failure. Tired of having to fight constantly, he closes his eyes... SUICIDE - black screen, background sound of gunshot. In the next scene we are back to God’s Mansion. God is in his room, in front of the mirror, in a state of complete shock: he has Jesus/Kurt’s suicide letter in one of his hand and he is aware of having to deal with a hard mea culpa.Long monologue of God who finally realizes how all the bad things happened until that moment have been caused by his intolerant and boastful attitude and defects. While God is experiencing a severe examination of his conscience, flashbacks of all the suffering he caused are shown. Subsequently, the scene moves to God Mansion’s Garden. It’s a splendid sunny day, all the characters are there, standing still while God passes through the garden with a six pack of beer in his left hand and a wicker bag from which a huge beach umbrella and some philosophy books appear. At this point, touched and prideful, God looks at his employees for the very last time and says goodbye to all of them. In the meantime, Peter enters the scene running out of breath. As soon as he sees his Boss he understands the situation and starts begging him to remain, while God is opening his beach umbrella. Before taking flight God turns to Peter and, by using the most seraphic tone, he reassures him that everything will remain the same and he will not have to worry as the office and his own position have been already taken in charge by the most competent one. Peter looks at him with an astounded expression as he can not imagine anyone more competent than himself. God begins his Mary Poppins style ascent by using the beach umbrella and throws a last glance at Peter yelling: “PETER... GET A DAMN LIFE!” Peter starts running towards God’s office: once arrived, he opens the door straight and finds Holy Spirit on his owner’s desk with a couple of cats guarding the room. The scene closes on a big close up of Holy Spirit that meows while yawning. THE END  APPENDIX SOMETIME LATER The scene opens on God pouring some beers behind the counter of a beach hut.On the other side of the counter two young atheists are seated. They criticize the Catholic Church and question the existence of God. Then, they turn to him in order to ask if their opinions are disappointing him.Solemnly God looks at them in silence, then he raises his beer mug to the sky and proclaims seraphic: -“Who me? I prefer atheists!”-Everyone bursts out laughing loud while rising up and toasting the glasses.Closing on God that - with a voice broken from laughing - says : -“Next round is on me!”-  WHAT YOU ARE CONTRIBUTING FOR :This campaign is aimed to raise 15,000 $ in order to fund the production of the pilot episode for our web serie God Prefers Atheists.All the actors except the main character (God) will star friends of us and people from our circle of connections. Enrico's background in film will help in this as he already has a crew who he's been working with for many years and that will deliver the best work possible. We will mostly need funds to build up a budget for locations, transportation and logistic, scenography and stage design, costume design and make-up, editing and post-production.We will be constantly updating the campaign informing on each single expense we will face in order to be as much straight forward as possible. We estimated a budget of 15,000 euros on top of the 3,000 euros personal funds we already have on a side for the project, resulting in a final total budget of 18,000 euros.Our final aim is to produce a professional high-end pilot in order to then find a TV channel or a production company interested in financing the rest of the episodes of the first season (6).We also do have in mind the idea to create a follow up second season in the future.Our crew for the filming will consist of:1 Director1 AD and script supervisor2 Cinematographers1 Editor1 Graphic artist1 Post production and colourist designer1 Costume designer1 Key make-up artist 1 Production designer1 Production sound mixer1 Boom operator (sound grip) 1 Music composer OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPEven if you can’t give any money, we absolutely value your contribution!Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by emailing it, harassing your family members, talking to your friends about it, sharing on social media.More about the project in our Facebook & Instagram pages.

story:
SINOPSIS [ES]

Una chica depresiva empieza a escribir pensamientos suicidas en un blog, está en contacto con Leo K. Un hombre que la convence de curarla, creando así un vínculo estrecho con ella y convenciéndola de ir hacia él. Lo que no se espera Leslie, es que lo que al principio parecía su salvación termina por ser la peor de sus decisiones.

 

SYNOPSIS [EN]

Leslie, a depressive girl, starts to write her suicidal thoughts in a blog. She’s in contact with Leo K., a man who convinces her to cure her illness, creating a strong bond with him and making her to go to him. Little she knew, that what seemed to be at first her salvation, would become the worst of her decisions.

 

CREW

COMPLETE CREW

Lo que no se espera Leslie, es que lo que al principio parecía su salvación termina por ser la peor de sus decisiones. SYNOPSIS [EN]Leslie, a depressive girl, starts to write her suicidal thoughts in a blog. She’s in contact with Leo K., a man who convinces her to cure her illness, creating a strong bond with him and making her to go to him. Little she knew, that what seemed to be at first her salvation, would become the worst of her decisions. CREWCOMPLETE CREW

story:
BUD'S 

Bud's is a series that is currently self funded by the creator and producer. We are looking for outside investors to help bring this project to life and you can earn some dope perks in the process.

Anything you provide will go towards props, wardrobe, set pieces, and feeding the cast and crew on set. 

Anything you can contribute will help, but if you cannot afford to support our project, please share this campaign, and also follow us on social media @budstvofficial for series updates.

story: The webseries is an anthology of 8 different short stories based on the different types of love (Affectionate, enduring, familiar, romantic, playful, obsessive, self and selfless) portrayed in different time lines. The series involves shooting in rural India to cities and the time lines covered from early 80s to present times. We are content producers in YouTube (Chitralahari Productions). We are growing independent film production house who are a team of young, passionate cinema lovers in need of support. The series will be made in regional Indian language with Intresting writing but will be made available to international audience's . The production assures the investors that every penny will be utilized for the content production.
