story:
Research into Mold Contamination in Homes 

Studies have shown that up to 25% of the population might develop a hypersensitive to mold. However many don't realize anyone can have adverse reactions to buildings with high levels of mold contamination. Research has shown that water damaged buildings often cause major impacts to health and well being. What isn't always so clear -- is how to return a contaminated building to a normal safe, healthful and nurturing environment. Currently the conventional wisdom is that hard surfaced items with settled spores or fungal fragments can easily be cleaned. But many questions remain. 

 

Author & Researcher - John C. Banta

Certified Industrial Hygienist and Author John Banta has worked professionally for the last 30 years investigating indoor environmental quality problems in homes and work environments. His first book Prescriptions for a Healthy House: A Practical Guide for Architects, Builders and Homeowners was co-authored with Architect Paula Baker-LaPorte and MD Erica Elliott and is now in its third edition. John is currently working on a new book --Mold Controlled: A Practical Guide to Find, Avoid, and Fix Mold Problems in Water Damaged Homes.  The book is aimed at demystifying mold problems and how to return mold contaminated housing to the nurturing healthful environments we should have as home.

The Research

The funds raised by this campaign will support science based research to answer a number of important remaining issues: 

  • Can soft furnishings be effectively cleaned to remove mold spores, fungal fragments, and mycotoxins (toxins produced by mold)?
  • Which cleaning methods are effective, and which are not?
  • When should a contaminated mattress, sofa or other upholstered furnishing be discarded?
  • Are barrier covers such as those for dust mites effective in preventing re-contamination? 
  • Can barrier covers be used to provide protection when used on an already contaminated mattress?

In 2012 the Journal of Asthma, 49:139–143 Published a study: "Daily Vacuuming of Mattresses Significantly Reduces House Dust Mite Allergens, Bacterial Endotoxin, and Fungal β-Glucan." This study concluded "Daily vacuuming of mattresses significantly decreased levels of house dust mite allergens, endotoxin, and Fungal β-glucan. This method offers sensitized patients a cheaper option to reduce their exposure to bio-contaminants in their bed."

There are a number of questions that were not answered by the study:

  • Fungal β-glucan is found in the cell wall of molds. It is not specific to molds associated with water damage. Your contribution to this crowd-funding venture would be used to test for water damage associated molds using mold specific DNA (MSQPCR).
  • The study tested mattresses were HEPA vacuumed daily at a rate of one minute per square meter for eight weeks. At the end of the eight weeks the daily vacuuming had reduced the levels of dust mites, endotoxins and fungal glucans by approximately 85%. The study supported by your contribution would help answer the mold question using MSQPCR.
  • After the daily vacuuming was stopped the mattresses continued being monitored. Six weeks later the levels of allergenic dusts had returned to the pre-study levels. The contributions from this crowd-funding venture would be used to attempt to determine if levels climbed because high levels of the contaminated dust remained in the home and re-infested the mattress or if contaminants were buried deep in the mattress and re-worked their way to the surface.

It is estimated $1,650 of funds raised by this campaign would pay for laboratory analysis for one round of testing on one mattress.

Use of Extra Funds if the Project is Over-Funded

If this project is over-funded the extra contributions from this crowd-funding venture would be used for replicate studies, additional research and book production costs as follows:

  • The original study did not address mycotoxins. Is HEPA vacuuming effective in removing mycotoxins from contaminated fabrics, mattresses and upholstered furnishings?
  • If HEPA vacuuming is not effective for mattresses and upholstered furnishings, are there other effective methods that can be used?
  • If preliminary studies show that mold contaminated porous furnishings can be successfully restored, the studies will need to be replicated enough times to be sure that the results are real and not a fluke!
  • It is easy to decide what to do with gypsum walls that have visible growth, but how much extra material should be removed and discarded beyond the visible growth to be sure that actual growth has been eliminated?
  • Production costs for the book could include professional editing, illustrations, salaries, layout and design.

What We Need & What You Get

The MSQPCR panel used is known as ERMI. It measures the quantities of DNA identified for thirty-six specific genotypes of molds. Laboratory charges for the ERMI panel is $300 per sample. Predominant molds can be analysed as a panel for $150 for a panel of any five of the identified molds. 

Study One (We met our funding goal for Phase 1 of this study. The results have been posted on the secure Contributor Login section of my website)

The first study replicated the eight week mattress study using MSQPCR to identify the molds found in dust that can be vacuumed from the surface. The dust will be collected before cleaning begins and at two week intervals for the eight weeks of the study. The pre-study sample and the sample collected at the eighth week were analysed using the full ERMI panel. Samples collected at week 2, 4 and 6 were analysed for the most predominant water damage related species identified at the beginning of the study. After the eight weeks of vacuuming the mattress had core samples collected at depths of two, four, six, and eight inches for analysis of the predominant water damage related species deep in the cleaned mattress.

Study Two (Part one of the barrier cloth study has been funded and completed and posted in the Contributor Login section of my website, additional funds are needed for phase 2 which will repeat the study with barrier cloths that have been laundered)

This second study was able to capitalize on the first study since the mold contamination types and quantities were already determined by the pre-study MSQPCR sample. The effectiveness of multiple types of barrier cloths was be tested by placing the barrier on the contaminated mattress and determining the types and quantities of molds that were able to be vacuumed through the barrier cloth. The dust that was vacuumed through the barrier was be analysed using the same MSQPCR analysis used by the pre-study samples. The results showed that Dust Mite Barriers also help reduce mold contamination - but one type was superior to all the rest!

Study Three (If this campaign is over-funded)

The third study would be performed based on available funds and the identification of potential mycotoxin producing organisms in the mattresses. This third study will be able to capitalize on the first study since the mold contamination types and quantities will have already been determined by the pre-study MSQPCR sample. In those cases where one or more organisms that are capable of producing a target mycotoxins is present the actual level of mycotoxins present in the mattress would then be determined prior to and after an interval of HEPA vacuuming. Each mycotoxin test is $300 per sample. In addition to determining if mycotoxins could be removed from a mattress, layer testing would be used to determine the penetration of mycotoxins within the mattress. This study is currently on hold - until we find a mattress contaminated with mycotoxins that can be used.

Additional Studies May Be Suggested by the Results of the First Studies (If this campaign is over-funded)

Information about additional studies are posted in the Updates section of this site.

Research projects almost always result in additional questions. If the campaign is over-funded these additional studies can also be performed.

What You Get

Every contributor of $25 or more will be a part of our inner circle. This means you will be sent research updates that will  keep you informed about the research findings as they become available. You will also have access to the Mold Controlled book chapters as they are produced. You won't have to wait for formal publication to receive the information. 

This will help insure you have access to the most up-to-date mold remediation information available. You will continue to have on-line access to the book in draft form until your copy of the e-book is published and emailed to you. 

 

The Impact

Previous studies have left many unanswered questions about whether cleaning porous contents such upholstered furnishings and mattresses can be effective. Some methods are likely to work better than others and some measures may only be temporary. It is important for mold sensitive persons to know what methods of cleaning are effective and what methods are not. This will help people determine reasonable expectations for what can be achieved. In a number of cases people have discarded and replaced contaminated items, only to have the contamination reappear in brand new furnishings. Knowing which temporary measures are effective, such as barrier cloths will also help establish a temporary safe environment while decisions are made regarding remediation or relocation.

 

Risks & Challenges

Submission for Publication in a Peer Reviewed Journal

Most peer reviewed publications do not permit prior publication. As a contributor, you will be a part of the inner circle, so we will be able to keep you informed with progress updates as the studies move forward, but the formal publication of the book Mold Controlled will need to be delayed until after the research studies have been completed, peer reviewed and appeared in the selected journal(s). Journals typically do not want researchers to submit their findings to more than one publication at a time. Additional delays can occur whenever a journal rejects a submission and during the editing and peer review process. Further delays may occur when peer reviewers request additional information, reject content or request that submissions be rewritten. It is estimated this process could require two years before the published studies can be referenced in the book. As a contributor you will be provided an access code that you can use to review the draft chapters, and illustrations of the book as they are posted. Combined with routine research updates - this will help insure you have access to the most up-to-date mold remediation information available. You will continue to have on-line access to the book in draft form until your copy of the e-book is published and emailed to you.
story_txt:
Research into Mold Contamination in Homes 
Studies have shown that up to 25% of the population might develop a hypersensitive to mold. However many don't realize anyone can have adverse reactions to buildings with high levels of mold contamination. Research has shown that water damaged buildings often cause major impacts to health and well being. What isn't always so clear -- is how to return a contaminated building to a normal safe, healthful and nurturing environment. Currently the conventional wisdom is that hard surfaced items with settled spores or fungal fragments can easily be cleaned. But many questions remain. 
 

Author & Researcher - John C. Banta
Certified Industrial Hygienist and Author John Banta has worked professionally for the last 30 years investigating indoor environmental quality problems in homes and work environments. His first book Prescriptions for a Healthy House: A Practical Guide for Architects, Builders and Homeowners was co-authored with Architect Paula Baker-LaPorte and MD Erica Elliott and is now in its third edition. John is currently working on a new book --Mold Controlled: A Practical Guide to Find, Avoid, and Fix Mold Problems in Water Damaged Homes.  The book is aimed at demystifying mold problems and how to return mold contaminated housing to the nurturing healthful environments we should have as home.

The Research
The funds raised by this campaign will support science based research to answer a number of important remaining issues: 

Can soft furnishings be effectively cleaned to remove mold spores, fungal fragments, and mycotoxins (toxins produced by mold)?
Which cleaning methods are effective, and which are not?
When should a contaminated mattress, sofa or other upholstered furnishing be discarded?
Are barrier covers such as those for dust mites effective in preventing re-contamination? 
Can barrier covers be used to provide protection when used on an already contaminated mattress?

In 2012 the Journal of Asthma, 49:139–143 Published a study: "Daily Vacuuming of Mattresses Significantly Reduces House Dust Mite Allergens, Bacterial Endotoxin, and Fungal β-Glucan." This study concluded "Daily vacuuming of mattresses significantly decreased levels of house dust mite allergens, endotoxin, and Fungal β-glucan. This method offers sensitized patients a cheaper option to reduce their exposure to bio-contaminants in their bed."
There are a number of questions that were not answered by the study:

Fungal β-glucan is found in the cell wall of molds. It is not specific to molds associated with water damage. Your contribution to this crowd-funding venture would be used to test for water damage associated molds using mold specific DNA (MSQPCR).
The study tested mattresses were HEPA vacuumed daily at a rate of one minute per square meter for eight weeks. At the end of the eight weeks the daily vacuuming had reduced the levels of dust mites, endotoxins and fungal glucans by approximately 85%. The study supported by your contribution would help answer the mold question using MSQPCR.
After the daily vacuuming was stopped the mattresses continued being monitored. Six weeks later the levels of allergenic dusts had returned to the pre-study levels. The contributions from this crowd-funding venture would be used to attempt to determine if levels climbed because high levels of the contaminated dust remained in the home and re-infested the mattress or if contaminants were buried deep in the mattress and re-worked their way to the surface.

It is estimated $1,650 of funds raised by this campaign would pay for laboratory analysis for one round of testing on one mattress.

Use of Extra Funds if the Project is Over-Funded
If this project is over-funded the extra contributions from this crowd-funding venture would be used for replicate studies, additional research and book production costs as follows:

The original study did not address mycotoxins. Is HEPA vacuuming effective in removing mycotoxins from contaminated fabrics, mattresses and upholstered furnishings?
If HEPA vacuuming is not effective for mattresses and upholstered furnishings, are there other effective methods that can be used?
If preliminary studies show that mold contaminated porous furnishings can be successfully restored, the studies will need to be replicated enough times to be sure that the results are real and not a fluke!
It is easy to decide what to do with gypsum walls that have visible growth, but how much extra material should be removed and discarded beyond the visible growth to be sure that actual growth has been eliminated?
Production costs for the book could include professional editing, illustrations, salaries, layout and design.



What We Need & What You Get
The MSQPCR panel used is known as ERMI. It measures the quantities of DNA identified for thirty-six specific genotypes of molds. Laboratory charges for the ERMI panel is $300 per sample. Predominant molds can be analysed as a panel for $150 for a panel of any five of the identified molds. 
Study One (We met our funding goal for Phase 1 of this study. The results have been posted on the secure Contributor Login section of my website)
The first study replicated the eight week mattress study using MSQPCR to identify the molds found in dust that can be vacuumed from the surface. The dust will be collected before cleaning begins and at two week intervals for the eight weeks of the study. The pre-study sample and the sample collected at the eighth week were analysed using the full ERMI panel. Samples collected at week 2, 4 and 6 were analysed for the most predominant water damage related species identified at the beginning of the study. After the eight weeks of vacuuming the mattress had core samples collected at depths of two, four, six, and eight inches for analysis of the predominant water damage related species deep in the cleaned mattress.
Study Two (Part one of the barrier cloth study has been funded and completed and posted in the Contributor Login section of my website, additional funds are needed for phase 2 which will repeat the study with barrier cloths that have been laundered)
This second study was able to capitalize on the first study since the mold contamination types and quantities were already determined by the pre-study MSQPCR sample. The effectiveness of multiple types of barrier cloths was be tested by placing the barrier on the contaminated mattress and determining the types and quantities of molds that were able to be vacuumed through the barrier cloth. The dust that was vacuumed through the barrier was be analysed using the same MSQPCR analysis used by the pre-study samples. The results showed that Dust Mite Barriers also help reduce mold contamination - but one type was superior to all the rest!
Study Three (If this campaign is over-funded)
The third study would be performed based on available funds and the identification of potential mycotoxin producing organisms in the mattresses. This third study will be able to capitalize on the first study since the mold contamination types and quantities will have already been determined by the pre-study MSQPCR sample. In those cases where one or more organisms that are capable of producing a target mycotoxins is present the actual level of mycotoxins present in the mattress would then be determined prior to and after an interval of HEPA vacuuming. Each mycotoxin test is $300 per sample. In addition to determining if mycotoxins could be removed from a mattress, layer testing would be used to determine the penetration of mycotoxins within the mattress. This study is currently on hold - until we find a mattress contaminated with mycotoxins that can be used.
Additional Studies May Be Suggested by the Results of the First Studies (If this campaign is over-funded)
Information about additional studies are posted in the Updates section of this site.
Research projects almost always result in additional questions. If the campaign is over-funded these additional studies can also be performed.
What You Get
Every contributor of $25 or more will be a part of our inner circle. This means you will be sent research updates that will  keep you informed about the research findings as they become available. You will also have access to the Mold Controlled book chapters as they are produced. You won't have to wait for formal publication to receive the information. 
This will help insure you have access to the most up-to-date mold remediation information available. You will continue to have on-line access to the book in draft form until your copy of the e-book is published and emailed to you. 
 

The Impact
Previous studies have left many unanswered questions about whether cleaning porous contents such upholstered furnishings and mattresses can be effective. Some methods are likely to work better than others and some measures may only be temporary. It is important for mold sensitive persons to know what methods of cleaning are effective and what methods are not. This will help people determine reasonable expectations for what can be achieved. In a number of cases people have discarded and replaced contaminated items, only to have the contamination reappear in brand new furnishings. Knowing which temporary measures are effective, such as barrier cloths will also help establish a temporary safe environment while decisions are made regarding remediation or relocation.
 

Risks & Challenges
Submission for Publication in a Peer Reviewed Journal
Most peer reviewed publications do not permit prior publication. As a contributor, you will be a part of the inner circle, so we will be able to keep you informed with progress updates as the studies move forward, but the formal publication of the book Mold Controlled will need to be delayed until after the research studies have been completed, peer reviewed and appeared in the selected journal(s). Journals typically do not want researchers to submit their findings to more than one publication at a time. Additional delays can occur whenever a journal rejects a submission and during the editing and peer review process. Further delays may occur when peer reviewers request additional information, reject content or request that submissions be rewritten. It is estimated this process could require two years before the published studies can be referenced in the book. As a contributor you will be provided an access code that you can use to review the draft chapters, and illustrations of the book as they are posted. Combined with routine research updates - this will help insure you have access to the most up-to-date mold remediation information available. story:
Legality & Similar Concerns

Especially if you just watched the video in which I forgot to address some of the key risks, please follow the FAQ link where I answer some of the common questions that are coming in about legality, customs, and supporting this effort longterm.

FAQ: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/deliver-critically-needed-medications-to-lebanon/x/23449691#/faq

Background

In 2018, Lebanon was struck with a catastrophic economic collapse due to decades of corruption and mismanagement in their government. The value of their currency plunged and eventually it became nearly impossible to import goods from other places. It has reached the level of a major humanitarian crisis in 2021 in which Lebanese people cannot even find aspirin and children are sick and dying from easily treatable maladies.

This is a great article if you're interested in how the situation came about:  https://www.thenation.com/article/world/lebanon-financial-collapse/

I have always wanted to visit Lebanon. From childhood, when our closest family friend threw dinner parties with spreads of kibbeh, manaquish, and sublime Lebanese rice, with memories of his family and the intersection of cultures they came from, even to my adulthood when I tasted Lebanese wine and wondered, "how is this so beautiful?," visiting Lebanon has been a lifelong dream. And with my eyesight deteriorating rapidly, it is now or never.

Sadly, the economic situation has only worsened and the delta variant is tearing through the country. Cancellation seemed like the sensible course of action. I didn't mind seeing a country when it's not at its best, but I also didn't want to be a burden on it.

Inspiration

When I found out that one of my contacts in Beirut had been hospitalized with Covid, I began googling to find out what kind of care he would receive and what he might need. I came across articles and tweets of Lebanese showing how they stuffed their luggage full of critically needed items (e.g. https://observers.france24.com/en/middle-east/20210730-lebanon-medicine-shortage-expats-bring-home-medication) when returning to the country. I realized I could do the same and repurpose my trip for something less self-serving.

I am flying out of JFK on Wednesday with my bags full of medicines and personal care items. I have already spent about $3000 on OTC products and prescription medications shipped from a doctor (who is actually an angel) in California. I am working with the Osman family who've coordinated lists of needs from Ashraf Pharmacy in Beirut and from a pharmacist working with Doctors Without Borders in the Beqaa Valley to plan how best to use the remaining space. But some of these medications are very expensive: one is $15/pill and honestly I had no idea asthma inhalers were $400! So I'm asking your help in filling up my bags to save some lives.

We know it's not a longterm solution. But in the near term, I am a man with three suitcases, and there's no reason not to leverage this opportunity to ease some pain.

What We Need

It's pretty simple

  • I am raising $10,000 to subsidize the actual medications and personal care items
  • I need New York metro area doctors who can assist with prescriptions and procurement
  • Share with anyone in your network who can contribute

Risks

This isn't a low-risk endeavor, so I want to be candid about what some of the risks are and how we're managing them.

  • Theft: always a risk with luggage. The strategy here is to put the valuable medicines in my hand-carried bags and use the luggage for things of lower value. I think this will be effective, and the fact is that antacids, anti-diarrheals, ibuprofen, antifungal creams, etc. are low value to thieves.
  • Customs: I feel somewhat confident in this area since I'm going to be among a hundred plus people who've done a very similar thing. I'm also receiving practical advice now from experienced medicine mules and I even have a few tricks up my sleeves from when my family lived in Egypt (like placing menstruation products on the top) that used to work great at getting us through.
  • Transport: Ahmad Osman has volunteered to pick me up and get these items to the right people (as well as supporting me non-stop in planning for the last four days in spite of having just had surgery and being very busy--thank you!). He's already looking out for and preventing the dumb things that tourists like me can do coming out of an airport. 
  • Insufficient Prescriptions to Buy What's Needed: This is our biggest risk currently, but the management of it is not difficult in the sense that we can still buy more OTC items or work with our Medicins sans Frontieres pharmacist to find another channel.

Ultimately, if some portion is stolen or confiscated, the sheer quantity we're bringing will more than offset it.

Here's What You're Buying

This is a rapidly-evolving list but will give you a sense of what I'm taking. For the more expensive prescription drug items, our budget gets us around 10 courses of treatment for most. The OTC items have been purchased much larger bulk quantities to maximize luggage space.

  • Ibuprofen syrup (pediatric) x10
  • Azithromycin (pediatric) x5
  • antiemitic (adult) Domperidone or US equiv x5
  • antiemitic (pediatric) Domperidone or US equiv x5
  • antibacterial Cefixime (pediatric) x10
  • antibacterial Cefixime (adults) x5
  • Augmentin/amoxicillin (pediatric) x10
  • Augmentin/amoxicillin (adults) x5
  • Voltaren or US equiv x10
  • Ciprofloxacin (adult) x10
  • Topical corticosteroid cream x10
  • Topical antibacterial cream x10
  • antifungal (adult) Daktarin or US equiv (monistat) x10
  • antifungal (pediatric) Daktarin or other oral gel/oral cream can be used in infants x10
  • Probitiotic for pediatric with diarrahea x10
  • Relvar inhalers x10 (2 so far)
  • Ramipril 10mg x10
  • Moxonidine or US equiv
  • Clopidogrel 75mg x10 (have 360ct so far)
  • Metronidazole syrup or US equiv x10
  • Acetaminophen/Ibuprofen combo pain reliever (4x bulk bottles)
  • Multivitamin male x10 (or equiv in bulk bottles)
  • Multivitamin female x10 (or equiv in bulk bottles)
  • Multivitamin generic (or equiv in bulk bottles)
  • Multivitamin pediatric x10 (or equiv in bulk)
  • Omeprazole 20mg (x10)
  • Acetaminophen otc x3 bulk bottles
  • cough drops (adult or ped) x4 bulk pouches
  • First aid kits
  • Band aids
  • Sleep aids
  • Vitamid C
  • adult probiotic
  • anti-diarrheal otc
  • melatonin 5mg
  • vitamin d3 50mg
  • fish oil supplements
  • menstruation products
  • anti-allergy adult
  • anti-allergy pediatric
  • batteries
  • nutrition bars
  • high-protein snack
  • small individually wrapped sweet for kids

story:
The Co-op at 1st: 

A West Denver Food and Wellness Hub

The Co-op at 1st - Westside Rainbow

 

Welcome to your one stop shop to grow, reclaim and indulge in food, health, wellness and community wholeness. 

Help support a community resource that was there when Denver needed it most! During the Pandemic, we provided over 1.2 million lbs of food to families and children at risk during the lock-downs and school closures. During the same time we helped to distribute over $50,000 in energy assistance in the Denver Area. 

The Co-op at 1st Community

The Co-op at 1st offers a shared 7,500 sq ft community space to empower Barnum Residents and our local Colorado Community with economic opportunity and increased access to healthy food and wellness. 

The goal of our co-op is to offer space for producers, farmers, and distributors of healthy food to collaboratively increase food access and sustainability in our local food systems. We also offer space for holistic health modalities such as Zumba, yoga, traditional Aztec medicine, Ayurvedic medicine, nutritionists, massage, chiropractic and western medicine. 

Year Round Farmers Market with Great Local Produce and Organic Bulk

When you support local small businesses and practitioners, your money stays local and supports the moms and pops who need it the most. Being part of our local co-op increases your voice on how our food and health systems operate. 

The Co-op at 1st has been a successful 3 year project underneath the non-profit Jovial Concepts. The goal of our Indiegogo is to build membership in our co-op as we need a large active community to survive on our own! Being our own entity increases our ability to create financial equity in our rapidly gentrifying community. Participating members can vote on our operations, serve on our board and even receive year-end dividends based on your shopping habits- something that under the non-profit we could never offer! Not to mention all the discounts and specials on fresh food and body work!

Spanish Yoga - Alexis

Membership is a mutual partnership between the co-op and its members. We have dedicated leadership working in food policy, health policy, school lunch reform, agriculture reform, and carefully identifying partners to create local access to local products at a fair prices to the farmer and consumer. 

We offer a wealth of classes, events, entertainment, services, and every day products that we mindfully source from local and diverse entrepreneurs. We offer these small businesses office space, teaching space, production space and access to professionals who can help make small businesses thrive. 

From our members, all we ask for is your participation! Sign up for our classes, shop for fresh food, vote on leadership and programming, help grow our network and help us create a thriving community not just for our next generation but now. 

Commissary Kitchen - Local Food Producers and Nutrition Classes

The Co-op at 1st is a City of Denver Certifiably Green Business with statewide recognition of our dedication to environmental leadership, a value that all our entrepreneurs share. Most our products come in ecofriendly compostable or reusable packaging and bear the Colorado Proud label. Membership in our co-op is a great way to ignite change in a system that hasn't been working. Together we can move toward a system that is healthy, regenerative, and empowering!

We hope you will donate to our Ingiegogo and make this dream a reality!

Colorado Environmental Leader Award 2020

Vendors making Friends

Shared Healing Space - Massage, Accupunture, Tibetan Cranial, and Chiropractic

Emergency Meal Program for Covid Relief

 

Business Plan with 5 Year Projections:

http://thecoopat1st.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/Coop-Business-plan-and-Proforma-9-2021.pdf

story:
Who are we?

There is a glaring gap in the commercial meal delivery market that doesn’t cater to people with food intolerances, and we are going to address it.

We are Anna Sturmey, Julia Leong and Kiarra Martindale, three Australian female founders who are passionate about health, particularly gut health. Gut Feel Goods is an integrative business dedicated to educating and empowering individuals with food intolerances find a better quality of life. 

If you experience gut health issues or food intolerances, our mission is to make eating enjoyable and convenient for you. We will be launching a Dietitian and Chef approved subscription based meal delivery kit with fresh ingredients and recipes delivered weekly in Australia in early 2022. The low FODMAP diet (explained below) is evidenced to help up to 85% of those with IBS or other gut health issues.

 

What are we offering now:

To raise funds to launch our meal delivery service, we are excited to introduce our first product, a low FODMAP smoothie recipe e-book. It is a strategic campaign to drive not only brand awareness, but awareness around the low FODMAP diet and food intolerances. We have signed a licensing agreement with the FODMAP Friendly Food Program to ensure all smoothie recipes in the e-book are FODMAP Friendly accredited and will only feature FODMAP Friendly certified products that have been laboratory tested to be low in FODMAPs.

The science backed recipe book will feature 50 recipes, including brand partners from Blackmores, Nestlé (Uncle Tobys Oats), Saputo Inc. (Liddells Yoghurt), The Beauty Chef, 5 Sparrows Brand, The Good Chocolate, Kfibre, The Gut Co, Cocofrio, Superflora, The Healthy Mummy, Wellgrove, Naturally Good and Otopia. We’ve received such a positive response that we have local F&B establishments such as Serotonin Dealer, Merry Men, Particle Cafe and Shoku Iku contributing recipes too. 

We have also partnered up with Frank Green, an Australian-based business, and are selling our e-book with a beautiful reusable smoothie tumbler. Frank Green shares our purpose of working towards a more sustainable tomorrow.

For purchase of the e-book, tumbler + brand pack, you will receive the following products at 15% RRP:

  • Glow Inner Beauty Powder (150g) from The Beauty Chef
  • Prebiotic Dietary Fibre (100g) from Kfibre
  • Vanilla vegan protein powder (500g) from Otopia® O’Fit Protein

 

What we need...

We are aiming to raise a minimum of $20,000 from this e-book campaign, in order to cover initial startup costs. As a business that will have a few overheads (kitchen leasing, delivery and packaging), we will need your help to ensure we are well positioned to make the best decisions in these areas, especially for the environment.

These funds will go towards:

  • Website and app design and build
  • Hiring reputable chefs to assist us in recipe development alongside our superstar dietitian Kiarra Martindale 
  • Administrative fees (legal, accounting) 
  • Physical overhead costs

 

What will be next?

We are aiming at launching our meal delivery service in Melbourne in Q1 2022, and expanding from there. Our subscription-based service will cover the three phases of the low FODMAP diet (elimination, reintroduction and personalisation), explained below.

 

Why are we doing this, and what is the low FODMAP diet?

Currently, 1 in 7 people worldwide, and 1 in 5 Australians experience Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) at some point in their lives. Research has found that a ‘Low FODMAP’ (FODMAP stands for Fermentable, Oligosaccharides, Disaccharides, Monosaccharides and Polyols) diet can greatly benefit these individuals. The low FODMAP diet is a three-phrase diet consisting of elimination, reintroduction and personalisation. Read more about IBS and the low FODMAP diet here. 

Aside from helping those with IBS, others that may benefit from a low FODMAP diet include:

  • Fructose Malabsorption 33% and Lactose intolerance 67 to 75% of Australians
  • Inflammatory Bowel Disease Crohn’s & Colitis (1 in 250 Australians, 45% of IBD sufferers also have IBS. Low FODMAP is recommended for symptoms management when IBD is quiescent).
  • Coeliac disease with ongoing symptoms despite following a gluten free diet. 1 in 100 Australians have Coeliac Disease and have higher rates of IBS.
  • Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth (SIBO)
  • Daily bloating (1 in 3 people)
  • Post infectious gastroenteritis
  • Endometriosis
  • Colic in breastfed babies

This segment of consumers is expected to grow in the coming years. According to Mordor Intelligence, the Global Food Intolerance Products Market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 9.1% in the forecast period (2020-2025). However, the diet needs of this group are grossly underserved with a glaring gap in the commercial meal delivery sector. With the COVID-19 pandemic, there has been a rise in the use of meal delivery services, with research showing 5.5 million Australians using such services in 2020, up from 3.9 million in 2019. Nielsen estimated the meal-kit market to be worth $300 million just last year. 

At Gut Feel Goods, we aim to service this market.

 

Other ways you can help

We’d love for you to share the word with your family and friends, even if you aren’t able to make a pledge today, if you can like, comment or share our socials this will help our brand reach and assist a greater portion of our community. 

Thank you to FODMAP Friendly, to all our brand partners, our team, family and friends for your ongoing support and believing in our product.

story:
EMPOWERING the Careers of Veterans, HBCUs & 1st Generation College Students

CAREER CLARIFIER is a revolutionary career clarity test developed to help college students and graduates (in all stages of their careers) quickly identify their best career options so they can have jobs they love and achieve their professional potential.

We also have an audacious social impact goal to support the career success of 100,000 college students who are either veterans, attending a Historically Black College or University (HBCU), or are the 1st person in their family to attend college (1st generation college student).

That’s where you come in. We need your backing to provide career clarity tests for veterans, people of color, 1st generation college students - or students at your alma mater - to help them achieve the professional success and financial self-sufficiency they want and deserve.

In exchange, we’ll give you a free career clarity test that you can use yourself or gift to a friend or loved one. (And who doesn’t know someone who is unsatisfied with their current career.)

 

 

WHAT PROBLEM DOES CAREER CLARIFIER SOLVE?

Despite spending tens of thousands of dollars (or more) on their college education, more than half of college graduates don’t know what career they would enjoy and excel in. Many take whatever job they land after graduating, and often waste years (or decades) of their work-life stuck in unfulfilling jobs.

Career Clarifier is unlike any other career test. Here’s why: All the popular career tests today suggest careers primarily based on personality. The flaw with that methodology is that personality determines HOW we do our job but not WHAT job we should do.

Think for a moment about the sharks on the hit tv show Shark Tank. They all have the same job - business leader and investor- but their personalities are wildly different.

Instead of personality, it’s their ability to size up an entrepreneur, analyze a market, understand the financials of a business, and structure a profitable deal.  It’s their skills, knowledge and abilities that make them great at their careers.

Career Clarifier, unlike other career tests, primarily uses a person’s skills, knowledge, and interests (and a bit of personality) to identify career options that truly fit.

Our career clarity test is the perfect solution for:

  • Students in university / college getting ready for the working world
  • A recent college grad still looking for a job / career
  • A not-so-recent college grad feeling stuck in their career 
  • Experienced working professionals looking to make a career transition 
  • High school students thinking about what they want to major in during college

 

 

THIS CAMPAIGN ADDRESSES A CRITICAL SOCIAL PROBLEM

There’s a big gap between the knowledge of careers known by nearly all college students and college graduates and the 1,000+ different careers that exist.

While veterans, people of color, and 1st generation college students have big dreams and strong motivation, they typically have less knowledge of the professional careers available to them to help them achieve their full potential. Many will get stuck in unsatisfying jobs that don’t let them achieve their potential.

That’s why for each career test we sell at Career Clarifier, we will donate a career test to a veteran who is enrolled in college, a student at an HCBU, or a 1st generation college student.

When you back this campaign, you’ll be helping people you know personally who need career support, and we will be able to provide the Career Clarifier to three traditionally underserved populations so they can have inspiring careers and be heroes to people in their communities.

Because of your support, they will be the example that other people will look to and think, “I can do that with my career too.”

 

 

 

CAREER CLARIFIER IS EASY TO USE

People can use their computer, laptop, tablet, or smartphone to answer 80 multiple choice questions about skills, knowledge, and interests.

Our proprietary platform will compare their answers to an in-depth analysis of more than 1,000 jobs and careers geared toward people with college degrees. Each test taker instantly receives a comprehensive, 70-page results report, which can be saved, downloaded and/or printed.

The personalized results report includes:

  • The test takers preferred skills, knowledge, and abilities
  • Up to 20 specific jobs and careers that best fit the test taker
  • Comprehensive Career Summary Profiles that describe each recommend job
  • Detailed information on how to evaluate the career options and choose the best one
  • Work settings the test taker will enjoy working in based on their interests
  • How to choose the right career for you

 

ABOUT ME

The past 17 years of my life have been dedicated to helping college students and college graduates to identify their best career options, so they don’t waste years of their life job hopping from one unsatisfying job to another.

In 2004, I founded NewCareerBreakthrough.com, a career clarity coaching service that helps college students and college graduates to identify their best career options. More than 7,000 people have used my 1 to 1 coaching service to identify career paths they will enjoy, excel in and be proud of.

For the past two years, I have been building a revolutionary online career clarity test that will provide career clarity to people who don’t have access to expensive 1 to 1 career coaching.

Working with a technical co-founder, we’ve designed and built a proof-of-concept model that has been tested and fine-tuned with more than 500 of my clients. I’ve gotten their feedback and suggestions on how to improve our system and results report.

I’ve also spent the past eighteen months writing comprehensive summary profiles for more than 1,000 careers to help users learn the details about each recommended option. The career clarity test is set for October 1, 2021 release.

I’ve been self-funding all this work and product development. It’s an investment I feel privileged and proud to have been able to make.

Now, I need your help. We’re aiming to raise $5,000 to provide 500 career clarity tests to distribute the career tests to veterans in college, HBCU students, and 1st gen college students. The more we raise, the more tests we can provide right now. Ultimately, our goal is to provide 100,000 free tests. 

 

FOUR WAYS YOU CAN HELP LAUNCH THIS REVOLUTIONARY CAREER CLARITY TEST

If empowering the career success of people you know, as well as traditionally underserved people, moves you, here are four things you can do today:

  1. Back this campaign now: Get a career test for you (or someone you know) and provide a career clarity test tests to one, a few or many veterans, people of color, and 1st generation college students to discover their best career options and help them achieve the professional success they want and deserve.
  2. Help a friend: Please share this link with friends that would benefit from career guidance.
  3. Help spread the word: Share this project with someone you know who is also passionate about seeing underserved people succeed.
  4. Help us get media exposure: Share this project with your media contacts.

 

WHAT YOUR GENEROSITY WILL DO

Your generosity will help unleash the career potential of graduating veterans, HBCU students, and 1st generation college students.  

With your generosity, we will get this career clarity test into the hands of motivated people who need to see their career possibilities so they can achieve their full personal and professional potential.

You and I have the power to use our influence and financial resources for good - and in this case, to make a difference in the lives of so many others.

 

Thank you!  Thank you!  Thank you!

story:
Let's create a community for people living with diabetes!

 

Founder's Story

Two years ago, I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes at 25 when I was hospitalized in the ICU for Diabetic Ketoacidosis, a serious diabetes complication where the body is in a high blood sugar and produces excess ketones. While I had been slowly losing weight to an unhealthy degree over the previous two years, my diabetes didn’t start in my life until that fateful year.

After being released from the hospital, I began my lifelong battle of managing Type 1 Diabetes– an autoimmune disease with no cure that renders me dependent on insulin for the rest of my life.

I quickly learned that caring for Type 1 Diabetes is a full time job. Like a baby, it requires around-the-clock attention. If you neglect to give this attention at the right times and in the right doses, you will pay the consequences. 

From the doctor, I was given a checklist of taking insulin, checking blood sugar, and exercising, but no one told me about the mood swings, anxiety, and loneliness that come with managing Type 1. Family and friends are there for us, but at the end of the day find it hard to relate. Needless to say, I battled on my own for some time.

I learned that on average, a Type 1 Diabetic makes 180 treatment-related decisions in a day on top of all the other daily activities. Living with diabetes can be exhausting, both mentally and physically from the rollercoaster of blood sugar. Everything affects blood sugar, from illness, injuries, hormones, weather, stress, and exercise or lack thereof. There is no magic formula to manage this disease. There are some basic rules but each diabetic must figure out what works for them - often through painful trial and errors.

 

The Problem

The mental health struggles of diabetics are not typically addressed by standard medical care professionals for diabetes, such as endocrinologists and nurses. Without dedicated resources to share, they often avoid the mental toll to focus only on the physical.  Managing mental health with diabetes is a full-time job that can lead to stress, anxiety, and depression, and eating disorders. These mental health issues frequently occur with diabetes, yet remain an unrecognized and untreated. 

“Diabetes distress” is an emotional state in which people experience feelings such as stress, from living with diabetes self-management. Diabetes burnout occurs when a person feels overwhelmed and frustrated by the burden of diabetes self-care.

 

Our Solution - Diabuddies App

Diabuddies is an app that matches users with other Type 1 diabetics based on shared characteristics and gives them the opportunity to mutually support each other and share useful information.

By creating the Diabuddies app, you will help us create a community of mutual support for diabetic patients. Our target market is connected people living with Type 1 diabetes who want to connect with each other. Users will also be able to create or join groups around commonalities such as location, interests, and recency of diagnosis. 

 

App features include: 

1-1

Provides one-on-one matching with a Diabuddy based on location, age, gender, etc.

Groups

Find or create your Diabuddies group to connect with more people with similar interests.

News/Events

Follow the latest news and updates about diabetes management and technology.

Posts

Post questions on discussion board to interact with others using the platform.

 

 

Our Mission

Diabuddies’s mission is to help people living with Type 1 Diabetes connect for mutual mental health support.

 

Why are we doing this?

App founder, Amy Hsieh, started Diabuddies after being diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. There are many resources and apps out there for tracking food, insulin doses, and physical health aspects, however, there are no resources out there for people to directly meet online for mental support. Our research shows that most of the useful information is not alway provided by doctors nor diabetic educators, but rather passed along among people living with Type 1 diabetes.

 

Our Challenges

Funding -  Diabuddies is funded entirely by grants and fundraising and we need your help to make this app available to support people who are either living with diabetes or are newly-diagnosed. With your help, we can bring Diabuddies together!

If we collect a minimum of $40,000, we can develop the MVP of the mobile app within 6 months (for iPhone, Android). All perks come with early access to the app. 

To request to set up to time with us for beta testing, email Amy at mydiabuddies@gmail.com

 

Beta Testing User Testimony

“Social support is one of the biggest struggles.” – Kelly, Diabetes Educator

“You feel like you’re on an island.” – Amber

“ [My wife] won’t understand that I felt like crap when I know it was because of my blood sugar.” – Mark

“This would be the switch from being controlled by your diagnosis to in control of your diagnosis.”  – Dr. Neelima Chu, Endocrinologist

“It’s really cool to be able to find someone who understands.” - James

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Back this campaign now!
  2. Listen to our founders speak on the Diabetes Daily Grind Podcast
  3. Donate on Paypal!
  4. Tell your network that you support Diabuddies and tell them why
  5. Follow & share us on Facebook and Instagram
  6. Invite your friends to this group
  7. Share this Indiegogo campaign!
  8. Share our Diabuddies website!

 

Contact us

mydiabuddies@gmail.com

instagram.com/mydiabuddies
 

About Our Team

Diabuddies is a non-profit diabetes mental wellness app founded by Amy Hsieh, who is living with Type 1 Diabetes. Alongside her are a team of female entrepreneurs from USC Iovine and Young Academy with shared expertise in design, marketing, healthcare, and software engineering. The team is passionate about helping people with diabetes and are very proud to bring Diabuddies to the world.

Thank you for being part of this movement and backing this campaign. Make our mission your mission to help people living with diabetes to successfully improve their mental health struggles.

 

Sincerely,

The Diabuddies App team

Without dedicated resources to share, they often avoid the mental toll to focus only on the physical.  Managing mental health with diabetes is a full-time job that can lead to stress, anxiety, and depression, and eating disorders. These mental health issues frequently occur with diabetes, yet remain an unrecognized and untreated. “Diabetes distress” is an emotional state in which people experience feelings such as stress, from living with diabetes self-management. Diabetes burnout occurs when a person feels overwhelmed and frustrated by the burden of diabetes self-care. Our Solution - Diabuddies AppDiabuddies is an app that matches users with other Type 1 diabetics based on shared characteristics and gives them the opportunity to mutually support each other and share useful information.By creating the Diabuddies app, you will help us create a community of mutual support for diabetic patients. Our target market is connected people living with Type 1 diabetes who want to connect with each other. Users will also be able to create or join groups around commonalities such as location, interests, and recency of diagnosis.  App features include: 1-1Provides one-on-one matching with a Diabuddy based on location, age, gender, etc.GroupsFind or create your Diabuddies group to connect with more people with similar interests.News/EventsFollow the latest news and updates about diabetes management and technology.PostsPost questions on discussion board to interact with others using the platform.  Our MissionDiabuddies’s mission is to help people living with Type 1 Diabetes connect for mutual mental health support. Why are we doing this?App founder, Amy Hsieh, started Diabuddies after being diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. There are many resources and apps out there for tracking food, insulin doses, and physical health aspects, however, there are no resources out there for people to directly meet online for mental support. Our research shows that most of the useful information is not alway provided by doctors nor diabetic educators, but rather passed along among people living with Type 1 diabetes. Our ChallengesFunding -  Diabuddies is funded entirely by grants and fundraising and we need your help to make this app available to support people who are either living with diabetes or are newly-diagnosed. With your help, we can bring Diabuddies together!If we collect a minimum of $40,000, we can develop the MVP of the mobile app within 6 months (for iPhone, Android). All perks come with early access to the app. To request to set up to time with us for beta testing, email Amy at mydiabuddies@gmail.com Beta Testing User Testimony“Social support is one of the biggest struggles.” – Kelly, Diabetes Educator“You feel like you’re on an island.” – Amber“ [My wife] won’t understand that I felt like crap when I know it was because of my blood sugar.” – Mark“This would be the switch from being controlled by your diagnosis to in control of your diagnosis.”  – Dr. Neelima Chu, Endocrinologist“It’s really cool to be able to find someone who understands.” - James Other Ways You Can Help
Back this campaign now!
Listen to our founders speak on the Diabetes Daily Grind Podcast

Donate on Paypal!

Tell your network that you support Diabuddies and tell them why
Follow & share us on Facebook and Instagram


Invite your friends to this group

Share this Indiegogo campaign!
Share our Diabuddies website!
 Contact usmydiabuddies@gmail.cominstagram.com/mydiabuddies About Our TeamDiabuddies is a non-profit diabetes mental wellness app founded by Amy Hsieh, who is living with Type 1 Diabetes. Alongside her are a team of female entrepreneurs from USC Iovine and Young Academy with shared expertise in design, marketing, healthcare, and software engineering. The team is passionate about helping people with diabetes and are very proud to bring Diabuddies to the world.Thank you for being part of this movement and backing this campaign. Make our mission your mission to help people living with diabetes to successfully improve their mental health struggles. Sincerely,The Diabuddies App team

story:
Journey Towards Inner Freedom

In today's fast-paced world, it is easy to lose sight of what really matters: a healthy, happy, and meaningful life. We invite you to join our first course series on Personal Mastery where we will deeply explore transformative lifestyle techniques such as gratitude and mindfulness practices, emotional intelligence, healing, values, vision and purpose.

This course is for you if you face these common challenges:

  • Feeling stagnant
  • Overwhelmed
  • Angry or fearful
  • Lonely or isolated
  • Hopeless or powerless
  • Pessimistic or dissatisfied.

 

The Personal Mastery course is a 6-month immersive experience to help you regain your strength, optimism, and confidence to live fully with purpose and meaning. In this journey we deeply explore transformative techniques, tools, and practices to help you live your absolute best version.

In our experience, most other development courses are compartmentalized with very limited focus. And in the world of 24/7 on-demand virtual programming, personal connection is lost. 

Unlike typical programs, our personal mastery series offers the deep connection of a cohort structure in a blended learning format. Virtual course modules include live sessions, mid-month check-ins, and breakout group discussions. Asynchronous coursework contains science-based interactive exercises, expert interviews, and current research. This course is appropriate for all levels of self-development.

Join us as we explore our inner workings, realign with values, and rediscover a purpose-driven life.   

Course Outline 

 

A 6-month journey of self-exploration

Plus BONUS 6 months of additional check-ins and support

Meet Our Team 

Co-Founder Nicole Jarosinski


 

Co-Founder Scot Walker

We believe there are no problems - only situations that require our loving attention.  We seek to positively impact individuals and organizations by turning today’s obstacles into tomorrow’s opportunities.

Our graduate-level teachers offer decades of combined specialized experience across many industries and spiritual practices. We are honored to share the fruits of our life's work by delivering highly impactful courses with engaging content, group exercises, and live sessions. 

 

“Your heart knows the way. Run in that direction.” – Rumi

“We must come to see that the end we seek is a society at peace with itself, a society that can live with its conscience.” – Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.

 

 

Service to others has always been our passion. Our desire to create positive change in a troubled world called us to embark on a courageous journey. After decades of professional development and deep personal inner work, we are incredibly excited to offer this unique personal mastery series and future courses to help others realize their own meaningful purpose.

We invite you to invest in us so we may positively impact countless lives. Together we can co-create a healthier and happier world for all!

Equitable Access

In alignment with our core values, we are establishing a scholarship fund to make our courses available to everyone.  100% of the scholarship fund will be applied to those in need. We will also offer discounts for students, military veterans, and senior citizens.

How We Honor Your Generosity

Your generosity will greatly help us develop transformative learning experiences. We are currently building the Personal Mastery course, with many more to come! We will use your contributions for the myriad of content development requirements, to build our team, and to accredit our educational programs. Your generosity will make lifelong dreams a reality!

Other Ways To Help

We deeply appreciate generosity in all forms! Please share this campaign through the social media links above. You are also welcome to connect directly with Nicole and Scot on LinkedIn.

Perks

Knowing that you personally made a difference to awaken hearts and minds will be a lasting reward. We are also happy to offer our heartfelt appreciation with discounted services. As a valued patron you'll receive special Early Bird Pricing on the Personal Mastery course, emotional intelligence (EQ) coaching sessions, and more!

EQ Assessment + Personalized Coaching

Take an EQ inventory to assess your strengths and growth opportunities

EQ-i 2.0 Sample Report

Emotional intelligence describes the way we understand ourselves, relate with others, and deal with challenges. If you experience challenges in your work or home life, EQ coaching can help you understand problem areas and guide you to a smoother path. 

EQ Leadership Assessment + Personalized Coaching

Deep focus on leadership skills

The leadership report contains all information from the basic assessment, plus a deep dive on how to use emotional intelligence when in leadership roles. A must for managers, leaders, and aspiring executives.

EQ 360 Assessment + Personalized Coaching

A 360-degree view of your emotional intelligence

This type of assessment includes feedback from peers, managers, and direct reports. If you're ready to take your career to the next level, a 360 assessment will give you a firm foundation to build upon. A complete view of workplace relationships is essential for managers, aspiring leaders, and those wanting to improve team dynamics. 

Join the first cohort of the Personal Mastery Course! 

Full Course Access + EQ Assessment with Personalized Coaching + Gratitude Journal

 

You will be registered for the first cohort of our Personal Mastery course, receive a gratitude journal, and a 90-minute personalized coaching session on emotional intelligence. Coaching includes a comprehensive science-based EQ assessment and separate EQ training module.

How To Use Indiegogo

New to Indiegogo? Follow these steps to contribute to our campaign:

  1. Create an Indiegogo account or log in
  2. Navigate to the Personal Mastery course page (this page you're on now)
  3. Click the "Back It" button
  4. Select your perk and/or contribution amount
  5. Complete your payment

It's as easy as that!

What People Are Saying About Us

Learn more about our "essence of bravery": One-Way Plane Tickets To Europe

Check out our AllBe website: Personal Mastery Series page

story:
Short Summary

My name is Beverly, a professional woman who practices and teaches yoga.  I started practicing yoga 10 years ago and wasn't long before I enrolled in a program to certify to teach yoga. Shortly afterwards, I opened a yoga studio.  A safe & welcoming space for everyone.  My goal is to inspire and help people form their own unique yoga practice.  It makes sense to me, since each body is like a piece of art, there are no two exactly the same.   When I started to practice I realized how powerful yoga can be when it helped me manage symptoms from anxiety and panic episodes.  When I started teaching and observing others experience their own transformation, it reaffirmed yoga's ability to help heal and revitalize energy in the body. 

The thought of losing this space where people come together without judgement makes me sad.  I feel like a whole community will be let down leaving a void where this type of yoga studio is needed.  The trendy yoga can be intimidating, this is a place where one can be comfortable and begin the journey to repair, restore and balance.  Get centered here!  the information age wreaks havoc on our bodies due to the majority of the day being immobile, sitting in an office, and massive amounts of information overtaxing our minds.   Yoga has changed my life and many people in our community.  I'd like to continue to maintain and expand this studio as it  brings forth community spirit, inspiration, light, growth, knowledge, and  inner-peace.  A place to explore the different styles of yoga to find the one that fits your body type.  We share the roots of yoga philosophy and science only if one has the desire to learn it.  Our place is neutral where one can reclaim their own minds and reconnect to their bodies & beliefs. 

I would be overjoyed to be able to maintain and expand this community.  With your help, we can continue to operate and expand within the community.  You will help serve traditional yoga to a large community of people who ordinarily are intimidated to enter a formal yoga studio.   No gym yoga offered , it's traditional Hatha, Flow classes, Restorative & Yin. Iyengar Yoga is the core of inspiration to learn how to properly align our bodies while practicing.   We specialize in small class learning for individualized attention.  Safe, & welcoming to all body types, cultures and backgrounds. 

  • The studio's current need is $6,000  
  • Our uniqueness is keeping the yoga practice real no discrimination to anyone who comes to us to learn, practice or meditate. 
  • The funds will go to renewing our lease next month. 

The Impact

Last month when we were looking at the yoga studio business end to end, it came to me that there is more here than our livelihood. Its the people who made this a warm and welcoming community for yoga.  The people are wonderful and count on this space.  i overheard a woman talking saying "she didn't know what she would do for yoga if this place wasn't here".  It made me realize, most people want to try yoga, practice yoga or learn about yoga and they need to be comfortable.  So this studio has drawn people out of their home practice to a studio practice that feels like home. 

  • what qualifies me?  A strong desire to help people help themselves to enrich their lives. 
  • my gifts are blended with strong intuition and education in business management. 
  • the challenges of a small class studio, is building other means and sources of income.  My plan to overcome this is to place a yoga retail boutique inside the studio. This will provide a one stop shopping for our community and add another source of revenue. 
  • You can help us reach our goals by contributing, or sharing this with everyone you know, 
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools makes it easy.  

Many, many thanks for helping a yoga community! namaste~

story:
Short Summary

I’m Heidi Sormaz – I’ve been teaching at and running Fresh Yoga in New Haven for 15 years. I’m so grateful to have seen the upsurge of interest in yoga and its growth throughout this city.  Although more yoga is available, what I primarily see across the country is exclusivity.  I’m committed to refreshing Fresh Yoga to make it more accessible and more inclusive. Instead of providing the occasional free class for students who cannot afford typical studio prices – I’m committed to a system where people can pay on a sliding scale according to their ability and maintain a regular yoga practice within a community. Yoga is and always has been about seva - being of service and giving to others in order to truly be happy in life.

To make this vision a reality, Fresh Yoga is changing the structure of the studio to a donation-based organization. It will include a sliding scale cost structure, $5 community classes, no-minimum donation classes on Saturdays (Seva Saturdays), and need-based tuition scholarships for the majority of our yoga programs. Part of the change is a simplification - going back to our home base at Erector Sq and closing the downtown location. Erector Sq is where we began in the heart of East Rock. I lived in this neighborhood for many years so the area will always feel special to me. As a graduate student in New Haven for five years, I know the challenging reality of attempting to live a balanced life as a full time student.

Through 15 years, 2 build outs, and 4 different physical locations, Fresh has never raised our prices. As we face our largest transformation, Fresh Yoga is striving to maintain a sustainable model of business not only for our community but also for our teachers and staff – we hope to remain a vibrant part of the community for another 15 years!

We hope you will be inspired to help us transform Fresh Yoga – your donation will allow us to completely refresh - to know that when we begin this transition at the beginning of January we will be able to stay afloat providing lower cost options for classes, workshops and trainings that everyone can take advantage of.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal at Fresh Yoga is to create a community in which everyone contributes according to their ability and the resources available to them. In order to do this in a way that ensures we meet our operating costs, we are creating a tiered system of rates and asking community members to participate at the level that works for them and their budget.

Specifically, there will be 3 main payment tiers:

The Base Rate is our first tier – it covers 65% of what is needed to run the studio. It provides an affordable option for regular study.

The Sustaining Rate is our second tier. It reflects the current market value for yoga classes and helps us by meeting the actual operating costs of the studio, which includes being able to pay the teachers who are teaching free, $5 donation and no-minimum donation classes for their expertise, time, and energy.

The Benefactor Rate is our third tier. It is 20% higher than the sustaining rate. If an individual can afford this level, they are assisting our efforts to offer tiered, scholarship, and need-based classes.

If someone cannot afford the base level – they can apply for a larger scholarship based on need.

The donations made during this campaign will help sustain Fresh during the transition to the new system. We are looking to raise enough funds to cover the sustainability of the studio for the next 6 months. Your donation will go toward balancing the operating costs of the studio while providing lower cost options. Specifically :

- 50% of teachers pay

- 50% of the rent and utilities

- 50% of administration 

After the campaign, we will continue to host an online store with Fresh Merchandise and hold special events to help sustain us in the long run.

Fresh Perks

In the spirit of generosity and inclusivity, we extend the following perks to you in deep appreciation for any amount you're able to give. There is super Fresh swag: tanks and our coveted light-weight hoodie, yoga classes and private sessions including online, at Fresh, prenatal, postnatal, and mommy and baby; wellness options such as meditation and massage, music, and yoga training for you or someone you would like to sponsor. Look over the options and choose what's right for you. 

Any contribution makes you a benefactor - you will benefit all who want to come to the studio. You are helping us make this transition a successful one.

 

Risks & Challenges

Although there is a risk in this transformation, that is being able to meet our goal of sustaining the studio while providing low cost options - there is very little risk in this campaign. All funds raised, whether or not we are able to meet our goal will go toward the support of being able to provide as many low cost services as we can. The major challenge you are helping us with is the ability to maintain the operating costs through the transition. The more we raise - the better chance we have of survival!

Although we predict that there will be enthusiasm for this new approach, Fresh can't predict exact numbers. The upside is that we already have a strong base at Erector Sq, as we have been there for 15 years and I believe that base will sustain. In closing the downtown studio, we are eliminating overhead but also anticipate some loss of clients due to the closure. We are running the campaign to carry us through the transition so that we can use this time to gather data and rebudget while still being able to pay the teachers and staff.

I believe we will be able to solve any challenge that arises because we have a 15 year track record of success. During that entire time, we have continuously been able to give 2% of our profit to local New Haven charities, keep our doors open, and pay our teachers and staff for their time and expertise.

Final Thoughts and Other Ways You Can Help

When deciding on how much to donate, we want you to feel well-informed and comfortable. Please feel free to reach out to us at info@freshyoga.com or (203) 776-9642 with any questions and insights you have! We support transparency and clear communication, always.

If you're totally strapped for cash, but still want to help, no worries!! 

Please share our mission on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, Tumblr, Pinterest, Youtube, etc! Simply click on the links at the upper right corner (next to the video) to share on Facebook and other sites. Any and all support is invaluable for our effort.

Do you have an offering that might be a great incentive that you could donate to raise funds? Email us at info@freshyoga.com!

If you love Fresh and want to send us a video or testimonial that we could use in this campaign - please email to info@freshyoga.com.

If you want to be a part of this new venture in any way - email us at info@freshyoga.com!

Thank you for reading!

We look forward to seeing you at the completely Refreshed Fresh Yoga!

 

Deep gratitude and thanks to all who helped make this campaign a reality: Niki Cunningham, Jen Kopec, Leah Dyjak, Brenda Oneal, Shaun English, Donna Dzubin, Ashley Feehan, Christine Nogueira, Kirsten Collins, Erica Mather, Cat Allen, Ida Jo, Kami Mikelis, Denise Hopkins, Emma Shansky, Allison English, and 108 Monkeys!
