In the spirit of generosity and inclusivity, we extend the following perks to you in deep appreciation for any amount you're able to give. There is super Fresh swag: tanks and our coveted light-weight hoodie, yoga classes and private sessions including online, at Fresh, prenatal, postnatal, and mommy and baby; wellness options such as meditation and massage, music, and yoga training for you or someone you would like to sponsor. Look over the options and choose what's right for you. 
Any contribution makes you a benefactor - you will benefit all who want to come to the studio. You are helping us make this transition a successful one.

 

Risks & Challenges
Although there is a risk in this transformation, that is being able to meet our goal of sustaining the studio while providing low cost options - there is very little risk in this campaign. All funds raised, whether or not we are able to meet our goal will go toward the support of being able to provide as many low cost services as we can. The major challenge you are helping us with is the ability to maintain the operating costs through the transition. The more we raise - the better chance we have of survival!
Although we predict that there will be enthusiasm for this new approach, Fresh can't predict exact numbers. The upside is that we already have a strong base at Erector Sq, as we have been there for 15 years and I believe that base will sustain. In closing the downtown studio, we are eliminating overhead but also anticipate some loss of clients due to the closure. We are running the campaign to carry us through the transition so that we can use this time to gather data and rebudget while still being able to pay the teachers and staff.
I believe we will be able to solve any challenge that arises because we have a 15 year track record of success. During that entire time, we have continuously been able to give 2% of our profit to local New Haven charities, keep our doors open, and pay our teachers and staff for their time and expertise.

Final Thoughts and Other Ways You Can Help
When deciding on how much to donate, we want you to feel well-informed and comfortable. Please feel free to reach out to us at info@freshyoga.com or (203) 776-9642 with any questions and insights you have! We support transparency and clear communication, always.
If you're totally strapped for cash, but still want to help, no worries!! 
Please share our mission on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, Tumblr, Pinterest, Youtube, etc! Simply click on the links at the upper right corner (next to the video) to share on Facebook and other sites. Any and all support is invaluable for our effort.
Do you have an offering that might be a great incentive that you could donate to raise funds? Email us at info@freshyoga.com!
If you love Fresh and want to send us a video or testimonial that we could use in this campaign - please email to info@freshyoga.com.
If you want to be a part of this new venture in any way - email us at info@freshyoga.com!
Thank you for reading!
We look forward to seeing you at the completely Refreshed Fresh Yoga!
 
Deep gratitude and thanks to all who helped make this campaign a reality: Niki Cunningham, Jen Kopec, Leah Dyjak, Brenda Oneal, Shaun English, Donna Dzubin, Ashley Feehan, Christine Nogueira, Kirsten Collins, Erica Mather, Cat Allen, Ida Jo, Kami Mikelis, Denise Hopkins, Emma Shansky, Allison English, and 108 Monkeys!

story:
Beauty With Purpose
We aspire to meet the beauty needs of women and inspire purpose

A S H A K I (meaning beauty) was founded by Joy and from her travels in Africa she realised that many women were not as fortunate as she is. 

The women were farming indigenous butters for their skin and hair but could not increase their income beyond the local community markets and therefore stuck in a cycle of poverty and limited opportunities. 

These butters were great for skin and hair. She soon realised there was an opportunity to use the local resources and created a line of luxury hair care products to do her bit in helping alleviate poverty and also share these beauty secrets.

From the outset she had the vision to form a company that will make a difference and founded Ashaki on the following ethos:

How we treat our skin, people and planet matters:

CustoMIXation - We believe that beauty is not a one size fits all and neither should your products. Our collection is customised to suit you.
We Are Plant Based – we sourced the purest, rarest ingredients that are potent enough to make a difference.
We Go Beyond Charity - We believe the ability to work is at the core of human dignity and we use rare, organic ingredients produced by women to help alleviate women poverty.
We Are Sustainable - We ensure full traceability of our ingredients. The pursuit of beauty should not harm the planet.


By supporting us you will help us bring our full collection of products to market and join us in in our efforts to provide meaningful and fair work to women in need. Who in turn use this income to take their children to school. 

COLLECTION SET

The Miraculous 20 Scalp Serum Therapy

A luxurious blend of African oils and super active ingredients all chosen with the outmost care for their efficacy in scalp health and care. This treatment serum is packed with the power of 20 different essential oils and active ingredients. The active ingredients have all being clinically proven to stimulate hair growth, reduce hair thinning, purify scalp and increase blood circulation all working together increase scalp health and hair health.This serum is suitable for all scalp conditions and all hair types.
INGREDIENT SPOTLIGHT:
MORINGA OIL – Sourced from women in Uganda
BAOBAB OIL – Sourced from women in Namibia


OIL ELIXIR


Enriched with a rich blend of exotic African oils, this oil is suitable for all hair types including coily, kinky, afro types. This oil deeply nourishes, seals in moisture and shines and keeps away frizz and reduce the appearance of split ends.


INGREDIENT SPOTLIGHT:

MARULA OIL – Sourced from women in South Africa

KALAHARI MELON OIL – Sourced from women in South Africa and Namibia

 

HYDRO REVITALISING TONIC 

This multi-tasking, leave-in styling tonic hydrates, controls frizz, blocks humidity, improves the appearance of split ends and adds supple movement and shine – all while protecting hair against heat damage.

INGREDIENT SPOTLIGHT:
BAMBOO BIOFERMMENT


SUBLIME BALM  

This multi-tasking, leave-in styling tonic hydrates, controls frizz, blocks humidity, improves the appearance of split ends and adds supple movement and shine – all while protecting hair against heat damage.


INGREDIENT SPOTLIGHT:

MAFURA BUTTER – Sourced from women in Mozambique


PERKS

USE OF FUNDS

How will your money be spent?

Purchase of ingredients, packaging and other product materials
Fund the manufacturing, fulfillment of our full product collection
Cover various administrative costs and online marketing associated with bringing our full product collection

JOURNEY MAP

   

CHALLENGES


A S H A K I is an independent and founder ran brand. We are undertaking our first ever full production run of our full collection set and there may be a number of challenges that may impact our plans such as late delivery of ingredients or packaging,  however, we have a capable team that is experienced, passionate and commited to the brand and its success.

We have carefully mapped out risk mitigation plans for every stage of this campaign and for our production.

Our approach for this Indiegogo campaign is to provide a conservative time estimate for the delivery of perks because we have to order packaging and ingredients. We do however, commit to staying in constant communication until all perks are fulfilled.

FOUNDER

Joy Ngwetjana is the founder of A S H A K I and has previously worked in the Financial Sector as a Relationship Manager for Standard Bank South Africa amongst other leadership positions in corporate.

She is purpose driven and passionate about empowering women and building inclusive communities.

She founded A S H A K I after her travels in Africa and realising there is a big descrepancy between womens welfare and the beauty industry. The majority of small scale farmers are women and produce most of the products used in cosmetics.   She soon realised that creation of a luxury brand of cosmetics could help alleviate women stuck in poverty by providing a wider market for the ingredient they produced.

Feulled by the idea that that the beauty industry can be the great equaliser she founded the brand on the firm believe that meaning work is at the core of human dignity.

SOCIAL IMPACT

ONE SIZE DOES NOT FIT ALL

At A S H A K I we understand that no two curls are alike and neither should the haircare regimen. 
We embrace inclusivity in beauty and recognise that One Size Does Not Fit All. And we have designed our collection to cater to all types of hair and you are able to build and customise your own mainteance plan because we believe beauty should not be exclusionary and every woman should have the freedom to be her own kind of beautiful.


WE GO BEYOND CHARITY

Charity is great but what is better is the ability to earn an income. Work is at the core of human dignity. We source our key ingredients from women owned cooperatives and they earn 3x more. We not only support fair trade we walk the talk by giving a living wage. Our producers earn more and their lives have improved as they can afford healthcare, education and all the little things we take for granted. When women are empowered they are more than likely to reinvest that income back into their families and communities.

We believe that beauty can be used for greater good. By supporting us an ethical brand and voting with your money you can contribute to a more equitable world.

 

WE ARE SUSTAINABLE

We are plant based and organic. We ensure full tracebility of our ingredients. The pursuit of beauty should not harm the planet. 

For us sustainability is more than just being green, it implies how you source your ingredients matters, who makes your ingredients matters and how safe your products are matters.

story:
When I say Re-Introduce Hypnotherapy to my business, I really do mean re-introduce, in that this has been a skill of mine since grade school and have used in the past to help people with past life work, memory and soul retrieval, and other services that hypnosis has been found to be a powerful tool for.  As my business moves further away from being a road show psychic medium and healer and more into a Holistic Health Care and Life Coach Service Provider, I am working to add some amazing capstone services and certifications to build my marketability. With the help of an amazing business coach, some business school training and a lot of trial and error I have brought my business to a point where it’s sustaining itself and by getting this state certification done, I will be opening a massive revenue door and going from surviving mode to thriving mode! The best part of this, I already have clients excited to sign up from having worked with me through other services!

My Journey with Blue Moon weaver, my business, began about 4-5 years ago under a completely different business name and a blog but as I began to grow and embrace my skills, things changes.  So over the past 3 +/- years I have been growing Blue Moon Weaver by reading tarot cards and doing work for paranormal groups as a psychic medium. Shortly after I started adding in my Jin Shin Jyutsu Services (Think Acupuncture + Reiki = Awesome) and that made money too and helped me expand upon the depth and meaning of my readings for my clients.  Once i was sure that this combo was working well for clients, I started promoting myself as a Psychic and Holistic healer. Then somewhere along the line I started getting noticed as a medium in the paranormal field and was invited to be a regular a radio show out of Canada and was with them for about a year. While doing the show, I added to my toolbox of services by getting my full certification in Jin Shin Jyutsu and my level two mastery in Reiki. I also began working at a metaphysical shop and traveling to popular paranormal events to build my reputation and clientele. Finally I started adding on herbalism (herbal medicine) and massage therapy and now I am reclaiming my Hypnotherapy skills with the goal of being able to offer a fully rounded Holistic health Care and Life Coach service so I can help my clients move onto their healthiest and most prosperous life path.

So Here is the Business Plan:

I am currently working as Psychic Medium and I am Being Picked Up by a Sponsored (AKA: Paid) Podcast in January 2018 and will continue my work with the paranormal and promoting myself there.

I am also working with a business coach to help make sure I stay focused and make the best use of my time, energy, skills, and resources.

I am currently working on an associates level herbalism certification and am set to do massage therapy licensing at the end of 2018  (*These two items plus the Hypnotherapy are my capstones and add credibility with the state and insurance companies)

By the End of 2018 Blue Moon Weaver will be licensed as an LLC

By 2019 I will be in a store front brick and mortar, offering Apothecary and Metaphysical products in the front of house and aiding clients in the back offices. I already have individuals I am training up to help in this as employees as I wish to remain a sole proprietor.

I do have some bigger plans after this, but right now a great opportunity has been offered for me to get this certification for the state at a reasonable cost and I want to get you what you need to know now so that you can help me really make my business bang over the next year and make it possible for me to actually start thriving and showing my daughter, women can make it in a field they love no matter the obstacles. And it’s with your help I’m going to be able to do all of this.

So here’s what you can do to help!

DONATE! Every dollar helps! And with that said, more is better in this case, but again, if 2500 people each donate $1, its still all good, but please do help and for helping I have some fun things to say thank you including neat little letters from spirit, readings, and Priority List Privileges for those who would like to try my Hypnotherapy Services out!

Share this With Everyone You Know! Tell Them “Hey, look at this lady trying to make a better life for herself and her family and her community by building her business and herself up! It’s Amazing! Help Her! Please!”

Finally! Give yourself a hug from me for helping out in any way you possibly could, it is greatly appreciated!

Lots of love to you all and Thank you again!

story:
SPECIAL OFFER

Starting August 29, the first 5 people who donate at least $150 will win a free 60 minute massage by the amazingly talented massage therapist Emily Brown! We have 2 left!

~

Hello Be Here Now,

 

Are you confused about that greeting? Why are we addressing YOU as “Be Here Now"? Simply put, YOU ARE Be Here Now. Without your energy, love, and support, Be Here Now would not exist. Sherri and Marco began this adventure more than four years ago and you all have joined it over the last three. We thank you for making the space what it is -- a place where you can develop your practice, receive healing, gather as a community, or as a space where you know you are loved and accepted.

 

Whatever it is you find here, we are glad to have you. Due to circumstances outside of our control, Be Here Now would have been forced to close for at least four months while the building is under construction.  We know closing is not an option for our community. But as the saying goes, when one door closes a window opens.

 

You might know that Be Here Now has been looking to expand. Our opportunity to grow has serendipitously presented itself at 406 8th St. SE, right across the street from our current home! In this new space, we will have two practice rooms capable of holding more clients and more classes. That means more space for folks who enjoy the classes held in Hanuman. Wednesday Yin, Monday Beginner’s, and Friday Flow won’t have waitlists every week! The second healing room will allow us to offer more 1-on-1 services and expand our service offerings; massages anyone?

 

Think back to all of the amazing and transformative experiences you have had at the studio. Today, Be Here Now is asking for your help to make these experiences continue for you and the rest of our community. Please consider giving to our relocation campaign to cover some costs associated with the move. Your donation will help us purchase new equipment, re-hire our wonderful muralist, complete the build out, and put the finishing touches on everything to create the same serene and welcoming vibe that exists at our current location.

 

If you cannot give at this time, share this campaign with a friend, family member, or partner. Perhaps they can give as an early birthday/holiday/whatever day gift for you to enjoy more Yoga. And from the bottom of our hearts, thank you and we love you!

story:
Short Summary

I live with my wife and my two daughters in a charming little town called Göd right next to Danube which is located  in the suburbs, a 20-minute drive from Budapest.

The Danube is very important is our lives. This is our all-time favourite holiday spot.  This is where we the whole family spends most Summers swimming (this is where my daughters learnt swimming), going kayaking and camping. This is where we go fishing, make bonefire in Autumn and Spring and this is where we have nice and quiet walks in Winter.

We would like to show the beauty of the Danube and Budapest to the wider audience  by offering a wooden heated mobile Sauna in this area.

We would like to boost up the Winter season at the Danube as well, since this is the best time to go to sauna. We have many favourite (hidden and charming) spots where we would like to place the Sauna but of course our customers can rent it out for longer time and place it at a spot of their choice (Antarctica is out of option..for now).

What We Need & What You Get

We ask altogether 7000 USD from our contributors to achieve our dream. This is the amount that can cover the material price (the purchase of the car trailer frame, the mounted wooden structure on it, the wood stove), the marketing campaign and all the permissions to place the Sauna in public areas in Budapest and in its surroundings.

If we don't reach our entire goal concerning the fundings we can cut costs by building some parts or the whole Sauna on our own, as well as running the marketing camping by ourselves (we are enthusiastic amateurs) and we can place the Sauna in more limited number of areas.

The Impact

We would like to rent out our our sauna for short terms - 1-2 hours and long terms - weekends - as well. It is great for recreation after doing exercise or after a long sightseeing tour in Budapest or its surroundings, a unique present for Birthdays and Christmas or a perfect way for celebrating family and friends reunions and gatherings.

Risks

Sauna can be damaged or crashed during usage. E.g. it is not a secret that many people like consuming alcoholic beverages in saunas. A pint of beer can feel good but if more go down the hatch, that can affect the condition of the Sauna (and your health). In case of renting out our Sauna, we ask a certain amount of deposit that covers that possible damages and this amount is returned as long as the Sauna is in the same condition as it was at the time of the handover. Depending on the damage, certain amount of deposit can be deducted. We are going to have an insurance that covers any possible issues as well.

It is great for recreation after doing exercise or after a long sightseeing tour in Budapest or its surroundings, a unique present for Birthdays and Christmas or a perfect way for celebrating family and friends reunions and gatherings.

Risks
Sauna can be damaged or crashed during usage. E.g. it is not a secret that many people like consuming alcoholic beverages in saunas. A pint of beer can feel good but if more go down the hatch, that can affect the condition of the Sauna (and your health). In case of renting out our Sauna, we ask a certain amount of deposit that covers that possible damages and this amount is returned as long as the Sauna is in the same condition as it was at the time of the handover. Depending on the damage, certain amount of deposit can be deducted. We are going to have an insurance that covers any possible issues as well.


supported by:

story:
Our Story

My Name is Jumana Kaplanian, i'm a psychologist, social activist and the founder of Psychology Spa. I received a B.A. in Social Work/ Psychology from Bethlehem University in Bethlehem (2012), and an MSc in Psychology from Oxford Brookes University in Oxford (2014). Besides my strong academic background, i have gained rich practical experience, fundamental knowledge, and strong skills in the field of my study, especially working with women, youth and children, especially those affected by violence. 

I believe that the learning process is the most powerful in leading any community transformation. Learning is her effective tool in helping the Palestinian population to improve and enhance their quality of life, and thus she can give back to her community. 

Despite the importance of psychological needs, many developing countries, Palestine included, view mental illness as threatening and disagreeable. Palestinians have been exposed to a series of traumatic events, such as imprisonment, torture, humiliation, human rights violations, etc. Yet, mental illness remains significantly under-reported despite being the largest and least acknowledged health problems in Palestine. Current mental health service providers in Palestine focus on counselling and therapy; however, seeking counselling remains often difficult to accept due to the fears of social stigma. Thus, there remains a prevalent need for an alternative, stigma free, mental health platform. Psychology Spa is a stigma free Oasis for Psycho-Education and raising awareness about Mental Health in a very relaxed setting.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a supporting hand in opening Psychology Spa. Psychology Spa have started its discussion panels by moving in different locations since April, 2017. People from different places and backgrounds were fully interested in our activities and engaged actively in all of our sessions. Now, it's time to encourage people to seek knowledge and also find a unique place to relax, learn and meet with others. We have a place to use it for this purpose, yet it requires major renovation to be a unique center. It is located in the heart of Bethlehem, Palestine. The location of the Psychology Spa is in a quiet neighborhood, yet it is easily accessible due to its proximity to the main street and public transportation. The house is an owned family house, and it consists of two rooms, one bathroom, and a garden.  This garden is very good for outdoor activities especially in the summer time. However, the house needs major renovation and to be fully furnished.

Estimated Cost to do the remain renovation 17, 000 $. We've already started doing some work and spent 8000$ . This money was spent on building a wall to separate our garden from the neighbors land to ensure privacy, renewing electricity power supply, and also repairing the front side of the house including extending a balcony to have extra space. We still need 17, 000$ to do restoration in the bathroom, installing windows and doors,  repair the kitchen corner, repair the entrance of the house including the garden, wall paint, Barket Hardwood Floor, sofas, office desk and locker, projector, and sound system. 

The Impact

Psychology Spa is a SPA for the mind. As our body needs relaxation so we can be in our best physical health. Also our mind needs knowledge and life skills so we can be in our best mental health. The importance of psychology and mental health is raised in a stigma free place. It is a meeting oasis to learn about psychological issues and how to deal with them in a very relaxed setting.

Psychology Spa aims to be a unique place where people feel proud to be part of, and not scared or ashamed to enter.

People are equipped with knowledge, skills, strategies and tools to have a better psychological and physical health. This is to create a social transformation regarding mental health, fight social stigma and enhance people's quality of life. 

 

Since 2017, We've reached more than 1000 people in the discussion panels we've held. We've also reached thousands of indirect beneficiaries through our short videos  and posts on social media. People are asking about our location and very excited to participate in our activities. 

 

 

If you can't contribute to support us in opening Psychology Spa, you can also support us by sharing the word with your friends and people you know. 

Million Thanks in advance and you are very Welcomed to come into this unique Oasis that, together, we will bring into being!

story:
Greetings, all! I am thankful to say that 3 Corners is growing and developing quickly. In case you are wondering, "What is 3 Corners?", it is a metaphysical shop located in Little 5 Points, Atlanta, GA. You can learn more about us here www.shop3corners.com.

We, my business partner and I, we're blessed to be given this shop by our mentor. We sell metaphysical supplies and provide our services (to include handmade jewelry) to the community. We have helped many people already, and they enjoy the atmosphere of our shop. Our purpose to aid others in their spiritual progression through the services and products we offer, and now we have the opportunity to expand and open our wellness center.

The 3 Corners Wellness Center will include all the products and services we already offer, as well as the addition of classes, art therapy, Reiki sessions, and more. 

We are looking to raise 25k or more for our building fund within 45 days. The money raised will go toward the purchase of the building where the wellness center will reside. It will also help us provide the necessary stock and any upgrades we may need to get started. Our wellness center will reside in the Decatur, GA, area. 

The 3 Corners Wellness Center will be open to the public, all ages and spiritual walks of life. We promote wellness and mental well being that supports the mind, body, and soul. We believe that our spiritual or energetic body needs just as much care and support as our physical bodies do. Our approach works with the Mind, Body, and Soul.




We offer tools and classes that promote clarity of mind (thoughts) through the use of aromatherapy, chakra balancing, color therapy, and products that relax and enhance mental energy.




We promote healthy eating and exercise in a few ways, such as through Reiki sessions, yoga classes, dance therapy, and advice and products. These different services will promote physical health and well being.




Our atmosphere itself is soothing and relaxing to the soul. We maintain an environment that is clean, uplifting, and free. We do this through the music selection we play, incense we burn or diffuse (aromatherapy) and through our decor. We also offer advice through various forms of divination, such as through chakra analogy or art therapy.


Your contribution will increase an appreciation to us in any amount, and we thank all of those who contribute. Please feel free to view the video and photos we provide to follow our progress. We will keep our content and visuals up to date as we progress. We have an excellent support group through our Little 5 Points family so far, and we look forward to having you as well.

story:
At Bond Together we are dedicated to providing families and schools with tools to mitigate the risk of mental illness and obesity in their children. Our interactive platform has a library of videos that teach joyful movement, exercise, and mental wellness skills. 

A full year's subscription will be donated to a low income family for every subscription purchased through this Indiegogo campaign.

With your help, we can create 80 new videos that target children of different age groups. Why so many videos? Because science has shown that only consistent engagement with healthy thought patterns and behaviors will have a lasting impact. More videos means more opportunities to develop those thought patterns and behaviors. 

Together we can help children develop into healthy and happy adults.  

Why Bond Matters

From ages 10-35 years old, suicide is the second leading cause of death. Obesity affects nearly 20% of children from ages 2-18. If your child is going to have a serious health issue, it will likely involve one or both of these maladies. While they might not seem related, science has shown that there is a strong connection between physical health and mental wellness, and what’s more, they are best addressed together.

Our name, BOND (BOdy and MiND) gestures towards the combination of physical health and mental health. Just as your physical health begins with healthy habits from a young age, your mental health also starts early and must be maintained throughout life. At Bond Together we provide families and schools with the necessary tools to develop lifelong physical and mental health.  

Unfortunately, many schools and parents only focus on the academic success of their children. This implicitly suggests that academic achievement is more important than personal wellbeing. Luckily, this is beginning to change. And that’s where Bond Together comes in. Bond Together empowers schools and parents to teach kids habits that will help them thrive physically and mentally—and healthy kids perform better in and out of school. 

HOW TO HELP YOUR KIDS

School Subscription:

Many schools do not have the resources to provide their students with tools for mental wellness and physical education. You can have a meaningful impact on hundreds of children by purchasing a subscription for the whole school. Every child and every teacher will be able to use the videos free of charge every single day.

Home Subscription:

At home, children will move through over 100 videos, gaining badges as they learn and practice life enhancing skills. They will exercise with cardio, strength and stretch videos; learn full dance routines; and practice breathing, mindfulness, and happiness skills. With your help we will be adding additional videos monthly. 

If we are fully funded, we will be able to create a library of 80 new videos that will cover the multi-video curriculum of 15 new mental health skills, 12 new dance routines and 12 new cardio, strength and stretch combinations. 

BOGO

When you purchase a subscription for your kids, we will give a free subscription to an economically disadvantaged family.  

What can we do with $35,000?

Creating one 10 minute video costs roughly $450. Those fees include paying for the actors, film crew and production. With your help we will be able to design and develop 80 new videos, making it possible to teach 4 additional months of curriculum.

One in five people will suffer from a mental illness, and those numbers will continue to climb without swift and effective action. Fifty percent of mental illness starts by age fourteen. Historically, our society has only addressed mental health after the onset of mental illness. Science has shown that this is a chronically ineffective approach. We are dramatically more successful at proactively preventing mental illness than we are at reactively treating it. That’s why we have developed a meaningful curriculum that teaches evidence-based skills to children at a young age, and young is important because that’s when children's brains are still very malleable. We teach healthy habits for young brains and bodies through interactive videos accessed daily in the classroom or at home. Kids have a blast while deepening their reservoir of skills for a healthy and happy life. 

Exercise:

Bond Together's full child approach to mental health emphasizes the benefits of exercise on our brains and bodies. Exercises release feel-good neurotransmitters including endorphins, dopamine and serotonin.

Mental Health Skills:

Bond Together teaches children evidence-based skills to deal with challenging emotions and face difficult situations. These include positive psychology, growth mindset, mindfulness, emotion awareness, emotion regulation and reframing thoughts.

Dance:

Bond Together promotes fun and joyful movement to help strengthen children's cardiovascular systems, muscles, coordination and flexibility while gaining neurological benefits such as a decrease in cortisol (a stress hormone) and an increase in memory and focus.

Risks & Challenges

Every start-up faces great risks. If Amazon, for example, decided to create a program like ours, it would be a challenge to compete. As a small company our resources are limited so we always run the risk of being muscled out by a big company.

Technology is always changing. By having a product that is based online there is always risk that new technologies will be incompatible with our videos. 

Additionally, if a policy was created that required all schools to implement a mental health curriculum that was created by the state, we would have to pivot and find a way to support their efforts. 

As we have all experienced over the past few months, life can be unpredictable. Throughout history, unpredictability has lead to a decrease in consumer spending. Therefore, it may be harder to sell our product to families who are facing job loss, turbulent home conditions, and the complications of remote learning/working. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute today but want to support our mission, you can still help!

-Let your friends and family know about Bond Together. 

-Subscribe to our YouTube channel bodymindtogether and exercise with us!

story:
From Dream to Reality

Since even before the inception of Navina, we (Drew & Daniela) have dreamt of having a place to cultivate and nurture an international community of like-minded people. The Osa region of Costa Rica is this place for us. We are so deeply drawn to the jungles here - the rainforest nourishes us on a level that no other place in the world has (that we've been to). 

With your support, Navina Costa Rica will be a space for enriching nature-based experiences, world-class training intensives, transformational retreats and individualized getaways that will leave you irrevocably changed. Bringing people together from all over the globe, our eco centre will be a hub of connection for health professionals, wellness seekers, and international movers-and-shakers.

There really aren't any words that adequately express the degree of healing that happens in this kind of environment. We've been running training intensives in the region for 2 years now and have seen it first-hand. There's just something about the jungle that changes you - making you not only more peaceful and less stressed, but also more resilient, more powerful and restored to a "full cup".

The Perks in Detail - The Energy Exchange

Our goal is to raise $60,000USD in order to:

  • Finalize the purchase of the land (we're halfway there!) and get construction rolling! 
  • Equip the centre with an eco-conscious energy solution. We're planning on Tesla battery packs for storing solar energy.
  • Planting trees that will nourish people staying at the centre for decades to come!
  • Train local Costa Ricans in Thai Yoga Massage - providing a powerful skill that can create employment opportunities for them.

We've created a tiered system of contribution, with some selections for those who intend on coming to the Centre, and options for any of you who want to help but are unsure of whether you'll make it to visit us in Costa Rica:

  • $50 - "Navina Jungle Kitchen" - our online cookbook, updated annually with new recipes.
  • $100 - Big Trees! - Sponsor a tree that will feed us for many years to come. We are planting avocado, mango, breadfruit, jackfruit and cacao trees around the Centre. (It'd be pretty cool to sponsor a chocolate tree, right!?).
  • $300 - Online Course Bundle! - Our Specialized online courses "Introduction to Thai Yoga Stretching for Exercise Professionals" and "Savasanahhh" - our blend of restorative yoga and Thai Massage. Ongoing access and updates!
  • $700 - One Week Stay - valid for a single 7-night stay at the Centre! To be used within 5 years of our opening. (Booking is subject to availability of accommodations, and does not include any transport required to get to the Centre.)
  • $1700 - Retreat Pass!! - This one allows you to attend a retreat of your choice within the first 3 years of opening! This pass is valid for a retreat of up to 7-nights. (Please note that one-week retreat passes do not apply to certification courses or training intensives; and do not include transportation required to get to the Centre.)
  • $2500 - Sponsor A Tico - We plan on becoming an integral member of the community, and part of this involves training locals (i.e. Ticos) in the practice of Thai Massage, in order to provide a new potential vocation for them. 

The Impact This Will Have

In our current age, it is evident to us that many of the world's issues would be eliminated through a greater connection to one another and to our innate humanity. We plan on being that place; not only to create experiences of connection and belonging, but also to educate on this exact concept and practice.

When we are able to touch a life, the effect of this ripples outwards to eventually reach the world. We have an impact on everyone who comes to Navina Costa Rica, and from there they go out and touch the lives of the people around them.

Whether through the vehicle of compassionate touch (one of our trainings) or through the offerings of retreat leaders, including but not limited to: yoga, martial arts, meditation and mindfulness, organic living, permaculture and renewable energy, people will leave the centre with an entirely new set of tools with which they can not only help themselves to thrive, they can facilitate that in others as well.

With your support and contributions we can continue dedicating our time and energy to building Navina Costa Rica into a place that brings out the best of who you are and who you can be!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you simply cannot contribute, there are other ways to help us reach our goal if you feel compelled to assist us:

  • Getting the word out to your tribe goes a HUGE way to helping us build awareness and positive-noise around our campaign.
  • When you share this campaign through email or social media, please make sure you include some text, describing why you think we're a worthy cause - it helps people to connect to us, through you! (A first-hand example of touching the lives around us).

Whether through the vehicle of compassionate touch (one of our trainings) or through the offerings of retreat leaders, including but not limited to: yoga, martial arts, meditation and mindfulness, organic living, permaculture and renewable energy, people will leave the centre with an entirely new set of tools with which they can not only help themselves to thrive, they can facilitate that in others as well.
With your support and contributions we can continue dedicating our time and energy to building Navina Costa Rica into a place that brings out the best of who you are and who you can be!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you simply cannot contribute, there are other ways to help us reach our goal if you feel compelled to assist us:

Getting the word out to your tribe goes a HUGE way to helping us build awareness and positive-noise around our campaign.
When you share this campaign through email or social media, please make sure you include some text, describing why you think we're a worthy cause - it helps people to connect to us, through you! (A first-hand example of touching the lives around us).

story:
Independence Is True Freedom

As per WHO, globally there are 285 million visually impaired people, of whom 39 million are blind. 56% of the blind are women and 90% of them live in poverty. This community experiences many challenges in performing simple daily activities. Most of them are dependent on their friends and family to help them accomplish these tasks. But it is unrealistic to think that someone will always be around for 24 x 7 to assist. The pandemic situation is adding more to their existing challenges.

Audible Vision App is an effort towards making a meaningful impact towards this community. App will leverage accessible technology and artificial intelligence to help them be independent by helping them perform some of the daily chores on their own and help stay safe during the pandemic.

As Helen Keller rightly said -  "There is no better way to thank God for your sight than by giving a helping hand to someone in the dark."

One App – Multipurpose

App is built on Artificial intelligence (AI) technology and has a very simple and intuitive voice driven UI interface for ease of operation. AI modules will process video and images form camera to assist users perform a specific task. It is a one shop stop to handle many routine activities like:

1. Smart Text - Identify product name or nearby shop names.

2. Expiry Date – First ever app to detect expiry date of products.

3. Pandemic Safety – First ever app to integrate this feature in an app specifically made for visually challenged users.In current pandemic situation, it is even more challenging for the blind people to know if their surrounding is safe.

Mask detector - If a person is wearing mask or not.

Crowd detector - Equally important is to identify if the commute path is not crowded.
This app will help users to make right choices through advanced machine learning visual processing.

4. Find Text – Search a specific product or shop through it's name. For example, if a user wants to find a specific medicine in a medical box; instead of reading all the text, user can ask for a specific medicine name to be searched and the app will alert as soon as it's camera is directed towards it.

5. Document – Read books or text documents.

6. Barcode – Read barcode to get product information if available.

7. Voice commands & feedback – The app can be controlled using voice commands and the results will be communicated through voice or sound.

FREE App - Most of the apps developed for this community have expensive subscriptions or annoying popping Ads at regular intervals. Our app is free for users and all features are accessible with a non intrusive Ads. Ads can be removed through a nominal cost subscription.
This model will help us cover app support and maintenance costs and at the same time, users with low income (which forms a large base of this community) can access all app features for free.

User Privacy - Some apps require users to share their data and usage. With our app, user data is secure and is not transmitted to our server or with any third party.

Find more at http://audiblevision.in

 

Download Beta App

 

Our Story

13+ years of technology expertise. We are a small team of enthusiastic technologists. It fascinates us to see the possibilities of solving real world problems with the help of technology.

Most of our app concepts are based on real world personal experiences. So is the case with ‘Audible Vision’ app. I have a high myopia since childhood. Living a normal life without spectacle is an impossible task. Its not difficult to imagine the struggles that the blind people either by birth or due to sudden vision loss need to face in day to day life. Hence the strong motivation to create a positive impact for the visually impaired and blind community. That’s how this idea got incepted.

We are determined to bring this app to life and are totally committed towards it. So far, we have developed the alpha app, beta app design, social media presence, and this campaign - all with self funding.

The Plan

 

Need For Funding

1. Leveraging 3rd party paid services to improve functional accuracy.

2. Additional developers are needed for improving A.I. prediction model and UI design.

3. Infrastructure and other costs - machine learning platform requires high end CPU and GPU hardware to work effectively, we are leveraging low cost options for now. But with some funds, we will be able to up our game and this will help to fine tune the machine learning model.

4. Collaborating with the blind institutions and training people.

Phase 1: Estimated budget - $15,300

Stretch Goals

1. Phase 2: Additional Features - $30K

Adding features like currency detector, generalized environment sensing, specific object detector like stair case, lift, etc. and additional language support.

2. Phase 3: Apple iOS app – $50K

Recent estimates from the World Health Organization indicate that vast majority of all those affected by visual impairment live in the poorest countries of the world. This population can only afford less expensive android mobiles. Poverty is both a cause and effect of visual and other disabilities that increase social divisions. That is the reason we are initially prioritizing the development of Android app.

For iOS development, we will need to hire iOS developers and invest in hardware i.e. iphone and mac devices. Apple store fees. Work on validating compatibility of machine learning models.

- The more we raise, the better the app will be!

Functional Prototype Demo

Risks & Challenges

Even though this app has low-risk, following are some:

1. A.I. model for precise prediction of product names, expiry date detection or human faces with or without mask requires serious GPU power hardware. As the training data will increase for improving accuracy, we will need to subscribe for additional premium services at some point.

2. There can be some risks in approval and deployment from Google store that are out of our control. The risk is very low and we do not anticipate any problems, but it’s a process that we do not control.

How you can support us

  • Back this campaign now! Help us reach the funding goal!
  • Tell your network that you support Audible Vision and tell them why
  • Follow & share us
    • Facebook
    • Twitter
    • Instagram

With your help we will be able to reach the finish line in helping visually impaired and the blind community to be independent. Join us in making this world a better place to live for all.

story:
Time to get a group X studio back in Newberg

The pandemic was hard on all of us in different ways. One of the saddest days was when Newberg Oregon’s Excell Fitness, a beloved gym and community gathering place, closed its doors for good in December of 2020. This wasn’t just any gym. Excell was a place of connection, accountability, growth and joy. Parents could bring their young children to the kids room and enjoy an hour to take care of themselves. Lifelong friendships were formed here. Members and staff would often comment on how everyone there felt like family. There’s a reason for this--people bond in special ways when they do something challenging together. 

 

We need a cycling and group exercise studio back in our community now more than ever.

 

Why group exercise is so beneficial:

Accountability

Higher intensity

Endorphins

Feedback from trained professionals

Lifelong bonds, friendships and connections

FUN!

 

We, Kara Johnson, Diane Kenney and Crystal Merrow, are highly trained and committed fitness instructors who worked closely together throughout the pandemic. We stayed loyal to Excell Fitness (a long-time workplace for us) during the first shutdown, teaching free facebook live classes for months. After the gym closed for good, we wanted a way to keep our community together. Two months later we started Level Up Cycle and Fitness, currently a virtual gym offering a full schedule of Zoom classes. 

 

Where YOU come in:

This is where you get to jump in with us! Our plan is to open a brick and mortar studio, complete with childcare, in the Newberg area this coming fall. With everything opening back up and all of us longing for that in-person experience, NOW is the time. For those currently working out with us from afar we also plan on continuing to stream live classes. This is a chance to make a difference. To be a part of something really good, healing, and uplifting after a long, tough year and a half. 

 

We, Diane, Crystal and Kara, are hard-working women. We’re passionate about serving and enhancing the lives of our community members. We also have families--children and hard-working husbands who support us. We are calling on you, our family, friends, community members and overall advocates for GOOD to make this happen without putting our personal finances at risk.

 

While we looked into taking out a business loan it quickly became clear that this is not an option for a couple reasons: banks will not grant a business loan to any business that has not been up and running for less than two or three years. We have also been advised not to start with debt (makes sense). Therefore our only option is this one--crowd funding.

 

We actually did try another approach to gaining startup funds for a studio. Thinking outside the box, Diane Kenney put herself out there and entered a Facebook-based contest titled “Yoga Warrior”. Diane was the face of this “campaign”, but we were all working hard to get her the votes required to win the $10,000 cash prize. While the community stepped up and showed overwhelming support, she was not able to make it into the final rounds. Ultimately, though, the experience was encouraging. It showed that there was indeed a desire in our community for group fitness again. . 

 

Why we need $65,000--Breakdown of Donation Spending 

 
  • Equipment $35,000 (bikes, weights, mats, lockers, racks, sound system)
  • Facility Costs $20,000 (deposit, lease, insurance, mirrors, point of sale terminal and utilities)
  • Facility Supplies $5,000 (cleaning supplies and equipment, towels, bins, cabinets) 
  • Indiegogo Fees = 5% of funds raised + 30 cents per contribution (includes platform and credit card fees) approximately $3,000
  • Miscellaneous/Contingency Expenses = $2,000

 

Perks (what you get!)

$1 - A heartfelt high-five or fist bump! Not bad for less than the cost of a pack of gum. 

 

$10 - Handwritten and truly meaningful “Thank You” Note. 

 

$20 - Love a good souvenir? Get a signed picture of Crystal, Diane and Kara in front of the new studio!

 

$30 - Limited Edition Level Up women’s tank top - (3 smalls and 2 large available) 

 

$50 - Party Time!! One ticket to our Grand Opening Party!! Hors d’oeuvres included (20 available)

 

$100 - Patron Ambassador Status. Bragging rights available (not required) on the Level Up Facebook page.

 

$200 - Advocate Ambassador Status. Bragging rights available (not required) on Level Up, Crystal, Diane and Kara’s Facebook pages.

 

$400 - The early bird gets the worm. All-inclusive 6-month membership. (10 available)

 

$1,000 - Dare me to get a tattoo? OK, Crystal will get the Level Up logo tattoo and live stream it. (1 available)

 

$1,000 - Champion Ambassador Status. Bragging rights available (not required) on Level Up, Crystal, Diane and Kara’s Facebook, Instagram and Website pages. 

 

$3,000 - Your golden ticket! The fast lane to Champion Ambassador status and One Lifetime All-inclusive Membership. If we’re open, you’re in! (10 available) 

 

$5,000 - Become a sponsor. Your name and/or business logo will be proudly displayed on all Level Up social media sites, on a Proud Sponsors banner inside the studio and used at any and all community events, markets and activities in 2022. Aren’t you a marketing genius!! 

Together we can fill the void and lift this community up. Can’t wait to partner with you in this, and, of course, to see you in class!

story:
Introducing Mentis

Liam McClintock:  I am a senior D1 athlete involved in Greek life at Yale and balancing a busy work schedule. The need to be more productive after social nights of drinking led me to partner with Margaret to create the best defense against a hangover that science could provide.

Margaret Morse: I am a senior Molecular, Cellular and Developmental Biology Major at Yale who worked with Yale professors and outside advisors to research and develop a supplement, Mentis, which combats the underlying causes of a hangover.

We are joined by two advisors: 

John Friedman has experience in healthcare venture capital as CEO of Easton Capital, serving on the board of several biotech and pharmaceutical companies. He provides business guidance and product advice.

Andrew Young is an MIT graduate who works for McKinsey and co-founded an energy chew company called Revivo. He brings entrepreneurial experience and aids in product development.

Hangovers cost the U.S. over $200 billion according to the Center for Disease Control and Prevention. That's about $1.37 for each drink consumed by Americans! Together with your help we are aiming to prevent the damaging effects of alcohol on the body, terrible feelings of hangover, and productivity lost due to alcohol hangovers.

 

How it works

Mentis aims to address the four root causes of a hangover: 

Basically the combination of nutrients in Mentis are intended to prime your body for alcohol consumption. For a more in-depth explanation of the science behind our formula, click here. 

Below is a full list of ingredients in Mentis:

  • L-Glutamine
  • N-Acetyl L-Cysteine
  • Sulforaphane (from broccoli extract)
  • Epigallocatechin gallate (from green tea extract)
  • Mung bean powder
  • Sodium
  • Vitamin C
  • Vitamin B1 (as thiamine hcl)
  • Vitamin B2 (as riboflavin)
  • Vitamin B3 (as niacin and niacinamide)
  • Vitamin B6 (as pyridoxine hcl)
  • Vitamin B12 (as cyanocobalamin)
  • Magnesium aspartate
  • Zinc (as aspartate and monomethionine)
  • Potassium

 

How we came up with the formula

We both put in countless hours of research in developing our formula for Mentis. For the past seven months we have strived to answer one question: How can modern science prevent hangovers? 

Answering this question has involved a two-step process. First, we learned about the physiological effects of alcohol on the body, and read all of the scientific literature on the causes of hangover symptoms. After identifying the root causes, the second step involved researching nutrients and compounds that have been shown in studies to combat the processes that lead to hangovers.

Once we had a general idea for our formula, we wrote up our findings (which we encourage you to check out here) and sent out our paper to various nutritionists and Yale professors, meeting with them and incorporating their feedback on the science behind our formula. We also partnered with a pharmaceutical manufacturer, which provided further advice on our final formulation based on years of experience creating supplements.

We then ordered the ingredients online and mixed together various combinations until we had ourselves and our test panel feeling hangover-free after drinking, accounting for factors such as type of alcohol and duration of sleep. 

 

Why we are running this campaign

Our pharmaceutical manufacturer requires $20,000 in order to produce a minimum production run of Mentis packets. This includes packaging, flavoring, and blending the formula, as well as certifying its safety for consumption. Essentially this campaign is a way for you to pre-order Mentis, while helping us make it available for others online and in retail.

 

Additional information

The final Mentis product should be delivered to your doorstep no later than the end of April. All rewards include a pass to Mentis's kickoff launch party at Yale (you must be 21+ years old to attend) by the end of April. Please drink responsibly.

Mentis is expected to retail at $5 per serving. 

Please check out our website for more information. If you have any questions regarding our campaign, feel free to email us at contact@mentislife.com. Thanks!

Legal Disclaimer:

These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease. 

Please use under medical supervision and consult your doctor before consuming any drug, supplement or food.

We'd love to keep in touch, join us on Social Media, or join our community through The Heart Movement App:

story:
The Naked Truth

Did you know that 1 in 5 adults suffers from a mental health condition such as depression, bipolar, anxiety, and schizophrenia? According to the Health and Human Services Office of Minority Health, African Americans are 20% more likely to experience serious mental health problems than the general population. When we examine the statistics and realize how ethnicity, socioeconomic status, environmental factors, stigma, and other barriers play a role in one's access to traditional treatment or willingness to seek therapy, it appears to be an injustice.

“Behind the Mask: My Naked Truth”  is an educational documentary which examines the proximal mechanisms in which stigmas are formulated. It also serves as a vehicle to provide those living with a mental health condition, a means to communicate their lived realities to the masses―ultimately shedding light on the pain and the needs of those suffering in silence.

 

We Will Listen!

"Behind the Mask: My Naked Truth" is created and executive produced by national bestselling author, N’Tyse, CEO of A Million Visions Productions and our award-winning director Arthur Muhammad of "Carter High”, (starring Charles Dutton, Vivica Fox, Pooch Hall, David Banner ... ).  Joining us is the National Association of Mental Illness (NAMI) ambassador, licensed psychotherapist and former Miss International, Miss Elise Banks, student and staff psychologist (Southern Methodist University) Dr. Abel Tomatis, and Congresswoman Eddie Bernice Johnson, along with a host of other guests.

Your Pledge Matters

With your support, we can have the mental health conversation aloud and truly make a difference in our community! When we reach our $3,000.00  fundraising goal through our Indiegogo campaign, it will allow our team to begin principal photography and further our research studies. Your contribution is critical to our success. How inspiring it is, to know that your support is not only helping us to produce an educational film, but that collectively, we will have a vital role in this shift in consciousness.        

#IWillListen #WeWillListen #BehindTheMaskFilm #LetsHaveTheConversation

You can also lend a helping hand by becoming a project ambassador. Contact Lu'Netta McGraw or Ayanna Verser via email at info.amvps@gmail.com to get acquainted and receive your first assignment. Please be sure to include BTM Ambassador in the Subject line. And if you’re curious, our ambassadors receive the red carpet treatment as well.

story:
I grew up with ADHD in a time when it wasn’t understood, I had a hard time in life. It wasn’t until my late 20’s that I discovered belly breathing. This effective technique had a profound effect on me personally and helped lead me to where I am today.  As a mother, yoga teacher and mindfulness instructor, I spend a lot of time working with children who have difficulties with attention, whether from anxiety, trauma, depression, or attention deficit disorders.  Often calming is necessary for the class and individuals to function. Since I have personally experienced the benefits of belly breathing, I have shared this with my students, including my own children, with impressive results.  It was tricky figuring out how to teach children the abstract concept of diaphragmatic breathing to children, while keeping them engaged long enough to experience the benefits. That’s when I created BellieBuddies!

BellieBuddies are little plush toys, designed to ergonomically fit on a child’s belly. They were designed with weighted tummies to provide bio-feedback, are tall enough to be seen while lying down, and are wide enough to prevent falling off.  BellieBuddies are a fun and simple way to teach breath to kids so it actually makes sense to them. Breathing with a BellieBuddie is like playing a fun game with your breath. This keeps kids engaged long enough to experience some of the benefits, such as relaxation, balance, mood stabilization, and stress release. Using classical conditioning principals, children relate BellieBuddie breathing to feelings of wellbeing.  This activates the reward centers in the brain, making them want to do it again and again, triggering these positive effects.  We all know that when we do things repetitively, we condition ourselves to have an automatic response.  Imagine if you could help your children learn to have an automatic response of relaxation, instead of stress or anxiety.  I know this is possible, as I have seen it work with many of my students!  That is why I created BellieBuddies.

I am asking for your help.  The first stage, the design and production of the first BellieBuddie, Sakhe, the dolphin, is complete. The money from this campaign will be used for the second phase which is the creation of companion books, training videos for educators, downloadable meditations, stories, and mindfulness videos for kids. If we go over our goal we will use those funds for stage 3 which is more animal designs, website resources, and advertising strategy.  The sooner we get the BellieBuddie project funded, the more families we can serve by introducing them to the benefits of belly breathing and mindfulness.

We are asking you to purchase a ‘raw’ BellieBuddie, meaning just the plush toy without the companion book or training videos, which are still under development, pending the success of this funding effort.  When you purchase your BellieBuddie today, you will receive your very own Sakhe, the dolphin within 4 weeks.

We are confident that we will reach our goal of selling 1,200 BellieBuddies. However, if we do not, we will use the money we do raise to further develop the full BellieBuddie concept, with the meditation downloads and training videos first on our list.  We appreciate your help and support and would LOVE to see you with Sahke, the dolphin in your home. Thank you.

Please consider helping BellieBuddies reach our goal by sharing campaign on Social media.

story:
About me and some background

ENG/日本語

Hello, and thanks for visiting my IndieGoGo campaign page. My name is Mio Nakamura, 39 years old woman, who lives in Tokyo JAPAN. My friends suggested me and I thought this is the time for crowdfunding, so I am typing this right now. (I supposed to launch on GoFundMe, but they don't support for Japanese citizen.)

On the 17th of May 2017, I got a high fever and passed out at work. A few days later, my knee started swelling aggressively and I had to stay in the hospital straight away. I was diagnosed with a malignant tumor which name is “Undifferentiated Pleomorphic Sarcoma”, incidence rate is 1/100,000.
In July of that year, sarcoma has been removed, After some months of chemotherapy, but still had possibilities of metastasis and recurrence. I considered for the next decades of years and quality of life, so I decided and got amputation surgery as my doctor recommended in January 2018.

 

私の名前は中村美緒です。日本・東京在住の39歳の女性です。友人の提案により、まさに今がそのときではないかと思い、初めてクラウドファンディングを利用することにしました。（医療系に特化したGoFundMeを使いたかったのですが、現在日本人には利用できません。）

2017年の5月17日、職場で勤務中に突然の高熱に襲われ、同時に右ひざが猛烈に腫れ始め、即時入院することになりました。精密検査の結果、悪性腫瘍であり、10万人に1人の発症率といわれる「未分化多形成肉腫」という肉腫であると診断されました。
同年7月、肉腫を摘出ののち、数ヶ月の抗がん剤治療はやや効果がみられましたが、転移・再発の可能性を拭い去れることはなく、今後の人生の質などを考慮した結果、2018年1月に足切断手術をするに至りました。

Things I need are...

I have been in rehabilitation center 3 months and getting training 5 days a week at the moment. I suppose to leave here pretty soon, And choosing my first prosthetic leg, it will cost me $15,000. 

Details:
Socket parts/ $2,000
Knee parts/ ossur TK2000/ $5,000
Leg parts/ $4,300
Foot parts/ ottoboch 1C30, TK-2052/ $2,000
Silicon liner/ $1,000
Leg cover/ $200
Stump socks x 6, and stocking/ $500

現在は都内の施設で週5日のリハビリテーションを受けています。もうすぐ退院の見込みですが、義足代として総額150万円必要です。購入予定のものは以下一式です：

ソケット部品/ 20万円
膝部品/ オズール社 TK2000/ 50万円
脚部品/ 43万円
足部品/ オットボック社 1C30, TK-2052/ 20万円
シリコンライナー/ 10万円
脚部スポンジ外装/ 2万円
断端袋 x 6、ストッキング/ $500

My Passion, BurningMan

I am making great progress learning to walk to get back to life. I really am hoping to go to “Burning Man 2018” in August with this prosthetic leg. This is biggest goal for this year!
この義足をつけ、いちはやく実生活へ戻り自立し、8月下旬アメリカで開催される「バーニングマン」へ参加するのが目標です。

Thank you for reading this far!

A donation of any kind will be greatly appreciated and a huge help. Also, please feel free to share to anyone you think might be interested.Thank you for your time and consideration of this effort to help! Love to all everyone.

Sincerely,
-Mio Nakamura

この状況に理解・共感していただくことができましたら、ぜひご支援を宜しくお願い致します。またご友人、興味のある方へのシェアをお願いします！
中村美緒

story:
A Summary of My Allergy ID

We are a group of under 18 girls from Newcastle and we have started My Allergy ID as part of the Young Enterprise scheme, which we hope to succeed in as well as make an impact on the catering industry. We hope to empower sufferers of food allergies to be able to make more informed decisions about what they eat, no matter where and what they are eating.

Our idea stemmed from the headlined, shocking stories in the news recently of food allergy suffers dying after consuming products from high-street cafes, which were incorrectly labelled. After seeing these stories we knew that something had to change; this terrible mistake could easily reoccur and have an equally devastating result. So, we have created My Allergy ID, an app which will eradicate this problem and massively aid both consumers and eateries, which we are in collaboration with, when it comes to food allergens.

We would really appreciate your help and funding as, with this our app has the potential to save lives and change the way food-allergy sufferers eat forever.

What We Need & What You Get

We hope to raise £500 and with this we can work to further developing our app . We as a company do not need £500 pounds so we will be donating a quarter of the money we raise to The Anaphylaxis Campaign. This is charity solely focused on supporting people at risk of severe allergic reactions, which is exactly the group of people we hope to support. Your funds would help us to launch our app as soon as possible, before this error could be made again and another life could be taken due to a easily-made mistake.

The Impact

It is clear to see what a huge impact our app could have on, not only the UK, but in time the world at large. This is going to change the way food-allergen sufferers eat forever - with security and comfort. I am sure if you, yourself, either suffer from food-allergies or know someone who does, you will know what a massive burden this can be for some people and what major precautions they need to take. This app will be so valuable to the world and the catering industry, because of its promotion of ease, convenience but most importantly safety.

Risks & Challenges

Due to our age, we have little expertise in approaching larger businesses in the catering sector. This is a step we need to take to generate awareness and also to start to amke our way into larger highstreet chain stores, where it will have the most impact. We have already generated great interest from a few one-store cafes and plan to trail our app here as soon as it is launched. To overcome this we have contacted a particular highstreet cafe for guidance and advice on approaching larger businesses, which has been really valuable and helpful.

We are aware that creating an app has its risks due to the nature of it being a huge success or just a flop. However, we really believe in what we have created and we have no doubt that it has the potential to become a huge success and one day something that people will struggle to consider not having. We are prepared to take this risk due to such strong belief that it could change the catering industry and the way people eat forever.

Other Ways You Can Help

If contributing is not an option for you, there are many other ways you can help us. Something we are focusing on at the moment is getting the word out and raising awareness of our app and this campaign. This is a key element and any support in anyway would be hugely appreciated. So please share our campaign on social media by using Indiegogo share tools because we believe our app has the potential to save lives and to the mass it provides the security and safety when buying food, that is missing in the industry at present.
