story:
Chonkers are Premium Therapeutic Stuffed Animals  that allow you to add calming weight, heat, scent, and more to naturally relax.     

With a variety of interchangeable Sensory Packs,  Chonkers allow you endless options to adjust to your preferences or mood. You can add weight up to 8 lbs, microwavable heat, cooling, and relaxing scents to customize to what calms you.

Chonkers are specifically designed to help find what calms you and recreate that relaxation technique.

 

Anxiety is not one size fits all and neither is how you manage it, which is why we designed Chonkers to be compatible with multiple interchangeable Sensory Packs.

 

The combination of different Sensory Packs allows you to take advantage of a variety of occupational therapy techniques shown to help manage anxiety and improve mood, customizing your Chonker for what is most effective for you.

 

 

 

 

Calming  

 

Comfort

 

 

Customizable

 

 

 

Meet Chonky Bear! For pre-order we will be offering perks for supporters of an adorably chubby version of a classic Teddy Bear, Chonky Bear and a selection of 4 different Sensory Packs.  

 

Chonky Bear is a premium super-soft plush Bear built to be durable while remaining soft and breathable. The bear is 16" in height so large enough for adults as well as children, but able to be condensed for traveling by removing packs. 

 

The back of Chonky Bear features a hidden zippered enclosure to add multiple Sensory Packs. The enclosure is double-lined to support up to 8 lbs of weight. 

 

Each Sensory Pack is designed to be soft and cuddlable within your Chonker but has a different feel, weight, or effect that makes it unique. All packs are easily removable and can be used alone or with any other pack. 

 

There will be 4 different Sensory Packs to choose from at launch: Weight, Heat, Heat + Lavender, and Plush. You can include up to 2 packs at once to add up to 8 lbs of weight or to combine effects like heat and weight.

 

 Adding weight allows you to take advantage of a therapeutic technique known as deep touch stimulation, a  method of adding concentrated pressure to the body to calm the nervous system and promote relaxation.         

This technique has become popular among Occupational Therapists and in hospitals as a natural method to calm anxiety. The weight provides a sensation of security much like you experience from cuddling, receiving a hug, or a child being swaddled.        

Each weighted pack is 4 lbs and each Chonker can hold 2 packs at a time. There is no particular perfect weight for everybody as it is largely a matter of preference and can change over time as you acclimate to the sensation; however, between plush, heat, and weighted packs you can go from 1 lb to 8 lbs in seconds to find the perfect weight for you.

Heat Sensory Packs allow you to warm up your Chonker to take advantage of the soothing physical and mental benefits of Heat Therapy. Pop your Heat Sensory Pack in the microwave for 1 minute and it will remain warm for over 2 hours within your Chonker. Add it to the freezer for 2 hours and it will stay cool for an hour.         

Applying heat to areas of your body can naturally soothe and improve the flow of oxygen through your blood stream.  The improved blood flow is why heat packs have been popular for so long when sick or recovering from an injury, or dealing with cramps as it increases the extensibility of collagen tissues, decreasing joint stiffness, pain and relieving muscles in a post-acute phase of healing while increasing the flow of proteins, nutrients, and oxygen to the affected area.

The Heat packs are also able to be cooled to help with pain management and general comfort.  Like using ice packs or ice baths, cold is great for recovery by reducing blood flow to a particular area of your body you can help reduce inflammation and pain.

There is nothing worse than trying to sleep through hot, sticky summer nights, CHONKERS are the "cool side of the pillow" that will stay cooler longer. Beyond just comfort, the temperature can be very helpful as soothing sensory input for calming panic attacks, over-stimulation, or anger episodes.

The Heat + Lavender Sensory Packs have the same effects as the Heat Pack but with  the additional benefit of Lavender added. 

Using scents as a relaxation aid has been used for ages and is known as Aromatherapy. Aromatherapy is simply the use of scents to trigger a reaction from your mind. The connections that your mind makes to particular scents can trigger this without you even knowing. Adding naturally calming scents like Lavender stimulates relaxing responses from your brain's limbic system. This works very similar to using a relaxing scented candle, a bubble bath, a sleep spray, essential oils, or sleeping with comforting smell of a loved ones sweatshirt to help you calm down or sleep better.

The Plush Sensory Pack allows you to fluff up your Chonker while adding minimal weight.  The plush pack is similar to a traditional teddy bear with a cushy soft feel that still plumps up his belly depending on how stuffed you want him while continuing to allow you to control the weight.

 

 The Team

Our team of designers and product experts has been working with occupational therapists to create new sensory products for people with anxiety, depression, autism/ASD, and other disorders for 5 years. 

Personally, throughout my life I have lived with social and generalized anxiety and sought methods to help manage it. In Kindergarten, I used to cut off a small piece of my favorite blanket to keep in my pocket to help me calm me down but have continued to create for effective options in the years since. In 2015, I discovered how the effects of deep pressure could help me calm down and began trying weighted blankets which were popular in the ASD community at the time. While I found them helpful, I also found them to be expensive, bulky, hot, and primarily made in child sizes.

I started making my own versions of these blankets to improve them working closely with others using the products and Occupational Therapists to create more affordable and accessible options, eventually founding a company to produce high-quality sensory bedding in 2016. Weighted blankets grew in popularity and became cheaper and better quality, but the inspiration for Chonkers came while still looking for ways to improve on some of the challenges customers and I continued to face like overheating, portability, price, and finding/adapting to the perfect weight even 5 years later.

The solution ended up not being bedding at all but a stuffed animal that could utilize more natural occupational therapy techniques and be personalized to the individual. Chonkers can be used everyday, traveled with, and was more effective. Chonkers is a product that I love and am excited about the opportunity to share with the world.
story_txt: Chonkers are Premium Therapeutic Stuffed Animals  that allow you to add calming weight, heat, scent, and more to naturally relax.     With a variety of interchangeable Sensory Packs,  Chonkers allow you endless options to adjust to your preferences or mood. You can add weight up to 8 lbs, microwavable heat, cooling, and relaxing scents to customize to what calms you.Chonkers are specifically designed to help find what calms you and recreate that relaxation technique. Anxiety is not one size fits all and neither is how you manage it, which is why we designed Chonkers to be compatible with multiple interchangeable Sensory Packs.  The combination of different Sensory Packs allows you to take advantage of a variety of occupational therapy techniques shown to help manage anxiety and improve mood, customizing your Chonker for what is most effective for you.    Calming   Comfort  Customizable   Meet Chonky Bear! For pre-order we will be offering perks for supporters of an adorably chubby version of a classic Teddy Bear, Chonky Bear and a selection of 4 different Sensory Packs.   Chonky Bear is a premium super-soft plush Bear built to be durable while remaining soft and breathable. The bear is 16" in height so large enough for adults as well as children, but able to be condensed for traveling by removing packs.  The back of Chonky Bear features a hidden zippered enclosure to add multiple Sensory Packs. The enclosure is double-lined to support up to 8 lbs of weight.  Each Sensory Pack is designed to be soft and cuddlable within your Chonker but has a different feel, weight, or effect that makes it unique. All packs are easily removable and can be used alone or with any other pack.  There will be 4 different Sensory Packs to choose from at launch: Weight, Heat, Heat + Lavender, and Plush. You can include up to 2 packs at once to add up to 8 lbs of weight or to combine effects like heat and weight.  Adding weight allows you to take advantage of a therapeutic technique known as deep touch stimulation, a  method of adding concentrated pressure to the body to calm the nervous system and promote relaxation.         This technique has become popular among Occupational Therapists and in hospitals as a natural method to calm anxiety. The weight provides a sensation of security much like you experience from cuddling, receiving a hug, or a child being swaddled.        Each weighted pack is 4 lbs and each Chonker can hold 2 packs at a time. There is no particular perfect weight for everybody as it is largely a matter of preference and can change over time as you acclimate to the sensation; however, between plush, heat, and weighted packs you can go from 1 lb to 8 lbs in seconds to find the perfect weight for you.Heat Sensory Packs allow you to warm up your Chonker to take advantage of the soothing physical and mental benefits of Heat Therapy. Pop your Heat Sensory Pack in the microwave for 1 minute and it will remain warm for over 2 hours within your Chonker. Add it to the freezer for 2 hours and it will stay cool for an hour.         Applying heat to areas of your body can naturally soothe and improve the flow of oxygen through your blood stream.  The improved blood flow is why heat packs have been popular for so long when sick or recovering from an injury, or dealing with cramps as it increases the extensibility of collagen tissues, decreasing joint stiffness, pain and relieving muscles in a post-acute phase of healing while increasing the flow of proteins, nutrients, and oxygen to the affected area.The Heat packs are also able to be cooled to help with pain management and general comfort.  Like using ice packs or ice baths, cold is great for recovery by reducing blood flow to a particular area of your body you can help reduce inflammation and pain.There is nothing worse than trying to sleep through hot, sticky summer nights, CHONKERS are the "cool side of the pillow" that will stay cooler longer. Beyond just comfort, the temperature can be very helpful as soothing sensory input for calming panic attacks, over-stimulation, or anger episodes.The Heat + Lavender Sensory Packs have the same effects as the Heat Pack but with  the additional benefit of Lavender added. Using scents as a relaxation aid has been used for ages and is known as Aromatherapy. Aromatherapy is simply the use of scents to trigger a reaction from your mind. The connections that your mind makes to particular scents can trigger this without you even knowing. Adding naturally calming scents like Lavender stimulates relaxing responses from your brain's limbic system. This works very similar to using a relaxing scented candle, a bubble bath, a sleep spray, essential oils, or sleeping with comforting smell of a loved ones sweatshirt to help you calm down or sleep better.The Plush Sensory Pack allows you to fluff up your Chonker while adding minimal weight.  The plush pack is similar to a traditional teddy bear with a cushy soft feel that still plumps up his belly depending on how stuffed you want him while continuing to allow you to control the weight.  The TeamOur team of designers and product experts has been working with occupational therapists to create new sensory products for people with anxiety, depression, autism/ASD, and other disorders for 5 years. Personally, throughout my life I have lived with social and generalized anxiety and sought methods to help manage it. In Kindergarten, I used to cut off a small piece of my favorite blanket to keep in my pocket to help me calm me down but have continued to create for effective options in the years since. In 2015, I discovered how the effects of deep pressure could help me calm down and began trying weighted blankets which were popular in the ASD community at the time. While I found them helpful, I also found them to be expensive, bulky, hot, and primarily made in child sizes.I started making my own versions of these blankets to improve them working closely with others using the products and Occupational Therapists to create more affordable and accessible options, eventually founding a company to produce high-quality sensory bedding in 2016. Weighted blankets grew in popularity and became cheaper and better quality, but the inspiration for Chonkers came while still looking for ways to improve on some of the challenges customers and I continued to face like overheating, portability, price, and finding/adapting to the perfect weight even 5 years later.The solution ended up not being bedding at all but a stuffed animal that could utilize more natural occupational therapy techniques and be personalized to the individual. Chonkers can be used everyday, traveled with, and was more effective. Chonkers is a product that I love and am excited about the opportunity to share with the world.

story:
About Us

Sway Soturi has been a personal trainer and group fitness coach since 2014. Her passion for fitness began after the birth of her son, Lucious. Her excitement for sharing this passion with others, coupled with a desire for knowledge in health and fitness has grown stronger each day.

Sway wants to create an impact in the community. She wants to show people that they can be healthy and gain results through simple practices.
 

Damian Mark has been a professional chef in private restaurants, country clubs, and hotels for the last 18 years. He has worked all over the United States and spent time in Europe honing his craft. He loves food, is passionate about of cooking, and most of all he loves to teach. 

Soturi Fitness and Nutrition will be a community within a community — a place to practice physical fitness, nutrition and mindful health, in California's Silicon Valley. Creating this facility means we can work with more people to create a larger impact on health in the community.

The Soturi Fitness and Nutrition studio will provide a comprehensive wellness experience, without fad diets or fad workout plans. We will offer a variety of fitness classes and health related workshops because we trust in the power of continuing education. Our coaches and fellow members will provide accountability and encouragement for each other. 

We believe it's never too late to set foundations for a healthy lifestyle but we also believe it's easier when you start early so we encourage whole family participation in this journey. 

With your help we can get the gym up and running faster and begin changing lives sooner!

 

What We Need & What It Is For

We are looking to raise $50,000 on Indiegogo (while at the same time applying for a SBA loan). We want to get started as soon as possible!

The funds raised will help us:

  • Add a communal kitchen space.
  • Purchase a portion of the equipment needed.
  • Help with continued education with our coaches to better serve the community. 
  • Create programs for community outreach. 

 

Below is a rough sketch of our functional movement layout:

​

What if we don't reach our goal?

We will still use the funds for the above purposes. We are determined to build this facility no matter what!

How we are different than other gyms!

  • Communal kitchen space -
    • Members are encouraged to use this space before and after their workouts (or anytime) to prepare healthy food. 
    • Scheduled cooking workshops to teach the community how to shop, prep, and cook healthy meals efficiently. 
    • Community cooking and dinner events (including food drive and volunteering events).
  • We see our members as individuals. Since no two people are the same, we aim to help people reach their goals in ways that are suitable to their lifestyle.
  • We understand and emphasize the importance of a balanced lifestyle -
    • We encourage members to take a variety of classes, the yin and the yang. 
    • We don't neglect recovery - including healthy eating and rest.
    • We partner with a world-renowned nutrition coaching program powered by Nutrition Precision. 
    • That doesn't mean we don't have fun! We still love ice cream and chocolates; we just enjoy them more mindfully and in moderation. 

Below is our class schedule for when we open:

  • We are actively involved with community programs, such as non-profits and schools. 
  • FunHouse Kids -
    • A kids care program to genuinely engage your child with structured classes so they can share the love of a healthy life.
    • Schedules will include -
      • STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math)
      • Cooking
      • FunFood Factor
      • Arts and crafts
      • Dance
      • Kids fitness
      • Kids obstacle course 

 

The Impact

In addition to the many who seek a healthier life, there is an epidemic of an overweight, and unhappy people in the United States. Many of our youth are not taught the importance of nutrition and healthy living in school or at home and they grow up without a foundation in health. At Soturi Fitness and Nutrition, we are working to empower the community through proper tools and information to live healthier lives. Education and empowerment are our best weapons to support those looking to create healthier lives for themselves and their families.

Soturi Fitness and Nutrition will be working with organizations to help kids live healthier, but that is only the beginning.  We have big dreams (including starting our own health and nutrition foundation and working with a wide variety of non-profits) to reach a wider population and make sure kids are supported too!

We need to be kinder to ourselves and to the world. And by doing so, we can all make this world a better place.

 

Risks & Challenges

We are determined to build this gym! We are in the process of applying for a SBA loan, and the funds raised here will help us build the entire gym the way we envision thus making a bigger impact, instead of scaling it down and taking longer to reach the wider community as we hope to do. 

Check out our website at SoturiFitnessAndNutrition.com

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to contribute financially, but there are definitely other ways you can help us share our mission!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on the top right to share on social media - Facebook / Instagram / Twitter.
  • Talk about Soturi Fitness and Nutrition with your friends, family, co-workers, teachers, students, bartenders, servers, cab drivers, mailman, milkman, exes, and newspaper delivery kids (if they still exist!)

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
LoveALL5D's Mission is to share Pure Love Energy with ALL.

But what is Pure Love Energy, you ask? 

It is the place of pure wisdom, of creative energy, of pure love, of instant healing, of manifestations and the highest truth. That “place” is within each of us but most have no idea it exists. Pure Love Energy returns you to your perfect, natural and divine state of being. This is the power of unconditional love. 

After years of trying to uncover how we could share Pure Love Energy, we finally arrived at our answer...an App (sound the angels singing). Avaala is a conscious App designed to support you on your Soul Path while connecting you to your Soul Community. 

The time has come to take our own growth into our hands, our own destiny back into our hearts, go inward and embark on our journey.  The Revolution has begun; it is the Evolution of Consciousness. We invite you to join us. 

~ Mikko, Founder/CCO LoveALL5D & Avaala  

 

What We Need & What You Get

The work has already begun as the Avaala founders & SparkLabsNetwork have been busy creating the App, but there is more to be done before launching in May 2020. 

Without giving it all away, imagine being immersed in beautifully, conscious curated content and experiences. While the App supports your own personal journey, community will be a significant part of the overall experience.  There will be opportunity to work with facilitators one-on-one or in group settings. For example, you will be able to sit in a virtual fire circle with healers, angels, and guides. Or even in a women's circle in the Andes virtually. Pretty amazing, right?

Through this App technology, ALL of the Pure Love Energy can be accessed by you. You will be able to create a profile. This is not your average profile. This is a sacred space where you'll be able process your own work, co-create with others and receive conscious content tailored to you. You will also be able to receive 24-7 Soul guidance and support.

We are offering you something now so you don't have to wait until we launch for you to feel this Pure Love Energy.   Please explore the PERKS we have created just for you in exchange for your support.  

* ALL the funds received will go into the operations costs (see below for details) for the completion of Avaala as an app. 

 

The Impact

We took many lifetimes to prepare a way for us to channel this Pure Love Energy into an app.  Many times in our journey we thought about giving up but found the heart to continue on.  We needed many years of trials and challenges for us to know we could embody Pure Love Energy and present it to the world. 

We left all attachments, the knowns and comforts behind with our two kids and two cats and journeyed across the US to create Avaala from Pure Love Energy.  Shaman Biji was a Media Technologist with a background in network television as a producer, writer, journalist, talent. During the Dot.com boom, she worked as an executive producer for a cutting edge video news Internet company.  This ignited the spark in her to create using both technology and media.  

Right Now the world is waking up to the realities of how we feel. We don't have the life we were promised or ever envisioned. Our world is centered around vibrations of lack and deprivation. We are exhausted and yet still unfulfilled.

It seems as if we can never have enough or be enough. We ask for more, new, different, better, and then feel overwhelmed, stuck and lost.  True Abundance is living in the vibration of being supported by the creative Universe and showing authentic gratitude for this sacred journey called life. Avaala, the app, is ready to contribute to your life. It’s time to activate and claim it now.

Avaala is a sacred mantra for Conscious Energy.  Avaala’s birth is Pure Love Energy. This energy has created a community which started on Instagram in 2017 and has organically grown to nearly 10,000 people. These fans will no doubt be the App's first customers. 

Don't take our word for it, come be a part of this Pure Love Energy Experience and join our social community.  Follow us on Instagram @loveall5d or join our private Facebook group by searching Love All 5D. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, we honor you as well. We invite you to share this campaign and help us spread this Pure Love Energy to everyone. Come be a part of the growing LoveALL5D community and experience ALL that is offered. 

Biji & Mikko have turned down investment offers in order to keep the authenticity and purity of this app, this mission, this energy, this love.  We are asking the beautiful hearts of beings like yourself who want to rise up to be a part of a global community and support this epic shift in consciousness. 

Love ALL. 

 

MEET THE TEAM

Mikko Carrea, CCO & Founder, LoveALL5D/Avaala 

  • 19+ years as a Creative 
  • High Ticket Live Event Scaling, Planning and Execution 
  • Coordinating Producer/Talent Acquisition for Nationally Syndicated Network Reality Show
  • Visual Design and Installation Curator for Museum of Arts, Los Angeles 
  • Music Production/DJ for Private & Live Events
  • Fandom App Concept Designer

Biji Carrea, CEO & Founder, LoveALL5D/Avaala 

  • +23 years of Media and Technology experience 
  • 10+  years Entrepreneur
  • 7 years Network Television (NBC/ABC) in Management and Production
  • Raised VC funding 
  • Technology Visionary in interactive media, online communities, social media

Hilary Allen (CMO)

  • 8 years in Brand Strategy  
  • 7 years of Media Planning & Buying experience 
  • Creator of Self Care Harder
  • 3 years of Direct Sales experience with #1 Skincare brand in North America 
  • Ambassador and Founding Member of plant-based nutrition company 

Ralph Kayden (Creative Director) 

  • Self-started successful marketing and advertising agency in Spain 
  • Since his Shamanic Apprenticship  Ralph has lost 70 plus lbs.,
  • Experiencing Avaala while living his dream life every day
  • Creating innovative and conscious content for our LoveALL5D platforms.  

Coralee (Operations)

  • BA in Communications
  • 10 years Management and customer service
  • 10 years Entrepreneur in the San Fransisco Bay area
  • Experienced Avaala through Shamanic healing
  • 6 month Shamanic Apprenticship

Hui Huang (Founder/CEO & Product Innovator)

  • 18+ years Technologist as a developer, architect, dev manager, and product owner
  • 3 years Chief Data Scientist & Director of Data Lab
  • 2 years CTO of Blockchain Startup for Supply Chain Finance
  • Industry experience: financial payment and audit for logistics & supply chain industry

Sudesh Sangelkar (Co-Founder & Business Strategy)

  • Solution leader in delivering innovative solutions in Financial Services, Insurance, Travel, Health Care, and government industries
  • 15+ years Account Management on delivering projects for fin-tech enterprise (Credit card, banking, and travel)
  • 4+ Director for business development, technical solution consulting and delivery

Sami Syed - 18 yr old Social Media Guru 

  • 4+ years as Founder of Social Media Marketing Agency with a team of 5
  • Self-taught social media expert who started making money online at 14 years old by figuring out how to buy and sell accounts 
  • Started his own agency as a teenager and now serving 35 clients

 

Break down of cost we have been provided with:

Operations of LoveALL5D $15,000/month 

App Cost: $149,240

Design : $19,060

Phase 1.0: $43,393

Phase 1.1: $43,393

Phase 1.2:  $43,393

Marketing for App/Launch  $50,000

***Check out the PERKS above we are offering to you to experience Pure Love Energy now in exchange for your generous heart-centered donation to contribute to this beautifully conscious App. We LOVE you and appreciate you.***

 Break down of cost we have been provided with:Operations of LoveALL5D $15,000/month App Cost: $149,240Design : $19,060Phase 1.0: $43,393Phase 1.1: $43,393Phase 1.2:  $43,393Marketing for App/Launch  $50,000***Check out the PERKS above we are offering to you to experience Pure Love Energy now in exchange for your generous heart-centered donation to contribute to this beautifully conscious App. We LOVE you and appreciate you.***

story:
Past, Present, and Future

Apollo Performing Arts Medicine is a traveling athletic training room for performers. I started Apollo to follow my dreams and provide athletic training services to an underserved population. I grew up in Northwest Georgia immersed in dance, choir, and musical theatre with dreams set on Broadway before finding a new passion for athletic training. Learning about performing arts medicine led to the realization that I could combine these two passions to create a fulfilling career in an exciting field. Apollo Performing Arts Medicine joins these two passions and is the product of my dreams and hard work. In the next few years, I would like to develop this company into a brick and mortar clinic with various health and wellness professionals coming together as a team to provide optimal support for our performing artists in South Florida.

The unique needs and environments of performing artists mean that their health is best managed by those skilled in treating this population. Apollo Performing Arts Medicine connects performers with healthcare practitioners experienced in performing arts medicine, many of whom are or were performers as well. Your contribution to this campaign will provide much needed and deserved medical services to performing artists.  

Where will the money go?

Your contributions will help fund the start-up costs of creating this company, such as LLC registration, permits and licenses, and more. Additional funds will go towards scholarships and discounted services to performers and programs in need. If you're interested in a detailed report of where we intend to spend the money from the campaign, please send us an email at ApolloPAMed@gmail.com. 

What services does Apollo Performing Arts Medicine provide?

Our current list of services includes:

  • Workshops: We offer a variety of subjects to educate people in the performing arts industry about healthcare that is specific to artists and their needs. 
  • Weekly Coverage: This is our most comprehensive service. It includes weekly visits to the rehearsal or performance space. The main services included are injury prevention and injury recovery, risk assessment, emergency action plan, referrals to other healthcare specialists (as needed), and case management.
  • Performance Day Coverage: Our athletic trainer will be present before, during, and after the performance and will provide services that ensure the safety of the performers and backstage support as well as helping the artists perform at their best.
  • One Day Clinics: We will set up a table at a studio, rehearsal space, camp, or event. We offer a la carte services, such as first aid, taping, injury evaluation, and manual therapy. 
  • Emergency Action Plans: We will develop a detailed emergency action plan for the practice or performance space and review it with the staff. 
  • Risk Assessments: We will tour the facilities and assess the stage, props, costumes, shoes, and more. We will then provide recommendations on how to reduce and prevent injuries.
  • Concierge Athletic Training: This service is primarily for freelance performers. We can offer any of the above services to individuals and will travel to them for treatment.

Supporting Performers

Apollo Performing Arts Medicine values a "big picture" approach to health care. Treating the problems is great; treating the causes is even better. We want to empower our performing artists to be both mentally and physically healthy so that they can perform at their best and have a brighter future. This starts with providing onsite support and access to needed services. Your financial contribution helps us ensure that more performing artists will have both. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, there are other ways you can help us!

  • Shop! We have an online store where you can purchase merchandise with our logo on it, and we will receive the profits from the sales to put towards our company. https://teespring.com/apollopamed
  • Share! Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign with friends, family, colleagues, and social media.
  • Network! Connect us with performers, directors, producers, healthcare providers, etc. We are always looking for performers and shows/productions who can use our services now or in the future. We are also building a referral network of healthcare providers and always enjoy sharing ideas and knowledge.
  • Other? If you've thought of another way you would like to help, send us an email! ApolloPAMed@gmail.com

Our Mission

  • Help performers treat pain and injuries so they can either continue their activities or return to activities more quickly as well as minimize long-term problems

  • Prevent injuries by assessing risks and offering solutions and strategies to reduce those risks

  • Develop emergency action plans to prepare for worst case scenarios

  • Build a multidisciplinary team of health professionals who understand the demands of performing arts and work together to treat any issues a performer or support staff may face

  • Educate performing artists about mental and physical health and how an athletic trainer or other healthcare professional can help 

  • Improve access to healthcare providers who are experienced in performing arts medicine

  • Advance the fields of athletic training and performing arts medicine

story:
New and expecting mothers often hear that breastfeeding infants is essential, not only for the health of their child, but also for the mother/newborn bond.  However, mothers often find that the resources and support required for breastfeeding success are lacking.  This campaign will fund the time and materials needed to provide assistance to families who lack the means to pay for these life-changing services, through my business Latch On Breastfeeding Services, LLC.

I am passionate about my career as a Registered Nurse (RN) and even more so as a Lactation Consultant.  Educating and supporting mothers and their newborns along their breastfeeding journey is my calling.  I have over 13 years of experience as Registered Nurse certified in neonatal intensive care and also am an Internationally Board Certified Lactation Consultant (IBCLC).  Through Latch On Breastfeeding Services families are provided with the instruction and ongoing support necessary to enable successful breastfeeding and bonding. And thereby positively impact the lives of these families emotionally, physically and economically.  

Every Dollar you contribute will assist with educating families about breastfeeding through in home prenatal classes and one on one counseling.

  • Prenatal education-  $100 will educate 1 family
  • In Home Consult-  $200 will provide 1 one to one counseling session

These numbers are based on supplies, transportation costs, and time commitment for services provided.  There will be no cost to the family receiving the service.  The target audience for service will be first time mothers. The goal is to help a minimum of 10 families in 2019.

story:
"We rise by lifting others" 
Robert Ingersoll

 

Who is Rowena Morais? 

Hi there, I am Rowena Morais. Wife, mom of three and at time of writing, 46 years old. An editor and writer based in Kuala Lumpur, who specialises in learning, communication and content. I run, lift weights and practise taekwondo. Diagnosed with Stage 2 breast cancer in June 2018, I am blown away by how quickly my life has shifted, both for me and those around me.

I am making sense as best I can of what has happened. I believe in taking action, finding my way around a problem and moving forward. The reason I'm sharing what I learn along the way is because I hope that it may be of use to those on similar journeys.

 

What is this charity campaign for?

Let's start with some simple worldwide statistics:

  • 18.1 million new cancer cases and 9.1 million deaths due to cancer in 2018 for both sexes, all ages  according to the International Agency for Research on cancer;
  • 2.1 million new breast cancer cases and 676 thousand deaths due to breast cancer in 2018;
  • Breast cancer is the most common cancer in the overwhelming majority of countries around the world, and 75% of deaths occur in low and middle-income countries.

As you can see, cancer is a problem that's been around for some time now and affects a great many people -  man, woman, old and young.

Infographic   source: The Economist

I am raising money for cancer research so that the vital work that needs to continue into cures, new breakthroughs, experimental drugs and innovative therapies may continue. As I am in Malaysia and getting treatment locally, I would like to direct the funds raised to a local non-profit organisation.

 

Who benefits from this charity campaign?

The beneficiary of this campaign is Cancer Research Malaysia, an independent and non-profit cancer research organisation based in Malaysia which is funded entirely by donations, research grants and the public. Cancer Research Malaysia conducts research into niche cancers often found in the Asian population.

 

What will you help achieve?

Your contribution, financial or otherwise, will help direct even more awareness, continued education and research into cancer as a whole.

We need to press for continued vigilance in how we actively manage our health because this is something we need to take charge of.

 

What are the goals of Cancer Research Malaysia?

  • Improving the survival rates of Asian cancer patients, focusing on neglected areas of research;
  • Empowering Asians to have the proper screening and treatment;
  • Improving survival rates by being more accessible, focusing on providing existing cures to patients rather than sit on inaction and potentially losing lives;
  • Making affordable and timely treatments by repurposing drugs, acknowledging the reality that developing new cures are costly and risky;
  • Putting Malaysia in the global spotlight for cancer research by collaborating with top scientists around the world, and working to nurture the next generation of Malaysian cancer researchers.

 

Why am I doing this and why does this matter?

I want to take positive, proactive action to deal with cancer that goes beyond my individual experience. I'm hoping that the work I do to shine a light on this and the collective effort of many through donations, social media and discussion, will help drive a greater good that can only be achieved by a collective spirit and not just the one individual.

This makes it wider than the one experience.  This helps me feel like I am contributing to something bigger than myself, and ultimately, it will make a difference and be impactful to many others.

This matters because this is not just my story – it is the story of literally millions of people around the world, people like you and me and their families. This matters because we all can take action to make a difference, in whatever capacity we wish.

It matters because this is both personal and universal.

 

What do I need from you?

If my story resonates, I urge you to make a donation of any amount towards this cause. Give as you can, give what you will.

I also urge you to spread the word through social media or any other means because you can and the work you do will make a difference.

 

How much?

A special note to say any amount will do.

While I appreciate the unstinting generosity of the backers who have contributed in the early stages of this campaign, I want to stress that every single dollar counts. So feel free to donate even USD1, USD5 or USD10 or any amount you feel comfortable and able to give. What matters is your involvement, contribution and amplification of this message to help carry this campaign through.

 

What do you get from this?

An opportunity to be part of something bigger than yourself and which will have tremendous meaning to those impacted by this disease.

 

How long is this campaign?

6 months from October 2018 – March 2019.

 

On the perk  

For those who would like to take me up on my offer of the 30 min skype call, feel free to reach out via email so we can lock in a date/time that suits both. You can email me at hello AT rowenamorais.com.

 

All the ways you can help

Donate money | Amplify this message

 

Risks & Challenges

The risks and obstacles I face in working to achieve this goal are the following:

1. I can't do this alone - I am counting on the growing network I have to raise awareness and money.
2. There are many worthy causes out there that justify equal or more weight. Mine is just one more.
3. I am currently undergoing chemotherapy treatment myself which means I have to manage my health alongside my work and this campaign.

That said, I intend to support this campaign through advocacy, education and awareness. I hope you will join me. 

 

“What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.”
- Jane Goodall

story:
Fitness as a practice. Community as support.

www.ironcoreway.com

Os Aponte has dedicated his life to fitness. He grew up in Puerto Rico, and by age 16 he was running a free community martial arts school for over 120 locals. He knew the value of a physical practice and wanted to share it with his community. Os went on to become a sergeant in the U.S. Army, motivating his unit to keep in peak physical fitness and helping soldiers struggling to meet weight and height standards overcome their challenges and get promoted. He then became a personal trainer and worked throughout the San Diego area since 2004. In 2005, he took his first kettlebell class at the original Iron Core, with founder Sarah Lurie.

(From left to right, Os, David, Sarah, and Jesus)

He immediately understood the value of kettlebell training and went on to get his certifications. He began working at Iron Core and there he fully developed his system of physical training, which he now calls the Four Chambers. The Four Chambers incorporate bodyweight, kettlebell, conventional, and circuit training to challenge the body while also keeping it safe and healthy. This is the culmination over 20 years of experience, education, and successful implementation of knowledge that comes from all of his physical practices; from martial arts, dance, kettlebells, Z-health, boxing, and good ole' fashion bicep curls. If you don't want to take our word for it, check out Os' testimonials. 

After going to business school at SDSU, Os realized that his passion for teaching is what motivates him and his clients every day. Not only does he want to open a school of movement in City Heights, but just like he did in Puerto Rico, he wants to give back to the community. Iron Core will offer discounted rates to members of the community, law enforcement, and first responders. He also wants to work with local businesses and artists to create a community atmosphere. He believes that fitness is a practice and for many, the best way to practice anything is with a community that supports you. 

The Iron Core School of Movement plans to open in November 2018 in the vibrant and bustling City Heights neighborhood in San Diego, California.  We want to secure the funding necessary for a down payment for our Small Business Administration loan.  Funds secured from Early Adopters and Angel Adopters will be used for start up costs such as rent, equipment (kettlebells, barbells, bumper plates, dumbbells, dumbbell racks, flooring, pull up bars, lifting cages, benches, gymnastic rings, Bosu Balls, plyo box sets, ropes, bands, etc.), an office computer, sound system, and related start up legal fees. Iron Core will offer intimate group classes, small group training, and personal training. 

We need you to become early supporters and adopters so we can bring our unique and effective physical training system to our community. Choose from a variety of perks. Depending on your contribution level, you can invest in your personal fitness journey with us and be one of the first members. We look forward to seeing you at our school and helping you enhance your life!

Choose your level of support:

The Jab – $25.00 

  • Social media shout out

The Side Kick – $50.00

  • Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
  • Social media shout out

The Left Hook – $75.00

  • Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
  • Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
  • Social media shout out

The Spinning Wheel Kick – $100.00

  • Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
  • Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
  • Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
  • Social media shout out

Here's where it gets exciting...

The Mountain Climber – $120.00 (Value $205.00)

  • 1 Initial training assessment with Os Aponte; including visual, vestibular, proprioceptive and movement patterns
  • Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
  • Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
  • Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
  • Social media shout out

The Push-up - $360.00 (Value $585.00)

  • 1 Initial training assessment with Os Aponte; including visual, vestibular, proprioceptive and movement patterns
  • 4 semi private sessions with Os Aponte
  • Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
  • Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
  • Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
  • Social media shout out

The Deadlift - $580.00 (Value $965.00)

  • 1 Initial training assessment with Os Aponte; including visual, vestibular, proprioceptive and movement patterns
  • 8 semi private sessions with Os Aponte
  • Invitation to our Private Open House Event
  • Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
  • Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
  • Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
  • Social media shout out

The Get-up - $1,000 or more (Value $1,345.00)

  • 1 Initial training assessment with Os Aponte; including visual, vestibular, proprioceptive and movement patterns
  • 12 semi private sessions with Os Aponte
  • Invitation to our Private Open House Event
  • Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
  • Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
  • Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
  • Social media shout out

The Impact

Iron Core will be the first comprehensive gym in the City Heights area, with an unparalleled level of service. Our business plan includes multiple community engagement features, including discounted pricing for clients from the local community and scholarship programs with local schools. We live here and we want to honor this community to it's fullest.

Risks & Challenges

Our goal at Iron Core is to eliminate risk and give you incremental challenges. We know this isn't the normal answer to this section of a crowdsourcing campaign, but we know our business plan will work. We look forward to challenging your fitness goals and giving you all the tools you need to eliminate the risks that are usually associated with a fitness program. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let your friends and family know about this campaign! Visit the website, www.ironcoreway.com, like us on Instagram @osaponte, and share this campaign on Facebook. There are quick and easy Indiegogo share tools for your convenience. 

Want to Read More...

The Iron Core School of Movement integrates the latest in applied movement neurology, possessing the know how to provide the most comprehensive system of training available.  The Iron Core School of Movement is built on a core principle of constant adaptation and development:  we learn best practices in our field and immediately put those ideas to the test.  As a result, we continually evolve as a comprehensive health and wellness system that empowers you with the right tools to efficiently and safely meet your goals.

The Iron Core School of Movement starts with a detailed assessment process that will measure your strength, movement ability, proprioceptive system, as well as your visual and vestibular systems. We use the results of the assessment to give you a detailed path forward. In other words, we meet our clients where they are, and prescribe a training template that will improve on weak areas while promoting existing skill levels and laying down a foundation for future development. Our methodology is not exclusive to the healthy or those that are already fit, but rather a systematic approach to help anyone to reach their fullest potential.

The Iron Core School of Movement plans to open in November 2018 in the vibrant and bustling City Heights neighborhood in San Diego, California.  We want to secure the funding necessary for a down payment for our Small Business Administration loan.  Funds secured from Early Adopters and Angel Adopters will be used for start up costs such as rent, equipment (kettlebells, barbells, bumper plates, dumbbells, dumbbell racks, flooring, pull up bars, lifting cages, benches, gymnastic rings, Bosu Balls, plyo box sets, ropes, bands, etc.), an office computer, sound system, and related start up legal fees. Iron Core will offer intimate group classes, small group training, and personal training. 

We need you to become early supporters and adopters so we can bring our unique and effective physical training system to our community. Choose from a variety of perks. Depending on your contribution level, you can invest in your personal fitness journey with us and be one of the first members. We look forward to seeing you at our school and helping you enhance your life!

Choose your level of support:
The Jab – $25.00 
Social media shout out
The Side Kick – $50.00

Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
Social media shout out

The Left Hook – $75.00

Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
Social media shout out

The Spinning Wheel Kick – $100.00

Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
Social media shout out

Here's where it gets exciting...
The Mountain Climber – $120.00 (Value $205.00)

1 Initial training assessment with Os Aponte; including visual, vestibular, proprioceptive and movement patterns
Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
Social media shout out

The Push-up - $360.00 (Value $585.00)

1 Initial training assessment with Os Aponte; including visual, vestibular, proprioceptive and movement patterns
4 semi private sessions with Os Aponte
Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
Social media shout out

The Deadlift - $580.00 (Value $965.00)

1 Initial training assessment with Os Aponte; including visual, vestibular, proprioceptive and movement patterns
8 semi private sessions with Os Aponte
Invitation to our Private Open House Event
Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
Social media shout out

The Get-up - $1,000 or more (Value $1,345.00)

1 Initial training assessment with Os Aponte; including visual, vestibular, proprioceptive and movement patterns
12 semi private sessions with Os Aponte
Invitation to our Private Open House Event
Local artist designed Iron Core t-shirt
Access to an online workout by Os Aponte
Local artist designed Iron Core logo stickers
Social media shout out


The Impact
Iron Core will be the first comprehensive gym in the City Heights area, with an unparalleled level of service. Our business plan includes multiple community engagement features, including discounted pricing for clients from the local community and scholarship programs with local schools. We live here and we want to honor this community to it's fullest.

Risks & Challenges
Our goal at Iron Core is to eliminate risk and give you incremental challenges. We know this isn't the normal answer to this section of a crowdsourcing campaign, but we know our business plan will work. We look forward to challenging your fitness goals and giving you all the tools you need to eliminate the risks that are usually associated with a fitness program. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please let your friends and family know about this campaign! Visit the website, www.ironcoreway.com, like us on Instagram @osaponte, and share this campaign on Facebook. There are quick and easy Indiegogo share tools for your convenience. 
Want to Read More...
The Iron Core School of Movement integrates the latest in applied movement neurology, possessing the know how to provide the most comprehensive system of training available.  The Iron Core School of Movement is built on a core principle of constant adaptation and development:  we learn best practices in our field and immediately put those ideas to the test.  As a result, we continually evolve as a comprehensive health and wellness system that empowers you with the right tools to efficiently and safely meet your goals.
The Iron Core School of Movement starts with a detailed assessment process that will measure your strength, movement ability, proprioceptive system, as well as your visual and vestibular systems. We use the results of the assessment to give you a detailed path forward. In other words, we meet our clients where they are, and prescribe a training template that will improve on weak areas while promoting existing skill levels and laying down a foundation for future development. Our methodology is not exclusive to the healthy or those that are already fit, but rather a systematic approach to help anyone to reach their fullest potential.

story:
La Ermita - a community space that matters

In July of 2001, I quit my job as a hospital based speech-pathologist to open up my own community wellness center, borrowing $6000 from my parents to launch this venture. I developed and published my own unique "radical inclusion" centered therapy approach and immediately put it into practice, initially focusing on kids with autism spectrum disorders, adults with stroke and other traumatic brain injuries and teen agers who were struggling with depression and anxiety. 

In the fifteen years that followed, I successfully started over 25 different all volunteer outreach programs, was the first non-profit yoga and wellness center in the Pacific Northwest, was the first social justice based yoga organization with a mission of radical inclusion and never sending anyone away for lack of funds, and the first yoga center in the area to focus on truly accessible yoga, for all bodies, for all minds. 

In 2015, with the market saturated in Seattle and the cost of living more than I could sustain running the non-profit, I took the leap to move to the small rural community in Mexico where I had already been planting roots for almost ten years. 

When I arrived in the town in early 2006, I began to ask folks what support they needed for things like depression and anxiety. At that time, as I was still an outsider, I was met with lots of "we don't get depressed here," or "that's an American thing to worry about." But as I continued to cultivate my ties to the community, learning to speak fluent Spanish, beginning to teach English and offer small groups for mindfulness and movement, the community response began to shift. Pretty soon I had lots of people, and particularly women, asking me if I could help them with various physical ailments. But every single time, when they entered into the tiny backyard studio I had built, they immediately began to cry and talk about things like domestic violence, feeling trapped and isolated, alcoholism, the stressors of poverty, and yes, depression and anxiety, 

I kept my reach small for many years, wanting to ensure that I had the right reputation with the community, that I understood - as well as an outsider could - their particular concerns and struggles, and that if I built something bigger it would be embraced and utilized and not seen as simply a "gringo" thing. I continued offering free one on one sessions, and expanded to offering twice weekly free mindfulness groups. I started offering free Bedside Yoga sessions in people's homes to help alleviate suffering and isolation associated with chronic pain - most people here not even able to afford over the counter pain medications. 

After my sister died in October of 2019, I earned a small but significant sum of money for being the executor of her estate. Erin was always so encouraging and proud of everything I did, and in particular admired my capacity and passion for reaching the most vulnerable among us. It only made sense to me then, to invest all of the money I earned from her estate into this place that would also honor her. 

Last year, finally having a bit of start up funding, a secure ground and, more than anything, watching the rapid growth and gentrification of the town, with the most marginalized of the community being further pushed to the margins, I knew I had to do something, especially before someone else did - putting in a "yoga studio" or some other space that would feel inaccessible to my local friends. 
 

The initial purchase of the land was approximately $22K and I have spent an additional $30K + of my own money to get us where we are. But the money has run out. 

In order for me to complete the main ground level space, that will include a simple garden, an office/library/welcoming area and a bathroom, I need an additional $10,000. With this part of the project completed, I will be able to open this healing space to the local community at no charge. I will be able to offer workshops, classes and retreats to visitors at a fair price that will help to sustain the work we will do here together.

Once the ground floor is fully established, I hope to be able to build a second floor that will include a small two bedroom apartment and a therapy room which will then create a 100% self-sustaining model so that I will be able to grow my reach and programs to support the community. 
 

I have created several unique perks that I hope you will benefit from. I would love to have you come here and visit, to see and experience this place that you have helped to create, and to know that you have made a real difference in the lives of people who would otherwise never have access to the healing opportunities of La Ermita or a place like it!
 

If I do not reach my entire goal, I will continue to build little by little, investing all of my income over the next several years to see the project through to completion. In the meanwhile, I will use the main hall to offer individual therapy, group classes, arts opportunities, mindfulness and meditation groups, and weekly faith services to my local community. I will also use it to offer once monthly "free" thrift shops - asking tourists and "snowbirds" to donate unused or unwanted items to a centralized location for folks who are struggling financially to be able to get simple household items such as towels, sheets, dishes, clothing, books, tools and toys. 


The Impact

I have worked in community organizing and outreach and the healing arts, including clinical therapy for all of my professional life. I have a proven track record of making things happen. As I settle into my second half of life, I am becoming increasingly interested in small, personal impact over large programs.

La Ermita is just that. We will offer free therapy and classes, as well as volunteer programs for people who are home-bound with critical or terminal illnesses and end of life care. We will provide a safe space for women of the community to gather and share and to know their own worth. We will offer a transformative, curative space which will allow people who otherwise don't have the means to even leave the pueblo to be able to experience a feeling of being transported beyond the limitations of poverty and lack of access. We will offer a space where kids can come and learn tools for self-regulation and valuing of self. We will replicate the experience of The Samarya Center, where all people feel invited, welcomed and celebrated. 

The best part is that you, as a donor, can come here and see it and experience it for yourself, and know that you helped to create this and see with your own eyes the changes you have made in the lives of people who desperately need these opportunities. 
 

I have done this before and I can do it again. Please look at my press, the videos about what we accomplished at Samarya, and the short documentaries about the community we built together in Seattle. I have the experience, I have the passion, I have the capacity and I have a solid start.  Now I just need the funds. 

Please help to make La Ermita a reality.

story:
The Southern Storm quidditch team is a community team based out of the Carolinas, and are made up of players who strive to succeed in the USQ league. This is our fourth year qualifying to play in the national championship! 

At the beginning of November, this year's team succeeded in getting a bid for US Quidditch Cup 12.We had several injuries during the weekend but the players never stopped playing hard and their determination was key in securing the final bid from Mid-Atlantic Regional. 

Prior to our regional championship, we traveled to Columbia, Blacksburg, and Wilmington. We have upcoming tournaments that are in Virginia, South Carolina, and other states. Traveling to different states gives us the opportunity to play other teams and learn the different styles of each region. We came in second place at South Carolina Classic, had a record of 3-1 at Blacksburg Brawl, first place at Warhawk Fall Classic, and third place at Mid-Atlantic Regional Championship. We are currently ranked in the top 20 community teams and strive to climb those ranks to be in the top 10! If you would like to stay up to date with the team then you can follow our Facebook page to see what events we attend and how well we do!   https://www.facebook.com/TheSouthernStorm/ 

What We Need & What You Get

US Quidditch Cup returns to Round Rock, Texas in April. Since we are a community team, we do not receive any funding from colleges and therefore must pay out of pocket to travel and stay for the event. We are raising funds to cover  hotel fees (estimating $1,200-1,600) and travel costs. If possible we would also like to help our players pay for their flights as well, since some of our players would have to make a 20 hour drive to attend. 

Perks

$5 - Thank You Card

You get to choose the pose the team takes for your thank you card! Give us as much detail as you can! The pictures will be taken during Nationals in Round Rock!

$5- Small (5x7)Hogwarts House Canvas Painting

Just $5 and you can have your house colors represented on a small canvas! Perfect for dorm or office decorations! Words or quotes can be added, just let Hanna Reese know!

$15 - Southern Storm Quidditch Calendar 

Have you been wanting a calendar of the awesome captains of Southern Storm? Well, here is your chance! Tanner and Alex have created an arrangement of photos for each month! 

$15 - Large (16x20) Hogwarts House Canvas Painting

Show your love for Harry Potter and the house colors by choosing this perk! Quotes can be added to this painting if you tell Hanna Reese what you would like on it!

$20 - Handmade Southern Storm Beanie

Our team moms didn't want us to get cold during our regional championship so they made these awesome beanies! You can get your very own by choosing this perk! 

Look how cozy these are on our team! 

$25 - Date with Tanner Morris

If you choose this perk, then you're in for an awesome date with one of the captains of Southern Storm, Tanner Morris! 

$25 - Give me the Bludger!

This perk is usable for all unofficial games and practices! If you are on the field and playing against Tanner, you can tell him to hand over the bludger to you or your beater one time during the game*. He will also try his best to not intentionally beat you for that one game. 

*Bludger turn over cannot occur if Tanner's team has only one bludger.

$75 - Custom Team Jersey

Have you seen our jerseys and wanted one of your own? This is your chance! Purchase this perk and you can have your very own custom jersey! *Make sure to give Hanna Reese your order information!*

$200 - Ultimate Package

What is the ultimate package you wonder? Well! With this you get a Southern Storm Calendar, handmade beanie, custom Southern Storm jersey, three Give me the Bludger perks and a canvas size of your choosing! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution is appreciated, no matter the amount! We understand if you can’t donate at the moment, but you can still help by sharing our page! Thank you for the support!

story:
We needed to raise just over $6,000 dollars this year to make our entry another huge success and we almost managed to do that; unfortunately, half of the funds we raised were returned to the donors because of some technical difficulties. We are setting up this campaign to raise our lost donations!

The Canstruction Toronto event challenge is to build a structure made entirely of (canned) food, all of which is then donated to the Daily Bread Food Bank. All of the money you donate will go towards the food and equipment that was purchased to build our Barn-Silo structure this year.

story:
Welstand Boutique is a company that provides resources and articles about wellness & self care, DIY workshops, and natural products for the mind, body, and spirit. As a mother and Mental Health Counselor, I know all too well the negative affects of neglecting any aspect of one's wellness. Our goal is to help women develop and maintain a wellness routine. We want to build an arsenal of content and products that will serve women in all stages of life, from adolescence to menopause.  Overall, our company brings a unique cultural perspective to proactive wellness and aims to elevate the black community.

Funding this project will allow us to:

- Purchase natural, high quality materials products.

- Buy shipping and packaging materials for a dynamic unboxing experience.

- Build and design the website.

- Pay for marketing materials and printable resources from the boutique.

- Offset the cost of legal compliance.

- Storage space for products and materials. 

- Rent a commercial cooking space to prepare food products, such as, lactation snacks and healing teas.

Risks & Challenges

I currently have a full time job in the evening and take care of my toddler during the day. Timing can be a challenge, but it is not impossible. I'm notorious for taking on multiple things and succeeding. Recently, I completed my altMBA while also maintaining 2 jobs and caring for my son full-time. Moms really are super human.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, but you want to help in other ways, please email me! Also, use the Indiegogo share tools to share my dream with others <3

story:
Om gebruik te maken van , ga naar: https://www.tinytodd.com/doneer/

 

Tiny Todd biedt de huidverzorging die jou begrijpt, omdat wij het hebben meegemaakt.

*scroll down for the English version

 

Weinig mensen weten hoe het is om ouders te zijn van kleine kinderen met de meest extreme eczeem. Maar wij wel.

Het begon toen onze zoon Mikai 3 weken oud was. Wat voelden we ons machteloos als we naar zijn ruwe, beschadigde huid keken en de met bloed bevlekte doeken. Om nog maar te zwijgen over de met tranen bevlekte dagen en slapeloze nachten. 

En altijd: de jeuk. Pijnlijk, onvoorspelbaar, non-stop. 

Onze eerste jaren als ouders stonden in het teken van overleven, met daartussen kortstondige momenten van vreugde. 

Toen Quilan 18 maanden later werd geboren, hoopten we dat het anders zou zijn. Maar we hadden het mis. 

Niemand begreep de hulpeloosheid, de frustratie, de wanhoop. De vreugde van een sprankje hoop, gevolgd door een fikse teleurstelling. We voelden het allemaal - beide keren. 

 

Mikai and Quilan

 

We probeerden alles. Maar niets werkte. 

De ene crème na de andere, het ene dieet na het andere, de ene specialist na de andere. Zelfs de de beste artsen in het land konden niet helpen. Maar we geloofden dat er meer was.

Gewoon goed genoeg was niet acceptabel. Onze kinderen verdienden alleen het beste.

Toen geen enkel zalfje werkte, besloten we onze eigen crème te maken. We gingen  van het ene lab naar het andere; vele wezen ons af. Eindelijk vonden we een klein vegan lab met een passie voor het maken van pure, natuurzuivere, eerlijke huidverzorging.

Eerst ontwikkelden we formules in kleine hoeveelheden, die we op onze zoon testten. Onze eerste samples waren mislukkingen, maar opgeven was geen optie. Anderhalf jaar lang hebben we de formule beetje bij beetje aangepast.

Totdat we een doorbraak hadden. 

 

Itch-Free Oat Cream

 

Het laatste testsample veranderde ons leven! Voor het eerst sinds zijn geboorte zagen we de huid van onze zoon al na drie dagen helen, weer zacht worden en zonder scheurtjes. En de opluchting was niet tijdelijk. Het bleef. Kan jij je voorstellen wat dat met ons deed? Nu is onze familie vrij.

De opluchting die we hebben ervaren willen we nu met de rest van de wereld delen. We willen mensen kennis laten maken met dit product. Omdat wij weten dat er andere ouders zijn die hiermee worstelen. En daarom hebben we jouw steun nodig. 

Steun onze campagne en onze missie.

Door deze campagne te steunen krijg je niet alleen een fles Tiny Todd Itch-Free Oat Cream, maar kun je er ook voor zorgen dat het product beschikbaar wordt voor alle ontstemde ouders die worstelen met het eczeem van hun kind.

Het ingezamelde bedrag zorgt ervoor dat we de eerste batch kunnen produceren en leveren. Daarnaast biedt het ons de mogelijkheid om andere producten te ontwikkelen, zoals een bodylotion, een douchegel en een zonnebrandcrème.  

Het ingezamelde bedrag is op te delen in de volgende mogelijkheden. Bij:

  • 5.000 Euros - zijn we in staat om alle grondstoffen in te kopen en kunnen we starten met de productie van onze eerste batch. 
  • 10.000 Euros - zijn we in staat om duurzamer te verpakken en bedrukken. Wij willen namelijk een bijdrage leveren aan het welzijn van de wereld door een duurzame onderneming te zijn. 
  • 15.000 Euros - zijn we in staat om een internationale marketing campagne te starten, zodat we meer mensen kunnen bereiken. De opluchting die we hebben ervaren door de Tiny Todd Itch-Free Oat Cream kunnen we dan met de rest van de wereld delen. 
  • 20.000 Euros - zijn we in staat om een start te maken met de ontwikkeling van het volgende product in onze productlijn.

 

Als ouders wil je alleen het beste voor je kind. Je wilt genieten van ieder kostbaar moment. En je gunt je kind de vreugde van... vrij van jeuk zijn.

Vrij om te spelen, te lachen, om hun tenen in het zand te graven. 

Vrij om 's nachts goed te slapen. Vrij om te genieten van de jeugd die ze verdienen. Maar ook als ouders zijn we vrij om de ouders te zijn die we altijd wilden zijn - met meer liefde, meer rust, meer tijd voor onszelf en elkaar. Meer in staat om te geven.

We zijn helemaal genezen en kunnen voor het eerst sinds jaren opgelucht ademhalen. Net als de huid van onze kinderen. 

 

 

Om gebruik te maken van , ga naar: https://www.tinytodd.com/doneer/

 

The available perks:

 

---------------------

ENGLISH VERSION

 

To use , go to: https://www.tinytodd.com/doneer/

 

Tiny Todd offers the skincare range that understands you, because we have been there.

 

Few people know what it’s like to be the parents of very young children with the most extreme form of eczema. But we do.

It began when our son Mikai was three weeks old, and spiralled into an endless loop of tear-stained days and sleepless nights. Raw, broken skin and blood-spotted blankets. Mystified doctors and inconclusive tests.

And always: The Itch. Agonizing, unpredictable, non-stop.

Our first years as parents were all about survival, with brief, fragile moments of joy in between.

When our second son, Quilan was born 18 months later, we hoped things would be different. But we were wrong.

Nobody understood the helplessness, the frustration, the desperation. The wild surge of hope, followed by the crushing pain of disappointment. We felt it all - times two.

 

Mikai and Quilan

 

We tried everything. But nothing worked.

Cream after cream, diet after diet, specialist after specialist. With each attempt, we prayed the relief would last. But it never did. Even the best doctors and specialists in the country said they could only do so much. But we believed there had to be a solution.

We could never accept just good enough. Our children deserve the best.

When no cure worked, we decided to make our own. We went from one lab to another; many turned us down. Finally, we found a Dutch lab: small, vegan, and passionate about making pure, natural, honest skin products.

We began formulating in small batches, testing on our son. Our first samples were failures, but giving up was not an option. We tweaked the formula bit by bit for over 18 months.

Until we had a breakthrough.

 

Itch-Free Oat Cream

 

That last test sample changed our lives. For the first time since they were born, we saw our sons’ skin soft, unbroken, whole after just three days. And the relief wasn’t temporary. It lasted. Can you imagine how that made us feel? Now our family is free.

And now we want to share the relief we've experienced with the rest of the world. We need to get this product to more people. Because we know that more parents struggle with this. And that is why we need your help. 

Back our campaign and help us reach more parents with Tiny Todd Itch-Free Oat Cream

By backing this campaign not only will you get a bottle of Tiny Todd Itch-Free Oat Cream, but you will also be helping us to ensure that the product is available for all other heartbroken parents who struggle with their child' eczema.

With the money raised from this campaign, we will be able to complete and deliver our first batch of orders, as well as start the development of additional products such as a bodylotion, a shower gel and sunscreen. 

Our fundraising is broken down into different stages if we raise:

  • 5.000 Euros - we are able to purchase all ingredients and start producing the first batch.
  • 10.000 Euros - our wish to use more durable packaging and printing will be made possible, so we can make a contribution to the world with being a sustainable company.
  • 15.000 Euros - we want to reach more people and with this stage, we can start an international marketing campaign and let everybody know about the relief Tiny Todd Itch-Free Oat Cream brings.
  • 20.000 Euros - With this stage, we will be able to start the development of our next product in the product-line.

 

Not only will you and your family experience the relief yourselves, but you will also be sharing the relief with other families. So your children, like ours, can be free to be children again.  

Free to play, to laugh, to dig their toes into the sand.

Free to sleep soundly at night. Free to enjoy the childhood they deserve. You as parents will also be free to be the parents you always wanted to be - with more love, more rest, more time for yourselves and each other, with more of yourselves to give.

Breathing and healing for the first time in years. Just like our children’s skin.

 

Finally the happy family we always wanted to be

 

To use , go to: https://www.tinytodd.com/doneer/

 

The perks available:
