story:
Essential Oil Wizardry Ashland Extraction Facility

What if the answers in which we seek, are your growing right beneath our feet?

My name is Dr. Nick Berry, licensed pharmacist & founder of Essential Oil Wizardry. My career in pharmacy has led me down a dynamic path discovering the origins of medicine through working with plants. I believe that by harnessing our connection with the earth, with our local communities, we can co-create innovative botanical lifestyle solutions that bring positive growth to our environment.

Our humble-sized company is looking to set a solid foundation in Ashland, Oregon to create a state-of-the-heart extraction facility implementing steam distillation, CO2 extraction and artisan co-solvent extractions. We have been steadily growing our presence as an essential oil supplier and product formulator while building connection with communities and nature around the globe. Our joy is in providing premium quality botanical extracts while educating and empowering community.

There are indigenous plants all over the globe which have been used for millennium as medicine for indigenous people. What can the therapeutic applications be if we produce high quality botanical extracts of these exotic herbs and plants? This is a time in history where we can align science, technology and ancient wisdom to bring people together, promoting vitality and economic opportunities for all cultures.

Are you ready to celebrate the grand vision for a collaboration across the nations?

What We Need & What You Get

Our Indiegogo Campaign goal is $150k to secure the down-payment for the property in Ashland, Oregon. We still need to secure a private loan / mortgage / angel funding for the remaining $500k to ensure a smooth transition for purchasing the property. There’s an estimated 200k of renovations for the gardens, structures, and about 350k for a well-rounded, extensive lab setup.

The speed in which this vision actualizes is directly proportional to the speed we generate the financing and the physical support/labor we have on the property. We are enthusiastic about crafting artisan botanical extracts with local plants and offering a community extraction service as soon as mid-2018 with support above and beyond our Indiegogo campaign goal.

We are offering delicious perks for all levels of contributions – from essential oil kits, transformational botanical retreats, travel experiences with Dr. Nick, playshops in your home town, private perfuming parties with your friends & complete Essential Oil Wizardry product packages. We are thrilled to enhance your quality of life using our products and appreciate your heart-felt investment!

We feel strongly about creating a worldwide network of extraction facilities that creates new economic opportunities for indigenous communities, supporting farms to create undiscovered botanical extracts previously unavailable on the essential oil market. This vision will be created at the rate of the support we can receive from the collective!

Social Impact

Our team has been providing botanical-based lifestyle solutions to tens-of-thousands of people since 2014. The effects that our artisan products have had on our expanding community have been astounding based on hundreds of testimonials (verbal, emails, phone calls, videos).

This foundation in Ashland allows us to begin producing essential oils from local plants, truly controlling what goes into our plants from seed to bottle. We have the opportunity to advance extraction knowledge by implementing new variables of awareness into our production. Our team is excited to implement various forms of technology we have discovered over the years. Introducing sound frequencies and high-quality energized water systems to feed our plants / power our distillation processes, we hope to produce more robust botanical extracts!

In addition to operating industry standard steam-distillation stills and CO2 extraction machines, our team is excited to explore new methods for plant extraction using vacuum pressure, temperature differentiation and non-toxic co-solvent techniques for bringing NEW innovative botanical products to market. We are excited to use industry standards as our baseline for product development and to test new processes to advance the field of botanical extraction.

The extracts we produce are intended to be analyzed by in-house lab analysis thus creating batches of new botanical extract products available for research to develop new solutions for well-being. This creates opportunities for user-based feedback & reports (ie. Reddit) using these rare botanical extracts and can create grass-roots inspiration for botanical research eventually guided into an academic setting using batch specific studies.

As our company grows, we intend to allow partnership with conscious investors to setup extraction facilities in countries around the globe to explore native plants while supporting indigenous communities who can lead the project. This brings new economies to less affluent regions with an exciting sense of purpose for a sustainable project which produces organic plant material. This creates a global project for developing new therapeutic extracts and explores the diversity of plants and cultures around the world!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risks include:

  • Not raising enough money in-time before the property is sold – this creates a need to find another home and new location to operate our business on in Ashland.
  • Raising the funds for down-payment / mortgage before our lease ends in San Luis Obispo September 30th.
  • Dealing with 1-3 months transition time to get our blending room / shipping & fulfillment center setup after we move.
  • Sourcing a mortgage or private loan for the remainder of house payment / renovations / lab equipment.

Our solutions for potential risks:

  • We are committed to our vision and will rent another location until we find another property in Ashland that suits our vision.
     
  • Essential Oil Wizardry has been offered a warehouse location about 1 hour from Ashland in Merlin (yes, Merlin!) to get setup for operations if we cannot raise enough funds or the property gets sold. This would be a temporary solution while we find a new Ashland location to keep our business operating relatively seemlessly and will be a low-capital cost for rent. This location can serve as an interim solution between our current lease and the new property, if needed.
     
  • If we are unable to raise enough funds for a down-payment or source a mortgage/private loan, we are prepared to rent a home / business location in Ashland, Oregon and continue offering our fine essential oil products. Our savings will be stored for our down-payment operating with lower overhead costs (Ashland vs. San Luis Obispo, California) to grow into our vision organically.
     
  • Our vision can only grow as fast as our finances and the human support we have at the property – we will grow into new aspects of our offerings (ie. extraction, farming) organically, or with the sponsorship/collaboration of an extraction manufacturer, angel investors and other local organic farmers. Our lab extractions and on-site testing will be launched as we are able to create and maintain these new opportunities in Ashland.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are several ways you can contribute to actualizing this dream!

1) Social media engagement will make this campaign a success! Play along with our 40-Day Campaign and share our community social media posts. Be part of the journey with our Essential Oil Wizardry Facebook & Instagram pages. Remember to include #wizardgarden on all your fun campaign-related posts :-)

2) Sign up for our Thunderclap announcement at https://www.thunderclap.it/projects/58957-eow-e... to let the internet know of our grand vision for transforming the planet through community and artisan organic extracts at ~ this will send out a one-time post from your social media sharing our vision with your friends.

3) Consider becoming a monthly supporter of our vision and join our Monthly Alchemy Club! This option delivers a package set of pure Essential Oils, a Wizard Alchemy Blend, Tinctures & Exquisite Perfumes to your door-step monthly while supporting our expanding vision each month.

4) Use Indiegogo’s share tools to share this campaign and inspiring video with your friends!

Heart felt thank-you for reading all of this exciting vision for the future and helping our team actualize these dreams for a more sustainable earth!

story:
UPDATE: THIS CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED. FOR MORE DETAILS, PLEASE VISIT: https://playhuahee.com/games-engage-seniors/

 

Hello! I am Christel and I created Hua Hee, a heritage card game to engage elderly in Singapore. 

This inspiration came from trying to find activities to engage my grandma as she got older. Having seen my grandfather suffer from dementia, my family did not want the same to happen to my grandma.

Unique SG Heritage Designs
I drew more than 20 popular Singapore heritage items and compiled them into a card game deck. Hua Hee is designed to encourage people to actively engage their elderly loved ones at home so as to help slow down the progression of dementia. Hua Hee means happy in Hokkien, and it will hopefully bring happiness to elderly.


Help me continue creating!
I hope to continue creating activities to better engage elderly in Singapore and the response gathered from this campaign will help me better understand how much of this is needed. So... please support me!

 

What you will get

 

 

The Impact

Dementia is a big problem worldwide. One in 10 people aged 60 and above in Singapore have dementia. By 2030, people with Dementia in Singapore will double. Having seen my family cope with dementia in the home, i'm quite certain that there are many like us, who are also at a loss when it happens. Through a series of exercises and healthy eating, my family has seen a significant improvement in my grandma's memory and disposition.

I've also tested it out with elderly and the response has been quite positive. The elderly who are unable to engage in the game can also recognise some of the heritage items fondly.

According to the National Institutes of Health in the United States, brain-training exercises slows down dementia between 33 to 48%. Fighting Dementia requires a consistent and committed effort. The Hua Hee card game is definitely not a silver bullet to mental illnesses, but it's a good start if this encourages you to spend more time with your elderly loved ones.

We are also constantly on the look out for more ways to keep my grandma engaged at home. Please share with me if you have any ideas. I would also be very happy if you could support this fight against Dementia by sharing this with your family and friends!

More about Hua Hee

Hua Hee can be played as a matching/snap game pack. 22 beautifully sketched designs of heritage items in Singapore such as Kueh Tutu, clogs and Tingkat are available. The vibrantly coloured cards come with elderly-friendly and fits snugly in your palm which makes for easy shuffling!

The Hua Hee Match game pack comes with two sets of each design, allowing caregivers to facilitate the memory matching game. Both Hua Hee Match and Snap game packs are suitable for a group of 2 - 4 players. All game packs come with a set of instructions.

If you're not ready to get the full set, there's also the Starter Pack and More than Starter Pack.

Card Specifications

- Dimensions: 8.7 cm x 7.5cm

- 310 gsm artcard with Matte lamination on.both sides of card

 

 

 

 

UPDATE: As the Hari Raya Puasa celebrations approach, we introduce a new card game pack aimed at encouraging children to put aside their digital devices and engage with their grandparents during the festive season! 

Gembira which means happy in Malay,  can be played as a Snap game, and will include unique to Singapore items such as Ketupat, Satay, Ondeh Ondeh and Gasing.

UPDATE: THIS CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED. FOR MORE DETAILS, PLEASE VISIT: https://playhuahee.com/games-engage-seniors/

 
Hello! I am Christel and I created Hua Hee, a heritage card game to engage elderly in Singapore. 
This inspiration came from trying to find activities to engage my grandma as she got older. Having seen my grandfather suffer from dementia, my family did not want the same to happen to my grandma.
Unique SG Heritage DesignsI drew more than 20 popular Singapore heritage items and compiled them into a card game deck. Hua Hee is designed to encourage people to actively engage their elderly loved ones at home so as to help slow down the progression of dementia. Hua Hee means happy in Hokkien, and it will hopefully bring happiness to elderly.
Help me continue creating!I hope to continue creating activities to better engage elderly in Singapore and the response gathered from this campaign will help me better understand how much of this is needed. So... please support me!
 
What you will get


 




 

The Impact

UPDATE: As the Hari Raya Puasa celebrations approach, we introduce a new card game pack aimed at encouraging children to put aside their digital devices and engage with their grandparents during the festive season! 
Gembira which means happy in Malay,  can be played as a Snap game, and will include unique to Singapore items such as Ketupat, Satay, Ondeh Ondeh and Gasing.

story:
Why Diabetic Defense Tea?

Created by diabetics for diabetics.

I am a 30 year old type1 diabetic. I am tired of taking pills and supplements, so I decided to combine all my favorite natural blood sugar remedies into one tea source 

I believe this tea will be a great big old help to those dealing daily with blood sugar concerns 

Together with your support I can press the first order and launch our online store bringing the tea to the market for the world to enjoy. 

I feel compelled to bring naturalistic wellness to this pharmaceutical congested space. 

Our Tea

All-Natural, Medically Researched Ingredients

  • Cinnamon
  • Bitter melon
  • Cactus
  • Chromium
  • Dandelion
  • Fenu Greek Seed
  • Ginger
  • Guava
  • Hibiscus
  • Licorice Root
  • Monk Fruit

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $20,000 to press our first run and launch our morning and evening formula. This money pays for the ingredients, production, packaging and website, we also plan to run a social media influence campaign to get the word out so it will help our Facebook and Instagram marketing.  

The Impact

Diabetic Defense Tea is built to help bring vitality and wellness to those struggling with blood sugar management. It's our believe that the product has the ability to enrich the lives of millions of people living with this condition.  

Diabetes kills five million people annually. Over 360 million people are living with the disease. If we can help even a handful of these people to experience a greater quality of life we will have succeeded.  

Before I invented Diabetic Defense Tea I owned an operated a successful restaurant. I know the work it takes to run a good business and serve a community. I'm excited to be all in on this project pursuing it with all I have to bring something truly of service out into the marketplace.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not diabetic this tea is of great benefit to your body. Although you may not have diabetes yourself, this tea is still tremendous for you as healthy blood sugar regulation is equated with a healthy life. Please share this campaign with anyone you know who has diabetes or worries about it being in there family. Sharing our campaign on social media means a tremendous amount and I am humbly grateful for your support.   

Product Disclaimer

Diabetic Defense Tea and the claims made about this product have not been evaluated or approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration or Health Canada to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease.  You should consult your physician or other health care professional regarding any medical or health related diagnosis or treatment option.

story:
HER'S By Chantell™ (HBC) has partnered with the Alopecia Support Group© to raise $30,000 to use the funds as follows:

  • Design and build one semi-custom wig for members of the  Alopecia Support Group© for every $1,000 raised.
  • Fund remaining start-up costs inclusive but not exclusive to: materials, website design, marketing and support staff to further HBC’s mission to reach and help as many people as possible.

HBC’s mission is to support the hair loss community and help women enhance and celebrate their individual beauty. With your contribution, HBC will be positioned to help revolutionize the hair industry, establishing a standard that supports communities, promotes quality and services the customers beyond hair.

Our campaign goal is to provide those with alopecia and medical hair loss with customized, yet affordable or complimentary hair pieces which reflect their individuality. We intend to offer clients a unique hair buying experience that ultimately raises community awareness and personal confidence.

 "Alopecia Support Group is partnering with HER'S by Chantell to continue with its joint mission and efforts, to help the hair-loss community find their voice, confidence and self love through self-expression. We are honored to be the recipient’s of custom hair pieces that will be donated to our organization for individuals in need. Thank you HER'S By Chantell."
 
-Jamie Elmore, Founder, Alopecia Support Group, Seattle Chapter
@alopeciasupportgroup
www.alopeciasupportgroup.org
 
 

 

According to the American Academy of Dermatology and WebMD, by the time women are 40, roughly 40% display visible signs of hair loss. Many women who experience this level of hair loss have expressed having higher levels of depression, low self-esteem, anxiety, and other potentially detrimental emotional states. Unfortunately, in the hair industry, custom wigs and hairpieces often range from $3,500 to $10,000, of which many people are already facing large medical bills and/or difficult financial circumstances so they cannot afford a wig.  When choosing between paying for medication or purchasing hair prosthesis, understandably, many forego custom hair solutions. HBC believes everyone deserves to feel their best, especially during these difficult times.

HBC is a specialty wig and hair brand that believes in equipping its customers with self-empowerment and self-love while also providing personalized hair solutions. HBC offers wigs, hair pieces, hair solutions and services, all customizable to fit the unique needs of HBC clientele.

Hairstyles can be unique forms of expression, and at HBC, we believe that everyone has the right to express themselves fully and creatively just as they are. When our hair looks and feels like a true representation of ourselves, we generally tend to feel more attractive and confident about the rest of our body-- feelings which, as a result, often carry over into other parts of our lives and make us feel happier and more energized altogether. At HBC, we strive to provide our clients with hair pieces that represent who they are to the fullest so that good feeling extends beyond the hair.

In just a short amount of time since the launch of HER’S By Chantell™, HBC has grown from an idea born out of a passion for helping others to a notable hair brand serving a wide array of clientele and customer needs. You can now see HBC wigs featured in major motion pictures, TV, Broadway, and various print advertisements. Moreover, our custom made hair prosthesis have helped our alopecia and medical hair loss clients find confidence and power in unleashing their personal identity.  With our increased business growth, HBC needs your help to expand to support growing demand as well as make critical operations updates.  All of this expansion still relates to HBC’S ultimate mission: helping those in need to empower themselves.

HBC Pillars

  • Quality- As a traditional wigmaker, Chantell has a deep understanding of the importance of high-quality materials and how to best use them to create a long-lasting, custom product that always looks and feels amazing for every client.
  • Service- Clients are assisted from start to finish to ensure that they are not only comfortable throughout the process and happy with the completed product but that it is a genuine expression of who they are individually.
  • Community- HBC aims to build and educate a community of hair care professionals that believe in the positive effects of diverse, well-crafted hairstyles and are determined to provide better access, care, and service to those in need. In addition to partnering with non-profit organizations, HBC offers classes and workshops to aid industry professionals and others.  Workshop topics vary but focus on helping professionals think through how to generate better brand awareness within the hair care industry, how to create custom wigs, and other topics often afforded to only elite hair professionals.

Community in Action

As part of our community pillar, it is important to us that we always find ways to promote and support others, so it is with great enthusiasm we announce that Laid Headwear™ and Monrowe NYC will be included in HBC "Empowerment Basket" as a perk for those who are able to contribute $1,000 and up!  We couldn’t be more proud to feature products from these women-owned businesses.  Below is a little more information on these great companies.

Empowerment Basket

1) Monrowe NYC

Monrowe tells the story of a free-spirited jazz musician from the American south: a man who played sax in speakeasies with no formal training, improvised his own unique style and unapologetically weaved a creative life centered on freedom and self-expression.

Monrowe was created by his granddaughter, model-turned-milliner Dani Evans, inspired by his legacy. 

These are the hats he would have worn. This is his aesthetic, channeled into crowns for the modern (wo)man.

Strong, structured silhouettes. Nostalgic tones. The sort of extraordinary details inherent in expert craftsmanship. Daring shapes or classic forms—we know there’s a place for both.

Monrowe is a unisex line of ready-to-wear hats, made in the USA and created for the bold at heart. More timeless than trendy, the brims blend nuances from ‘40s and ‘50s Jazz Era styles with classic Western shapes and contemporary elements. 

@monrowenyc

https://monrowenyc.com/

 

2) Laid Headwear™

Laid is a Hair Accessories and Lifestyle brand committed to creating high quality hair protection products that are feminine, fashionable and functional. This product line is a must have for every woman's hair maintenance routine.

Our mission is to create beautiful, feminine, fashionable products that takes you from the gym to the bedroom and any where in between with the sole purpose of keeping your hair Laid!

@lwsalon

https://www.lwsalon.com/

 

Friends,

Thank you in advance for your support! For more updates on the campaign's progress, please follow us on Social Media at  @hersbychantell and or sign up for email updates on https://www.hersbychantell.com

XO,

Chantell

story:
Keep the Delphin Cruise Ship Alive by Sailing Your Soul Upon Our Sanctuary at Sea -Enjoy the Benefits of Conscious Cruising.

Innovation born from restriction

Deep in the frustrating restrictions of the last lockdown, the idea to create a platform of possibilities….a floating haven for holistic retreats and workshops was born.

Let your Soul Sail ~ United and Free

Share the Sweet Possibilities

Engage Your Spirit 

Dance at Sea

The Dawning of The Delphin

Finding herself on the Bournemouth coast in southern England at the beginning of yet another lockdown, Shekina Ray looked wistfully out to sea.

On the horizon tall and proud in the distant waters was a majestic cruise ship, full of the promise of freedom and fun.

“What if we could host holistic retreats, immune boosting treatments and soul enhancing workshops in the beautiful environment of a cruise ship?”

Shekina’s heart began to beat faster as the idea started to take shape.

For the past 20 years, Shekina has been facilitating nurturing workshops throughout International locations.  And now this vision:

To access the freedom of the seas to nurture the mind, body and soul. 

Evolve your Body, Mind and Spirit while delighting in the global exploration of exotic energizing locations!

Inspired, Shekina started looking for cruise ships that were available for sale. One particular ship jumped out at her, and immediately she was in love.

This special ship that called to her was perfect.

It is big enough to accommodate 500 people in safety and comfort and yet small enough to foster a real sense of community on board.

There were many things that made this ship ideal, serendipitously sealing the choice was the ship’s name:

The Delphin

(which of course means Dolphin). 

Dolphins have been close to Shekina’s heart since she was very young, so it was as if this ship was calling her:

“Shekina, save me!”

Shekina had found out that because of the recent global travel bans, a shocking number of healthy, world class cruise ships were being sent to the “scrap yard” doomed to be taken apart and never sail again. 

Ships have Souls

Shekina couldn’t bear such destruction and rallied her friends around the idea of saving the ship, a soul of the sea, and creating a “home” for retreats, workshops and holistic treatments. 

“We all got excited”

said Shekina

“..and we pledged to attempt the near impossible task of saving this ship and creating a world of conscious fun on board to be enjoyed for many years to come.” 

The Delphin Magic Team was formed

Our immediate excitement motivated us to take on the challenge of saving this ship - our “Delphin” and start the process of creating a sanctuary on the sea.  

We are a group including holistic teachers and practitioners, eco-aware sustainability researchers and systems managers who care about the planet and every life form that inhabits our sacred mother earth.

Be a Part of a Revolutionary New Way of Cruising

This fundraiser is the first step in providing a creative, innovative and eco-aware way for people to receive holistic health services, workshops, retreats and a world-class cruise-of-a-lifetime experience with other people who care about the planet too.

Imagine being a Digital Nomad on the ship. Having access to healthy organic and local food, to a variety of relaxing, luxurious and energizing holistic health services and spa treatments. Socializing with interesting people, having access to retreats, lectures and courses and visiting different cities and countries. Renting a cabin for a month or two or for a longer period of time. Living a balanced and healthy life and nurturing your mind, body and soul.

Not only will our ship nurture your mind, body and spirit, but it will be equipped with eco-friendly bio-sustainable innovative methods of operating that is kinder to the planet.

We are planning to change the engine to biofuel, add solar panels and windmills and an organic garden to replace the basketball court on the top deck.

With much research and preparation, we discovered that the specialisms and expertise required at this level are a costly process.

The funds initially required to get this project moving are $75,000.

What Will The Funds Be Used For?

The funds that we raise with this initial step will seed the following steps to acquire the ship. 

Your contribution will fund:

  • Vital feasibility studies,
  • Specialist advisors, 
  • Legislations, 
  • Certificates,
  • Legalities 

All that is required to ensure that we can purchase and safely operate the Delphin Ship.

(Contributions in excess of our 1st step will go towards funding the purchase - bringing us even closer to this beautiful vision becoming reality.)

How Can You Help?

Would you like to join us in actualising this vision of enhancing health and consciousness while having the time of your life cruising the oceans - Fun, Freedom and Fantasy?

You can choose to contribute any amount from $9 to $1,800. If you would like to donate a different amount, please click the pink "BACK IT" button on the top of the page (if you are using a computer) or scroll past all the perks if you are using a cellphone.

We have created a wonderful variety of perks and rewards which you can select as our way to thank you for your generosity.

Themed in the spirit of holistic health, wellness and soul enhancement, these perks are our way of acknowledging you for your contribution.

Thank you for being a part of helping us create the first steps to actualising this vision and take the first steps to creating a platform of possibilities….a floating haven for holistic retreats, wellness and workshops.

Please check out our website for detailed description of the perks here: http://heartcenteredcruising.com/perks

Having access to healthy organic and local food, to a variety of relaxing, luxurious and energizing holistic health services and spa treatments. Socializing with interesting people, having access to retreats, lectures and courses and visiting different cities and countries. Renting a cabin for a month or two or for a longer period of time. Living a balanced and healthy life and nurturing your mind, body and soul.Not only will our ship nurture your mind, body and spirit, but it will be equipped with eco-friendly bio-sustainable innovative methods of operating that is kinder to the planet.We are planning to change the engine to biofuel, add solar panels and windmills and an organic garden to replace the basketball court on the top deck.With much research and preparation, we discovered that the specialisms and expertise required at this level are a costly process.The funds initially required to get this project moving are $75,000.What Will The Funds Be Used For?The funds that we raise with this initial step will seed the following steps to acquire the ship. Your contribution will fund:
Vital feasibility studies,
Specialist advisors, 
Legislations, 
Certificates,
Legalities 
All that is required to ensure that we can purchase and safely operate the Delphin Ship.(Contributions in excess of our 1st step will go towards funding the purchase - bringing us even closer to this beautiful vision becoming reality.)How Can You Help?Would you like to join us in actualising this vision of enhancing health and consciousness while having the time of your life cruising the oceans - Fun, Freedom and Fantasy?You can choose to contribute any amount from $9 to $1,800. If you would like to donate a different amount, please click the pink "BACK IT" button on the top of the page (if you are using a computer) or scroll past all the perks if you are using a cellphone.We have created a wonderful variety of perks and rewards which you can select as our way to thank you for your generosity.Themed in the spirit of holistic health, wellness and soul enhancement, these perks are our way of acknowledging you for your contribution.Thank you for being a part of helping us create the first steps to actualising this vision and take the first steps to creating a platform of possibilities….a floating haven for holistic retreats, wellness and workshops.Please check out our website for detailed description of the perks here: http://heartcenteredcruising.com/perks

story:
Everyone Experiences Grief

I got hit by the "grief truck" when I was 36 years old. 

In 2018 I lost my first husband, Lance, to a sudden and terrible battle with cancer. When he died on August, 7, 2018 after just two months of illness, I was left broken, lost, and confused. I wasn't sure I'd ever be able to recover, but I made him a promise as he took his last breaths, "I don't know how I'll be okay again, but I promise you, I'll figure it out." 

Three months later, I "skipped Thanksgiving" and traveled solo to Costa Rica. The first night I spent on the Pacific Coast, watching the sunset over the ocean, was the first night I felt I could breathe—it was the first time I felt hope. I returned to Costa Rica at least once a month for six months before deciding in May 2019, to move here. 

Many Modern Cultures Don't Understand or Help

What Costa Rica taught me is that many modern cultures don't support people who are devastated by grief. They don't understand. Many modern cultures get awkward and weird and want to sweep grief under the rug. They want people to be "strong," to "pull themselves up from their bootstraps," to "move on," to "get over it," to "succeed in the face of trials and struggles." Many modern cultures want a success story. They don't want to see the depths of the loss or the ongoing, painful struggle of continuing to live after losing the most important person (or people) in your life. 

In contrast to the many modern cultures whose pace of life and values are causing so much stress and illness, Costa Rica's lifestyle is famous for promoting health and healing. Slowing down, eating healthfully, and having a sense of community. You may not be able to stay here forever, but you may be able to carry home some of what you experience and learn. And you may, through your time here, become a healing presence for others. 

Brave Heart Ranch Will Provide Community & Support

The goal of Brave Heart Ranch will be to provide a grief community and opportunity for legacy for those who are lost in their own seas of grief. It will provide an honest, straightforward approach to loss. One that doesn't get awkward or weird. One that accepts wailing and thrashing. That accepts the clinging to coping mechanisms of all kinds while encouraging the healthy ones. One that promotes therapy. One that sees the importance of continued connection with those who have died. One that won't tell you you should be "better" after a year, or two years, or 10 years. Because grief never goes away. It just changes. 

Brave Heart Ranch Will Offer

  • A physical, in-person grief retreat. Those who visit will enjoy yoga overlooking the Pacific Ocean, a glass of wine at sunset, time with animals of all types, horseback riding, paddleboarding, other opportunities for exercise, healthy Costa Rican cooking, and massage or other forms of therapy, if desired. These retreats are fully customizable—if someone wants to come and just cry for two weeks uninterrupted, that's okay, too. 
  • Online grief community. Through the website and social media pages, Brave Heart Ranch will provide an honest look at what grief really is, aiming to normalize and encourage all the confusing facets of emotions that accompany grief at all stages of the grief process. Whether it's been a week or 10 years, grief continues and is normal. 
  • Opportunities for memorials and legacy. Brave Heart Ranch isn't just for the those who are able to come to Costa Rica in person. It's a place where people from all over the world can memorialize their loved ones in one of the most beautiful places on earth. It's also a place where those who are facing a terminal illness can create a legacy, helping support those who are left behind in the wake of loss. 
  • A columbarium park space for the interment of ashes. Brave Heart Ranch will provide a small, peaceful park at the Ranch with several columbariums designed to hold urns for the interment of ashes. Niches will be available for purchase when the park space is complete.  

We will help other people who are grieving and searching for hope to experience their own brief moment of relief as a sign that it's possible to live again after loss. We will also help normalize the grief experience and provide a community of support online to help those who cannot visit the Ranch in person. 

Brave Heart Ranch is a property on Costa Rica's Pacific Coast that has all the key elements required for turning it into the perfect Grief Retreat Center and Living Memorial. 

This Ranch itself will include: 

  • Horses, and opportunities for grooming and riding for those who visit—horses are known to be incredibly therapeutic animals
  • Cows, and opportunities to feed/milk/pet the animals
  • Lots of dogs, sheep, chickens, and pigs
  • Wildlife, including monkeys, parrots, and even the occasional jaguar sighting
  • Lodging with jungle, and/or ocean views
  • Opportunities for yoga, nature hikes, and other forms of exercise
  • Opportunities for ocean activities, like kayaking, stand up paddleboarding, and swimming 
  • Opportunities for popular Costa Rican tours, including ziplining, rainforest canopy hikes, white water rafting, and surfing
  • Local Costa Rican cooking/food
  • Opportunities for other forms of therapy, for those who are interested, including talk therapy, myofascial release/massage therapy, assistance from social workers, occupational therapists, acupuncture, and access to a grief doula (some of these services will be arranged for online/Zoom-style meetings with US-based therapists and coaches)
  • Time with other people who have experienced deep loss and understand how overwhelming it can feel, even months or years later

The extended community will include: 

  • Live online stories and events to allow people from around the world to experience the Ranch
  • Private Facebook groups for grief support
  • Newsletters including expert resources and commentary on grief and loss
  • Opportunities for memorializing loved ones 
  • Opportunities for creating legacies (including scholarships, special programs, and events)
  • First chance access to scholarships or other discounts to visit the Ranch, as they become available

What We Need

We need a lot of help! The property is 66 acres on Costa Rica's Pacific Coast. It's about two hours from both international airports, and It's a steal at the price it's being listed for. That said, it's still not cheap. The cost of the entire 66-acre property is $320,000. 

  • This is an IMMEDIATE NEED. To secure the property, we need at least $180,000 ASAP, although a more realistic number is $250,000. After securing the property, all other goals will be much more realistic to meet, even if they take more time. If you're interested in being part of a Founder's Circle (you'd be commemorated as such, and receive other perks) to help secure the land, please see the "Founder's Circle" options listed in the Perks—there are two levels, Silver and Gold. There are limited opportunities for this perk and as soon as we meet this goal, the listing will be removed. 
  • Even if a Founder's Circle donation is outside your reach, this is exactly why we need all the donations and eyes on the project as we can get. Your $5, $10, or $50 donation can really help. And beyond that, SHARE. With 36,000 $5 donations, we could secure the property. That's a lot of donations, sure, but it's doable.  

The property also has a beautiful, 4-bedroom house (the house that would be used for guests) that's 60% built, but needs to be finished. I've asked the realtor how much this would cost. His estimate is between $60,000 and $120,000. 

The property also currently includes:

  • Two small cabins that need repairs
  • A large 3,000-square foot building that can be renovated and used for larger group retreats with hostel-style bunks and shared bathrooms
  • A second large, enclosed space that can be renovated and used for animals
  • An additional private apartment with ocean views
  • A large, open-air restaurant/meeting space.

All of these structures need to be cleaned up, undergo minor repairs, and be prepped for guests and/or animals. That's roughly $30,000 more. 

There are two cleared terraces with amazing ocean views where we would like to build additional cabins for guests and a large, open-air yoga and fitness studio. Costs will vary depending on the type of structure built, but would be roughly $50,000 for four cabins and the studio. 

There are two more areas higher up in the hills that need to be cleared of brush and would later be perfect for additional cabins or other meeting spaces. This would be a future project, but we'd like to start clearing the land and prepping the trails to access these spots for future use. This will cost roughly $5,000.

Total cost to fully prepare Brave Heart Ranch for onsite visitors: $525,000. The online community can be started almost immediately, with little up-front cash necessary. 

We are also committed to starting the Ranch and moving forward with aspects of the Grief Community as soon as possible, even if full funding isn't met. Please see the FAQ section for more details. 

What We Have

  • Knowledge, skills, and expertise in opening community-style centers. I helped open two, 70,000+ square foot community/fitness centers in the United States. I'm fully capable of managing this type of project from the ground-up. 
  • Knowledge, skills, and expertise in fitness/health. I hold a Master's Degree in Exercise Science, including certifications in Exercise Physiology, Yoga, Sports Nutrition, and Sports Conditioning. I taught Exercise Science at a University in Texas and I've been published in national magazines, including Men's Journal. 
  • The animals to start the Ranch. We currently own 18 cows, 8 horses, 9 dogs, 2 sheep, and 2 pigs. 
  • The knowledge to run a ranch. My new husband is a life-long rancher, bull-rider, and horse trainer. We're not just diving into the world of owning and running a ranch without the proper know-how. 
  • An onsite cook. My new husband is a trained cook and has cooked in resorts and hotels in major tourist areas in Costa Rica.  
  • Connections to therapists and other specialists ready to come on board and offer assistance. These include: 
    • Grief doulas 
    • Grief and trauma therapists
    • Occupational therapists
    • Art therapists
    • Yoga instructors
    • Social workers
    • Other non-traditional healers, if desired by clientele
  • We're fully bilingual. Since moving to Costa Rica, I've learned Spanish and am conversationally proficient. My new husband is a native Costa Rican and is fully fluent. We can provide support and answers to anyone speaking English or Spanish. 

The Impact—Everyone Grieves

Everyone will experience a major loss at some point in their lives. Grief is universal.

But grief and loss are not easy, and most people need help finding a way to navigate grief effectively, especially after experiencing the death of a spouse, child, parent, or sibling.

Brave Heart Ranch will give mourners a "toolbox," so to speak, of ways to work on healing, both while at the Ranch, and while at home. By donating, you're helping invest in promoting healing in those who have lost a loved one, while also acknowledging that grief and loss are normal. That we, as a society, need to be prepared to support those whose lives have been shattered after loss. And the only way we can do that is if we work toward this goal together. 

Risks & Challenges

As with starting any business, there are always risks. While I've been talking extensively to the realtor to get an idea of real costs associated with starting the Ranch, there are of course challenges with buying real estate and construction. Fortunately, I've been involved in starting two large recreation centers in the past, and I'm familiar with what it takes to get a center like this up off the ground.

Also, the knowledge and skills I bring to the table with my background in exercise and sport science and yoga, as well as my husband's experience with livestock and cooking, mean that there won't be extensive costs associated with hiring employees when starting the actual center. And with assistance from my own therapist and other Licensed Counselors and professionals, I feel confident I can create a safe and healing environment for those experiencing significant grief. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please spread the word! If you know someone who is in mourning, let them know that we hope to have this retreat center up soon. And please, share on social media. The more people who are aware of Brave Heart Ranch and our goals, the more likely we will be to fully fund the project and to be able to help and serve in the ways we hope to help and serve.

story:
Raising Awareness and Funds Through Art

I Get Happy When I Think About You is not only a rebirth but a celebration of Darrius' journey this past year. The purpose of this fundraiser is to celebrate Darrius' remission and, at the same time, raise money for The American Cancer Society. On June 22nd, Darrius learned of his diagnosis, Hodgkin's Lymphoma, and after seven months of fighting, Darrius entered remission. In his own words, "This is for those who can't fight and giving them a fighting chance." The first $2000 raised will be used to create the music video of Darrius's dream, a music video that he designed while fighting for his life this past year. The rest of the funds raised will be privately donated to The American Cancer Society. 

https://donate3.cancer.org/?campaign=fruseo&amp... 

 

w

 

Music Video

The project will be shot on 16mm film and visually depict his inner psyche.

Pong Tulyathan

https://ttulyathan.com/

story:
What's TLR #3 about?

The Local Rebel is a zine publication that aims to educate and empower our youth. In past issues, we’ve covered primers on feminism and decolonisation, uncovered class issues and xenophobia, navigated queer identities and more! This time round, we wanted to take it slow, focus on just one crucial issue: especially so in today's world wracked by a pandemic, a fraught political climate, and numerous flashpoints surrounding race, religion, and sexuality. 

Dig into TLR #3 for:

  • A comic about family estrangement
  • How to spot red flags in relationships
  • An art therapy directive!
  • An essay on conversion therapy for queer folk
  • A tarot and yoga guide for 2020
  • And more!

 

 

Our team is dedicated to making this zine an accessible and fun educational resource. Expect not just thoughtful essays, but also ‘breathers’ for you to process and appreciate our zine: playlists, colouring pages, and more! This zine is also colour-coded, so you know off the bat how heavy a particular piece can get- and you can flip to a section that’s slightly easier to deal with. The front section will contain contain more mental health-related issues, while the back section speaks to broader feminist issues.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Zine 3 is now UPSIZING! While the fundraising was going on, we had a fantastic response from readers & contributors alike, and we couldn't resist: we're adding 27 NEW PAGES to the zine!! This does mean printing costs have changed, but we don't want to change the zine price either: that wouldn't be fair to those who have bought it, and we believe in our message AND in making this important information accessible. Indiegogo won't let us increase the fundraiser amount either, which is not a big deal- we're counting on you to help us reach the total goal!

Unfortunately, this issue doesn't have the same sponsorship as the last issue, so this zine will cost more to print. What this means is that we'll be shouldering more of the financial burden ourselves than before, and we'll need your help with:

  • Printing costs (500 copies) -̶ ̶$̶3̶3̶0̶0̶ ̶  $4400
  • Contributors' fees - $900
  • Shipping costs; handling and printing perks; Indiegogo fees (5% of everything raised & bank transfer for fundraising in SGD) -  ̶$̶3̶4̶2̶ $397

 

That means we need $1155 more: and we're counting on you!

You'll be able to get not only this latest zine, but many goodies exclusive to this fundraiser. We're going big (then going home) with this very last crowdfund, and our contributors have poured their heart and soul into offering you these lovely perks, so we hope you love them too. All of these are offered at a discounted price, so grab them before they run out!

Even if we don't hit our fundraiser goal, the zines will be print-to-order, which means you'll still receive the zine and any perks you've selected! 

Shipping costs are based on Singpost's postage rates. We ship worldwide. The zines and perks will be shipped via normal mail, as registered mail is not currently an option. (If you'd like to opt for registered mail, that is available on our Ecwid store at a later date, but the zine will not be offered at the same discounted price!) 

We are also providing up to 15 free copies for those who are unable to afford it- just reach out to us via localfeminists@gmail.com. 

 

Why Get TLR #3?

This issue, we’re focusing on the Self. We wanted a look at our personal well-being; patterns and/or behaviours that used to help us survive before but weigh us down now; the invisible battles we fight within ourselves; understanding why we react the way we do. Overall, this zine hopes to show how we can listen to ourselves better. How can we treat ourselves with kindness? How do we tend to our bodies, in a world that continues to other us? 

 

 

In today's fast-paced news cycle, we wanted to create a resource you could slow down and take your time with. Having this in print allows you to hold it in your hands, explore the issues we discuss, sit with all you've learnt, and indulge in the breathers.

 

Perks You Can Get!

We're excited to offer you an array of perks this time round, which you can get alongside this zine! We wanted to pull out all the stops as well as pay tribute to all our contributors, from this issue and previous issues, so we asked them to offer whatever piece of joy and/or art they would like to showcase. This is what they came up with: 

  • 3 watercolour prints (A4)  to choose from by our lovely illustrator, Natasha Mamonova

 

You can grab these as a solo companion to your zine, or, if you want to treat yourself, all three! These watercolour illustrations are printed on white cardstock paper.

 

 

  • Acephobia: a mini-zine (12 pages) by our editor, Qis, satirising ace-exclusionists
  • Art & Chill: a mini-zine (16 pages) by our head designer, Myrah, depicting one's journey of mental health through COVID-19 times
  • Meditation as a Tool for Collective Liberation (8 pages) by our contributor, Leanna, navigating meditation & yoga for marginalised folk 

 

 

You can also get past copies of TLR: Exploration (#1) and TLR: Roots (#2) with the Super TLR Bundle! As they've sold out and we're not doing another print run for these, this will only be available as in PDF form, with TLR: Self (#3) in print. 

 

Stretch Goals

Help us reach our mini-goals to unlock even cooler perks!

 

3 exclusive artworks of embroidered coral reefs on canvas (7x7x1cm) from our comic artist, Clarisse Bu. Clarisse finds ways to embroider unconventional, ‘un-healable’ materials such as primed canvas or paper, using these mediums to create abstract images that appear frozen in motion. The works offered in this perk were created for TLR in their zine’s aesthetic colourway; cool-toned blues and greens with pops of neon-pastel purples and pinks!

 

A self-care themed sticker set from our illustrator Natasha Mamonova who works with traditional and digital mediums. Her works hope to share childlike wonder through colourful imagery and stylized characters. The prints and stickers offered for this perk showcase themes of mental health and self acceptance - a reminder that healing is a process with high's and low's, but that is important nonetheless. This sticker set is made with waterproof vinyl material. 

 

How Else You Can Help

  • Tell your friends about us! Spread our crowdfunding campaign all over social media! 
  • If you would like to stock us, email us localfeminists@gmail.com
  • If you're an educator, facilitator, consultant or otherwise would like to buy TLR in bulk for your organisation, reach out at localfeminists@gmail.com

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
What's TLR #3 about?
The Local Rebel is a zine publication that aims to educate and empower our youth. In past issues, we’ve covered primers on feminism and decolonisation, uncovered class issues and xenophobia, navigated queer identities and more! This time round, we wanted to take it slow, focus on just one crucial issue: especially so in today's world wracked by a pandemic, a fraught political climate, and numerous flashpoints surrounding race, religion, and sexuality. 
Dig into TLR #3 for:

A comic about family estrangement
How to spot red flags in relationships
An art therapy directive!
An essay on conversion therapy for queer folk
A tarot and yoga guide for 2020
And more!

 


 
Our team is dedicated to making this zine an accessible and fun educational resource. Expect not just thoughtful essays, but also ‘breathers’ for you to process and appreciate our zine: playlists, colouring pages, and more! This zine is also colour-coded, so you know off the bat how heavy a particular piece can get- and you can flip to a section that’s slightly easier to deal with. The front section will contain contain more mental health-related issues, while the back section speaks to broader feminist issues.
 

 

What We Need & What You Get
Zine 3 is now UPSIZING! While the fundraising was going on, we had a fantastic response from readers & contributors alike, and we couldn't resist: we're adding 27 NEW PAGES to the zine!! This does mean printing costs have changed, but we don't want to change the zine price either: that wouldn't be fair to those who have bought it, and we believe in our message AND in making this important information accessible. Indiegogo won't let us increase the fundraiser amount either, which is not a big deal- we're counting on you to help us reach the total goal!
Unfortunately, this issue doesn't have the same sponsorship as the last issue, so this zine will cost more to print. What this means is that we'll be shouldering more of the financial burden ourselves than before, and we'll need your help with:

story:
This Moment in Time

About Camille:

I am first a mother, community activist, certified peer specialist and a Navy veteran during our ongoing conflicts. Born and raised in Philadelphia, PA. I am continuing to live here and serve my community because I believe that my purpose is here. I've always been a leader, helper, and giver. So I'm looking to combine those attributes and help to give light to dark places. 

As a certified peer specialist, I am a person who uses my life experiences in order to assist someone (my peer) in recovery. Recovery from what you may ask? If you think to yourself we ALL have experienced something that we've had to or would like to gain clarity of, recover, and be better on the other side that experience.

 

About this campaign: 

This is the launch of my business, Answer The Bell. Filling my role as your Image Consultant, building positive image of self, this is the Real Talk Advice Fundraiser. Included in this fundraiser, is a convenient way to preview the type of counsel and assistance my services provide. With every donation I grant you one question, one answer, PRACTICAL advice. Not the type of advice you learn from a textbook. CHECK OUT THE PERKS ----->

Anonymous questions can be asked with this link: https://ask.fm/AnswerTheBell

or email questions to info@atbphl.com

CHECK OUT our full list of services (below)

& make your appointments

by way of our FACEBOOK page @ AnswerTheBell

 

So you need me?

I SURE DO! As we all are social creatures, now is the time when I need your support & this is where the funds will go :

  • I am looking to raise $500. Starting a business obviously requires funds, small or large. With your donations I will solidify a location for Answer The Bell's very first event!  
  • IF AND WHEN we exceed this goal I will provide a donation to my local community outreach program, RBGFRIDAYS, in order for us to provide a great resource of food for the people.
  • If some chain of unfortunate events happen and we do not reach our intended goal, I will still use the funds collected to provide a loving atmosphere for our first event. 

 

The Impact

As a community activist, I see a very real need for people to learn more about themselves. Of course no one can TELL you who you are, but we all constantly have people molding us along the way. Some of us have a path of destruction laid out for us. Most of us don't realize that we possess all the tools we need to correct that path. Just as a friend, associate, and listener, I've provided peers with my services before I ever realized I possessed the ability to heal with my words and experiences.

Below I've provided a few kind words from people I've shared a moment in time with: 

“You have definitely helped me several times! Help heal people if that is what your calling is. Love ya.” (K.H., wife & mother, PA)

"This is awesome the community needs someone like you! No tips, all words of encouragement! You keep it raw, while remaining pure and genuine simultaneously!" (K.C. Mother/Healer, PA)

"You have always been an honest and positive in my life. Words of truth whether I want to hear them or not. Never steered me wrong." (M.E. Father/ Content Creator, PA)

“The strengths of your counseling are, it's easy to talk to you, it's a very down to earth type of feeling. I believe that is imperative for this profession. People have to feel comfortable and open to talk about certain situations. The next strength is your forward thinking yet realistic attitude towards life, you top it off with positivity. Your advice itself doesn't feels pushed, nor too opinionated, its levelheaded.” (R.W., Mother/Healer)

 

Risks & Challenges

I honestly do not forsee any challenges for reaching the goal here. I am an overcomer and again if our goal is not met I will still move forward providing an awesome service that I know my community deserves. Because who doesn't deserve to be healed, whole, and loved absolutely? 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many avenues to take in helping build strong, positive images and outlooks in our community. If you are someone who can not donate at this time, I'd love for you to do one or ALL THREE of these actions listed below:

1) Please tell a friend to tell a friend about Answer The Bell.

2) I have 2 community outreach programs I participate with and we would love to see your smiling face. That is at RBGFridays, every single Friday @ Broad & Girard from 5-8pm AND the North Philly Peace Park, located at 22nd & Jefferson. Work parties scheduled every Sunday starting at NOON! Join us in building a better Us which in turn builds a better YOU.

3) Tell someone you LOVE them and mean it. We all need LOVE.

 

Peace & Love. Thank you for your time. I can not say that enough.

C. Bell AKA Zoona

3) Tell someone you LOVE them and mean it. We all need LOVE.
