story:
TOGETHER WE CAN CHANGE THE WOMEN’S FERTILITY HEALTH CRISIS IN AMERICA!

 

With YOUR support, the Women’s Ovarian & Medical Education Network will save the lives and fertility of thousands with California’s first ever preventative care mobile ultrasound clinic! Our friends at Matthews Speciality Vehicles have developed our blueprint for a state of the art mobile ultrasound clinic, fully furnished with medical supplies, ultrasound machines and HIPPA compliant technology!

The Women’s Ovarian & Medical Education Network is an active federally recognized 501(c)(3) non-profit public benefit organization. Your contributions to this project are fully tax deductible, less the fair market value of any reward gifts.

 

OUR MENU OF FREE PREVENTATIVE CARE SERVICES

✔ External & Internal (transvaginal) ultrasounds to identify fertility conditions or gynecologic cancers in their earliest stages as they are often present without symptoms.

✔ One on one consultations with Obstetricians/Gynecologists to review each client's results, what they mean, and the next steps to ensure proper monitoring and care for any conditions that may be identified during the visit.

✔  Preventative Care from fully licensed physicians. No insurance approval needed.

✔ Instant printed sonogram images for women to take to their doctors, finally eliminating the burden of "proof" required by insurance companies.

✔ IMMEDIATE answers. There are few things worse than thinking something is wrong with your health, finally getting a scan, and then having to wait 1 or 2 weeks for the answers. All clients will receive their ultrasound results within the same visit!

✔ Pelvic Exams to identify any potential unknown abnormalities before conducting an ultrasound.

WHAT WE DO- The women's preventative care battle

The Women's Ovarian & Medical Education Network is  dedicated to alleviating the fertility risks faced by women through education, advocacy, and research. By serving as the voice to end the silence on the common conditions that lead to impaired fertility, advocating for equitable healthcare on a local and statewide level, and mobilizing around access to preventative care, we can increase healthcare equity and decrease infertility in women.

Since 2016 we have been working directly with women and sadly, we see that even after informing women on how to identify the silent signs and symptoms of early infertility conditions or gynecologic cancers, the battle for PREVENTATIVE CARE is still present. We have received endless calls and emails of women sharing their own stories of discovering late stage cancer, or being rushed to the emergency room for a growing tumor they were never aware of, despite multiple doctors visits. This crisis will continue unless women have access to preventative care ultrasounds which are not considered standard care by the insurance industry.

W.O.M.E.N. Inc on the National Stage

The CEO and founder of the Women’s Ovarian & Medical Education Network knew that it would take a unique path to get women’s fertility health in the headlines. In 2017 she decided to do whatever it would take, even if that meant sharing her own fertility health story and running for Mrs. California. Upon winning the crown of Mrs. California and continuing on to the National Mrs. America Pageant, the message of women's preventative care and the mission of W.O.M.E.N. Inc swept across the state and was covered by CBS News.

Women’s health is more important than corporate wealth!

Insurance companies refuse to include ultrasounds in a woman’s “annual exam”. 

Even worse, women are being told to wait 3 to 5 years for a pap smear.

Women need a place where they can get an ultrasound without dropping $300-$500 just to make sure they’re healthy!

Nationally, the United States is not investing in fertility related preventative care, rather reactive treatment-- which is why IVF treatment and egg counting is becoming a popular topic.

One ultrasound can prevent the need for women to ever need to seek IVF; However, that means certain industries will lose millions of dollars. 

Our mobile unit will provide free preventative care ultrasounds and one on one consultations to women with INSTANT answers and next steps for care. The unit will visit prime locations for women at risk: college campuses, businesses, city center, and other locations in which women between 20 and 40 years old have an active presence, but girls and women of all ages can and will be served by W.O.M.E.N. Inc.

OUR CROWDFUNDING GOAL

One (1) Series 4000WB-38 Mobile Ultrasound Clinic...............$264,295.00

Our Indiegogo Project funding goal is based on the initial cost for the mobile ultrasound clinic, but our additional operating costs needed to bring this life changing care to women are $225,000 for  a total of $475,000.

If our project meets our minimum fundraising goal listed, we will continue our local efforts to fundraise the remaining difference in order to bring this project to fruition. In showing our private funders YOUR nation wide support and belief in the urgency of women's preventative fertility care, our goal is to raise the additional capital by December 31, 2019. Construction of the mobile ultrasound unit will begin upon raising 80% of our overall goal and is estimated to take 6 months for full construction.

 

 

DONOR REWARDS 

Check out the details of our extensive list of donor rewards in the Rewards column on the right! All donor levels include the gifts in ALL levels below! 

Added BONUS: All donations are tax deductible as the Women's Ovarian & Medical Education Network is a federally recognized 501(c)(3) public charity corporation. 

 

For more information visit our website: www.theWOMENinc.org

story:
Short Summary

  • Hello dream catchers! I'm Dellasie; a philanthropist, public speaker, CEO and recording artist. I started my philanthropy career 5 years ago after being invited to some schools to speak to children about my career. Being able to touch those kids was so inspiring to me.  I was also deeply inspired by my late uncle KOFI ANNAN. I wanted to do more than entertain and touch people with my music/performances. I wanted to make a real difference in the world like he did, so I asked him for advice. He said, "Go home and think of what makes you upset. Use that energy to fuel your drive for change'. A brilliant and unorthodox method. That is precisely what I did lol! I thought about colorism in the entertainment industry and throughout the world. I thought about the psychological, historical and health implications of this phenomenon. I realized this was a huge contributing factor to skin cancer trends in communities of color... I was inspired to make a change. 
  • This issue is so important to me because my aunt passed from melanoma when I was 11 years old. I have seen the adverse effects of skin bleaching on so many. Cancer is so pervasive; both my parents are cancer survivors. My life has been deeply touched by various types of cancer, but skin cancer due to bleaching was something that really touched me. I am a darkskin woman who understand first-hand the effects of colorism on one's psyche and confidence. My anti-bleaching skin cancer initiative was thus born. I started doing research and I put together a comprehensive proposal. I started getting invited to platforms to speak on this issue (such as: the United Nations, Washington University, Georgetown University, Microsoft Headquarters, etc).
  • Investing in this endeavor will mean that you will play an integral part to effecting change in an area that is severely under-reported, under-represented, and under-researched. Your funding will help me conduct critical research, visit areas where access to important medical care is limited, conduct powerful and inspiring speeches for young people around the country, continent and diaspora, and change lives. 

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down in more detail:

  • I am requesting $10,000 which will fund my work over the next 6 months to a year. That price includes the cost of travel (airplane and car depending on location), the registration fees for the conferences and congresses I have been invited to speak on, the marketing and filming fees for the work I'm doing to keep a digital diary of my progress, and the various logistical costs for the education/media tour I plan to launch in 2022. 
  • Perks include access to a private digital diary of behind the scenes personal footage and exclusive information in terms of the progress of this initiative. 
  • If I do not reach my entire goal, whatever funding I do receive will go towards registering for as many conferences as I can. My hope is that through my passionate and engaging speeches, I will inspire some medical professionals in the field to join this initiative and assist with their resources and their access. 

The Impact

  • This project is valuable to the world because it doesn't just effect Black people, it effects every single person of color on earth. Skin cancer is pervasive and actually effects all communities (including Europeans) -- but colorism directly effects those of color. I think it's important to show the world that all colors and shades of people are beautiful. Diversity is beautiful, and it's what makes humankind so amazing. With your help, we can spread this message to everyone who needs to hear it. There are so many medical implications of this practice, and millions of those who bleach their skin do not realize how dangerous this practice is. The goal is to prevent this very serious issue from becoming an epidemic. We can be a part of the solution before things escalate to dangerously deadly. levels. 

Risks & Challenges

  • A big risk in this work that I am very aware of is my safety. Skin bleaching is a billion dollar business, and many multinational corporations have made huge profits off of this practice. The work I'm doing definitely poses a threat to their capital. Many of the dignitaries and professionals in the field I have discussed my work with have warned me to be careful and work trepidatiously to reduce the risk to my safety. Another challenge is the lack of dermatologists on the continent to care for those that are at risk. There are millions of people per 1 dermatologist in sub-Saharan Africa. In the West, there are about 1,200 people for every dermatologist. These numbers are staggering. 
  • In Angola, the government has subsidized education in dermatology for their youth. They give grants to young students to obtain dermatology degrees. I think this is a great initiative that should be adopted by other nations around Africa. I would like to appeal to some of the government representatives and see how we may initiate these kinds of incentives for the youth. As far as my safety, I plan to be as careful and vigilant as possible. But I do understand that this is a risk I am willing to take. This cause is very important and it needs the world's attention. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Not everyone has the capital to donate funding, and that I do understand. You can help by sharing this campaign to your following; looking at dermatologists in your area, and appealing to them by sending them this information -- or even providing any information you may have that subsidizes travel fees for a philanthropist in the field like me. 
  • You can also use the various Indiegogo share tools! That would be deeply appreciated.

story:
Did you know that focusing on the breath is a common trauma trigger?

Most meditation programs begin by guiding us to focus on our breath. For trauma survivors, this is not the best way to begin meditating.  Forcing ourselves to focus on our breath and turn inward goes against our traumatized physiology, which is focusing outward in order to keep us safe. How can we honor this innate intelligence, rather than override it? This audio program offers solutions, finally making the benefits of a meditation practice more accessible for trauma survivors.

Kristina's story

My own trauma stems from having been sexually abused as a child. I began processing this trauma as an adult, experiencing flashbacks, panic attacks, anxiety, and shame during my struggle to heal.

During this time, I helped produce hundreds of meditation audios in my role as managing editor for a major publisher of meditation books and audios.

I heard of all the research-proven benefits of meditation, like reduced stress and improved concentration (see infographic on these benefits in the Gallery). I tried to set up my own meditation practice. Yet I failed again and again. 

Then I realized why I had failed  at establishing a meditation practice. There were 2 basic reasons:

  1. Focusing on the breath was triggering my trauma
  2. Meditation involves turning our attention inward - the opposite of a trauma-impacted survival instinct which keeps our attention focused outward on the external environment.

Understanding this helped me turn frustration and shame into self-compassion. Every meditation program I had ever encountered started out with the instruction to focus on my breath, and this was counterproductive for me as a trauma survivor!

Over several years, I developed and used a handful of approaches that helped me honor my survival instinct and redirect it so that I would be able to meditate.

Now, I'm excited to share these practices, to give fellow trauma survivors a gentler entry into a meditation practice. One that avoids shame and self-blame and makes the benefits of meditation accessible.

The Program

Trauma-Informed Meditation Exercises is an audio program, which will be available as both a CD and a downloadable audio. It is 67 minutes long and consists of spoken word audio plus 7 guided practices for a customizable experience. See the image gallery for our final product cover, designed by Lisa Kerans!
>>> Full track list has been added to the "Updates" section! <<<

Already Professionally Produced & Recorded

The program was recorded in October at Sounds True's recording studio in Boulder, Colorado.
It was produced by Randy Roark, who has produced big names in the worlds of both meditation and trauma, including Peter Levine, Jack Kornfield, Dan Siegel, Maggie Phillips, Rick Hanson, and Lisa Wimberger.
Our audio files have been finalized, and we are now working on the packaging!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're willing, please support our campaign by:

  • Helping us get the word out by sharing this page with your friends
  • Using Indiegogo's social share tools to share online
  • Reviewing this product on Amazon

More by this Author

Kristina Cizmar is creator of The Ten Keys Holistic Approach to Healing for Adult Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse, a free online resource at tenkeys.org . Also known as The Shame Lady, Kristina is the author of The Little Book of Shame: What shame really means, and how to shift from low self-esteem to empowering self-acceptance, a book based on her popular workshop which offers concrete tools for escaping the infamous shame cycle. 
Special thanks to Jeff Deen for the music used in the video and introductory track on the CD. For more on Jeff, visit www.JeffDeen.com

story:
Why Celebrant School?

I feel like the roads of my life have been leading towards this career path.  Several years ago two of my friends asked me to solemnize (aka be the officiant) at their wedding. They thought I would be good at something like that. I considered it and thought, yes, I would like to try that, and I would love to give that gift to my friends.

And then another couple asked me to officiate, and then another.  Each time I performed a ceremony I applied to be a one-day solemnizer in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Each ceremony was different and special. I customized each ceremony to the couple and what they wanted, adding what I learned each time to the next one. One fun thing that each couple had in common was the fact that I met them all through flying trapeze, as at least one member of each couple was a fellow instructor, like myself.  

I'll be preparing another union ceremony, this time for a friend that I met through martial arts.  

Creating these ceremonies of love with each of them involves a number of skills I have:  

  • My performance skills certainly come in handy, as ritual is a bit of a performance. The ability to feel comfortable speaking and projecting in front of a group of people is definitely important.
  • I have a great interest in ritual, and especially in creating ceremonies that reach beyond traditional religion. I myself am not a religious person, though I consider myself a spiritual person. And there are growing number of people who do not subscribe to a religion, but still are looking for someone to help facilitate rituals to help mark the milestones of their lives.  My Master's Thesis involved a performance project that included a humorous theatrical look at ritual and its companion paper explored the connections between play, ritual, humor, and healing.

These experiences and skills, plus conversations I have had with fellow members of the hospital clowning group of which I am a professional member of, encouraged me to seek out more education in this field and to become a Celebrant.  I found The Celebrant Institute, based out of New Jersey, applied, and was accepted.  I am interested in starting my training in January of 2017.  And that's where you come in...

What I Need & What You Get

  • The initial tuition for The Celebrant Institute is $2500.  It is based on Montclair, NJ but I plan to do their online training. This training includes learning the fundamentals of celebrancy, becoming well-versed in wedding celebrancy in particular, and becoming a Certified Celebrant. In the future, if I want to continue my training (and I am interested in doing so) each future specialization is $1100 - these specializations include funerals/celebrations of life, LGBTQ-specific ceremonies, ceremonies for healing, and more. But I would like to finish the initial training, which is 7 months long, and begin practicing and growing this new career path first.

  • In exchange for your support, I have a few different perks to offer you
    • For $500 I will work with you to create a ceremony, as we see fit.  This is available to folks in Massachusetts, or possibly elsewhere depending on a variety of factors. Please ask questions if you think this might be right for you! You will also have access to a digital copy of the online reflection journal I will keep during my studies.
    • For $250 I'll combine my skills as a personal trainer with my love of ritual and create a 90-minute workout just for you and  up to 10 of your friends. I did this for my 40th birthday and then a few months later for my friend's 40th birthday and it was a blast!  This is available to folks living in Massachusetts, but possibly elsewhere depending on a variety of factors. Ask questions if you think this might be right for you! You will also receive a digital copy of my reflection journal.
    • $100 will give you 2 hours of consultation (not necessarily sequential) on creating a ceremony of your own and/or how to bring more joy and play to your event plus a digital copy of my journal.
    • $50 will give you 1 hour of consultation similar to the aforementioned perk plus a digital copy of my journal.
    • $25 will give you access to a digital copy of my journal.
    • $10 will grant you my undying gratitude and the knowledge that you have helped me on the next phase of my career and life.
  • All funds will go towards my tuition.  If I make extra, I will apply them towards further celebrant training.

Making an Impact

  • Ceremony is filled with love, joy, sometimes grief, but always transformation. We need that in the world now more than ever...
  • I have been able to successfully complete two other training/education projects via Indiegogo and it has enriched my life in various ways - not just through the training but through the immense community support I received.

Risks & Challenges

  • If I don't reach my goal I will supplement the difference with as much funding as I can out-of-pocket or I will ask to postpone my start date, if possible.  
  • If illness or another life event creates a situation by which I cannot participate in these studies, I will either postpone my training or seek another method of training (there are other programs of this nature).

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word - Facebook, your website, person-to-person, via email.
  • Even if you cannot contribute monetarily at this time, word-of-mouth has gone a long way in my previous campaigns and I expect this one to be the same.

Thank you for supporting this project. I'm so excited for this adventure!

Why Celebrant School?
I feel like the roads of my life have been leading towards this career path.  Several years ago two of my friends asked me to solemnize (aka be the officiant) at their wedding. They thought I would be good at something like that. I considered it and thought, yes, I would like to try that, and I would love to give that gift to my friends.
And then another couple asked me to officiate, and then another.  Each time I performed a ceremony I applied to be a one-day solemnizer in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Each ceremony was different and special. I customized each ceremony to the couple and what they wanted, adding what I learned each time to the next one. One fun thing that each couple had in common was the fact that I met them all through flying trapeze, as at least one member of each couple was a fellow instructor, like myself.  
I'll be preparing another union ceremony, this time for a friend that I met through martial arts.  
Creating these ceremonies of love with each of them involves a number of skills I have:  

My performance skills certainly come in handy, as ritual is a bit of a performance. The ability to feel comfortable speaking and projecting in front of a group of people is definitely important.
I have a great interest in ritual, and especially in creating ceremonies that reach beyond traditional religion. I myself am not a religious person, though I consider myself a spiritual person. And there are growing number of people who do not subscribe to a religion, but still are looking for someone to help facilitate rituals to help mark the milestones of their lives.  My Master's Thesis involved a performance project that included a humorous theatrical look at ritual and its companion paper explored the connections between play, ritual, humor, and healing.

These experiences and skills, plus conversations I have had with fellow members of the hospital clowning group of which I am a professional member of, encouraged me to seek out more education in this field and to become a Celebrant.  I found The Celebrant Institute, based out of New Jersey, applied, and was accepted.  I am interested in starting my training in January of 2017.  And that's where you come in...
What I Need & What You Get

The initial tuition for The Celebrant Institute is $2500.  It is based on Montclair, NJ but I plan to do their online training. This training includes learning the fundamentals of celebrancy, becoming well-versed in wedding celebrancy in particular, and becoming a Certified Celebrant. In the future, if I want to continue my training (and I am interested in doing so) each future specialization is $1100 - these specializations include funerals/celebrations of life, LGBTQ-specific ceremonies, ceremonies for healing, and more. But I would like to finish the initial training, which is 7 months long, and begin practicing and growing this new career path first.
In exchange for your support, I have a few different perks to offer you
For $500 I will work with you to create a ceremony, as we see fit.  This is available to folks in Massachusetts, or possibly elsewhere depending on a variety of factors. Please ask questions if you think this might be right for you! You will also have access to a digital copy of the online reflection journal I will keep during my studies.
For $250 I'll combine my skills as a personal trainer with my love of ritual and create a 90-minute workout just for you and  up to 10 of your friends. I did this for my 40th birthday and then a few months later for my friend's 40th birthday and it was a blast!  This is available to folks living in Massachusetts, but possibly elsewhere depending on a variety of factors. Ask questions if you think this might be right for you! You will also receive a digital copy of my reflection journal.
$100 will give you 2 hours of consultation (not necessarily sequential) on creating a ceremony of your own and/or how to bring more joy and play to your event plus a digital copy of my journal.
$50 will give you 1 hour of consultation similar to the aforementioned perk plus a digital copy of my journal.
$25 will give you access to a digital copy of my journal.
$10 will grant you my undying gratitude and the knowledge that you have helped me on the next phase of my career and life.


All funds will go towards my tuition.  If I make extra, I will apply them towards further celebrant training.

Making an Impact

Ceremony is filled with love, joy, sometimes grief, but always transformation. We need that in the world now more than ever...
I have been able to successfully complete two other training/education projects via Indiegogo and it has enriched my life in various ways - not just through the training but through the immense community support I received.


Risks & Challenges

If I don't reach my goal I will supplement the difference with as much funding as I can out-of-pocket or I will ask to postpone my start date, if possible.  
If illness or another life event creates a situation by which I cannot participate in these studies, I will either postpone my training or seek another method of training (there are other programs of this nature).


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word - Facebook, your website, person-to-person, via email.
Even if you cannot contribute monetarily at this time, word-of-mouth has gone a long way in my previous campaigns and I expect this one to be the same.

Thank you for supporting this project. I'm so excited for this adventure!

story:
I have been writing songs and performing for almost 30 years.

I have been teaching music and special education in diverse settings in public school for almost 15 years.

10 years ago I went on a journey, became a yoga + mindfulness teacher, and the rest of my life changed forever.

I am creating this project in order to share what I learned on this journey.  To share my passion, purpose and story; to use all my gifts, skills, talents, experience and background to serve your well-being and to make a valuable contribution to our world.

Mostly, I am doing it to inspire YOU.  To move your heart and soul.  To get you singing, humming, or tapping along.

I want to light a spark, and help you start (or continue) to walk a healthy, joyful, connected path in life with your kids, your students or community.

I know when I hear a song I love (or any song for that matter!), the words, rhythm and melodies go around and around in my head many times while I am moving about my day.  It is hard to get that music out of me!!!

That’s good news for my mission in life – to promote wellness using arts, culture and creativity – If there is a healthy message that can be wrapped up inside a catchy tune, then that song can inspire you, and hopefully stick around like a good friend!

I know there is a lot of music out there on the radio, TV + internet these days, that doesn’t necessarily contain meaningful words or messages - that doesn’t nourish or feed the soul….I’ve been asking a deeper question: what does feed your soul?

I want to feed  you + your family (or students) with some homegrown (wholesome) organic stuff.

Good for the mind, body and soul.  Rich in nutrients, full of energy.

Music has enriched and given meaning to my life more than anything, so this is the greatest gift I have to share.

I hope that if a whole bunch of people feel moved at the same time, then they just *might* feel called to sing together….and our world just *might* be filled with a little more hope, a little more health, a little more light.  I’m really hoping A LOT more, because I feel we need it, and I KNOW I do!!!  Have you noticed the world spinning faster and faster? Does it feel stressful, uncertain or overwhelming sometimes?

I created each song in this project in order to evoke a different feeling, and to express a different message.

For example, I have infused ‘I Am A Sunflower’ with a joyful, powerful feeling, and the message I want to share is: ‘with love anyone or anything can grow’.

‘Climb Inside My Boat’ has a deep, soulful feeling, and the message is: ‘you can create a sense of safety inside yourself’.

I have created these songs based on what I am feeling and experiencing in my own life, and the lives of those I love and the people around me.

I interact with children everyday, and I know how to use words that speak to them in ways they will understand.  I share music is so many different settings, I also know how to express music in ways that appeal to people of all ages.

This fall I will record ‘Waves of Change: Songs to Move your World - 7 catchy tunes to help adults + kids share joy, ease + flow’.  In April, I went into the studio with my producer, Jerry Brodey; we recorded the first song for the project, called, ‘I Am A Sunflower’ (featured in the video) with several stellar local musicians.   It was powerful standing at the Root Down Studio in Toronto, singing with 4 sweet voices. I felt like I was floating.  I can imagine YOUR VOICE adding another interesting and beautiful layer.

Singing is not just for the professionals, it’s for all of us, and it feels good. It’s our birthright!!

I LOVE to collaborate, and I LOVE to share. As I continue along the journey of creation, I am so grateful for your support and presence: it motivates and energizes me.

I really and truly want to create this recording WITH you and FOR you.

Making something together is called ‘co-creation’, and I firmly believe when we work together, something bigger, brighter, better is possible.

I can’t do this alone, and that’s why I need your help.

Many people and materials are needed to bring the vision to life.

With your help, musicians can be hired and properly compensated for their hard work, along with studio rental, producing, engineering, mastering, manufacturing and marketing costs for the album.  You can help make it possible for ‘Waves of Change’ to land in the hands of people, families, classrooms and communities who can benefit.  I hope YOU can enjoy and benefit from the music!

If you can join in and help out, I PROMISE to do my very best to take the wisdom I’ve gained in life + music + teaching + yoga (& mindfulness) so far, wrap it up in the most beautiful musical package possible, and gift it to you.

For those who can contribute a bit more, I will come IN PERSON and deliver music to you, PLUS hands-on teachings in yoga + mindfulness.

Wellness is a gift.  Music is a gift.

Please make a contribution to ‘Waves of Change’ and together we can share these gifts.

Much love, straight from my heart to yours,

XOXOX
Marni

 

Let's make it a reality!

Waves of Change: Songs to Move Your World
7 catchy tunes to help adults + kids share joy, ease + flow

Coming soon.....

story:
Imagine an Eco-Wellness Oasis in the depths of a lush and forever green Rain-forest.An eco Conscious sustainable development located on an island in the rich and nourishing Parish of Portland, Jamaica.

I Am Akashi and during a hospital visit in 2009 where I was informed of a compromised immune system, I was inspired to create an alternative healing space for those on their personal Journi of Self Love, healing and transformation.

 

The vision is to utilize 10 acres of land which has been secured that will thrive as a sustainable wellness center, community organic farm, vegan food cafe, fabulous retreat destination, martial arts training ground, meditation and yoga center, indigenous arts culture and music therapy space, outdoor spa, with nine cottages for long term healing therapy.

  With your generous contribution you will witness and receive the benefits of the seeds you have sown. 

Now let us create!

THE PROJECT: 

 

LIVING AKASHI Guesthouse & Gardens will be an alternative way for the non-conventional tourist. We invite people to come and stay in a uniquely beautiful place in the heart of the lush tropical rainforest on the Rio Grande River in Portland Jamaica. 

 

The goal is to create a eco-wellness center based on self-sufficiency, where everyone can learn to live holistically and sustainably, relax, heal naturally, attend educational workshops and express creativity.

LIVING AKASHI Guesthouse & Gardens will use all sustainable development concepts such as bio construction, rainwater harvesting, solar energy, and organic farming while using the healing arts such as yoga, meditation, live vegan foods, sound and water therapy.

 

 

PROCEEDS:

A portion of  the profits of Living Akashi will go towards neighboring communities and we will build a cultural arts and music center that will provide work opportunities in farming and the arts.

 

A portion will go to paying the workers to complete this project for our dreamland, as well as costs to help provide the the funding for the start up amenities we envision having on the land to make your stay at the cabins the most memorable and transformative experience  ever. 

Living Akashi Organic Farms 

 

I Am Because Of You!


Living Akashi has touched the lives of a few thousand people in 450 homes, 44 states and 5 countries globally since 2010!
Supporting others on their personal journey to wholeness by sharing the message of self love and how to align with it is the fuel that continues to charge my soul today.
Living Akashi is a path to aligning ones self with your inner ability to heal which begins by making a commitment to live and live life abundantly.
Daily commitment to eating vegan living foods, participating in mind/body therapy through meditation, yoga and intentional love, herbal compounds, a naturally healing environment and a guide to assist in your personal transformation is the 
Journi.

Realizing The Vision:


After 9 years of global travel, experiencing very personal and intimate stories,  disheartening diagnosis and transformations to many, I Am now ready to realize my vision in an environment suited for healing.  
In 2017,  I launched my own sustainable wholeness community in the rich and healing parish of Portland, Jamaica. 
This is The Living Akashi Transformation Center
I Am grateful to introduce a holistic platform to sustainable community development.   
Our health is our greatest asset, make an investment that will return to you abundantly

~Akashi

Our Goal & Gift To You

Sowing seeds of love into our Holistic Sustainable Community will transform the lives of the individuals that partake in this experience as well as the natives that live in Portland, Jamaica.  There will be opportunities for the natives to share their gifts of healing through their ancient and passed down knowledge of the healing powers of herbs, natural plant based foods, the transforming powers of the waters, natural skin and body products and endless ways to align you with your inner power to heal yourself.  We currently hold retreats in this area and have access to many of the beautiful treasures that Portland has to offer however there is much more to accomplish in the development of the land space.
The total cost to clear land, farm, build structures, bridge and pathways, design and create with artisans, upkeep of waterfalls, springs, caves, creation of a vegan cafe and everything required to materialize this mission is $44,000. 

We will use $9,000 this season to focus on the infrastructure projects.


Several generous supporters have agreed to be present to assist by volunteering their time to farm, build and share their experience of "how to create" a sustainable community. 
We welcome you to join this effort!

 

 

MANY HANDS MAKE LIGHT WORK 

Please stand with us in our mission by giving whatever feels right for you. 
Share this project with all of your friends, family, social media connections and anyone who you know will benefit from what we are offering

Don't forget to select your perk on the right side bar by clicking on it -
We have several exciting perks for our generous contributors
One of my favorites:
Contribute $9,000 and you will be buying into the land to use 10 consecutive days annually until 2022.  This part of the land is yours to use in accordance with holistic guidelines and keeping the integrity of this intentional community in tact.
(Excellent Opportunity For Retreat Facilitators)
 

The Land

 

 

Wellness Discovered In Paradise

Portland, Jamaica is thee gateway portal to the ultimate healing for your soul. Tranquility and peace will be your guide as you discover ancient mystical rain forest with backdrops of wise musical calls of the bird Queendom. Abundant herbs, roots and fruits await your palette...Prepare to be pleased. Nights are cool and complement the warming rise of the sun. Stand in your Power as you on look the sea from your Royal mountain views. The Blue Mountains peak reaches a glorious 7,402 ft above sea level and what you will behold are seemingly infinite waves of cove, blue lagoon, coral reef, roaring rivers, cascading falls. Divine elements surround you and you will be humbled by it's magnitude. Stars bright, stars light and guide you to your destiny true. Allow yourself to be fully present with Jamaica and all of her soothing and rejuvenating powers.

Welcome To "Living Akashi" in Portland, Jamaica. 

Thank You For Supporting My Vision

 

 

_________________________________________________________

What is low immune function?

Low immune function refers to an underactive and poor performing immune system. The immune system’s prime function is to protect the body against infection and the development of cancer. Support and enhancement of the immune system is perhaps the most important step in achieving resistance to disease and reducing susceptibility to colds, flu and cancer. Supporting the immune system involves a health-promoting lifestyle, stress management, regular body movement, a healthy vegan lifestyle and the appropriate use of nutritional supplements and herbal medicines.

If you answer “yes” to any of the following questions, it is a sign that your immune system needs support:

Do you catch colds easily?

Do you get more than two colds a year?

Are you suffering chronic infection?

Do you get frequent cold sores or have genital herpes?

Are your lymph glands sore and swollen at times?

Do you have now or have you ever had cancer?

Recurrent or chronic infections-even very mild colds-only occur when the immune system is weakened. Under such circumstances, there is a repetitive cycle that makes it difficult to overcome the tendency toward infection: a weakened immune system leads to infection, infection causes damage to the immune system, which further weakens resistance. Enhancing the immune system can provide the answer to breaking the cycle.

 

What causes low immune function?

The health of the immune system is greatly impacted by a person’s emotional state, level of stress, lifestyle, dietary habits and nutritional status. Nutrient deficiency is the most frequent cause of a depressed immune system. An overwhelming number of clinical and experimental studies indicate that any single nutrient deficiency can profoundly impair the immune system.

We are so grateful to you and your support ~Living Akashi

By supporting this project you will co create a sacred space that offers health education, self empowerment, body purification and healing to people who have experienced a compromised immune system due to multiple circumstances and various diagnosis of the mind, body and spirit who are seeking a holistic and effective approach to their situation.

story:
So you want to hear our story... here it is

Comfort Farms: The Movie is a documentary film about one of the most interesting veteran run therapy programs in the country. Comfort Farms” will explore the struggles of veterans and the journey to make Comfort Farms a reality as a healing and therapeutic place for veterans to manage the symptoms of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and Traumatic brain injury (TBI) through a new and innovative approach called Agro Cognitive Behavioral Therapy.

Our approach for managing trauma can revolutionize the way trauma patients are cared for around the world. We have received so many emails, PMs, phone calls and invitations to speak concerning our program, that we decided to create a film that tells the story of how Comfort Farms came to be, the problems we face, and the solutions we provide. 

Carlisle Kellam will direct and shoot a short dramatic documentary film (produced by Dee Thompson and Carlisle Kellam) about Comfort Farms in Milledgeville Georgia—focusing on the struggles of combat veterans and founder/visionary Jon Jackson, a man who is committed to seeking healing for himself and others.

Interviews with veterans, people in the community, therapists, volunteers, farmers, and chefs will show how far Comfort Farms has come in just over 2 years of existence. Also explored will be the idea of the farm as a non-profit seeking to be partially self-sustaining, through sales of all natural produce and meats. It will also show how Comfort Farm's mission is to create a coalition of small family farms across Georgia to serve the community and restaurants seeking local and sustainable products managed by veterans who have been helped by the program. The film will be shown at film festivals and possibly distributed for broadcast.

What We Need & What You Get

By contributing to the funding of Comfort Farms: The Movie you will help spread a profound message of hope and healing. The goal is ultimately for Comfort Farms to be able to help more veterans and hopefully, one day establish more veteran and community-based outreach programs around the country.

Expect an exciting, suspenseful dramatic documentary that really puts the audience in the shoes of its subject.  

With your support, we will be successful 

Our budget to produce this film is $10K. With these funds, we will be able to produce high-quality footage and professional editing and follow along with the intense schedule that Comfort Farms commits to every day. 

Your support will not go unnoticed! We have perks lined up with bumper stickers, t-shirts, exclusive VIP tickets for our upcoming 2019 Boucherie, VIP invitations to a  private film release party, to be an associate producer for the film. At whatever level you can support us, we have a perk for you. 

The Impact

All Americans and especially veterans and their families want to see a drastic change in how veterans are healed. We all want to see our veterans receive the care they deserve without simply relying on the constant use of heavy medications. With your support, you will help us tell a unique story that goes to the root of veterans' issues and how we are able to jumpstart veterans in the service of supporting their communities and creating a system to help small family farms be successful. Veterans want to serve again! This film will create the network of partnerships around the country that will develop the Comfort Farms model in a way that shows dignity and respect to our nations heroes and the struggling communities they are fighting for.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people can-not assist financially to fund this campaign. So if you would like to help but can-not commit any funds financially please share this link on your social media to help us spread this campaign and help us promote it. We want to spread the message far and wide about the wonderful work we are doing on Comfort Farms.
story_txt:
So you want to hear our story... here it is
Comfort Farms: The Movie is a documentary film about one of the most interesting veteran run therapy programs in the country. Comfort Farms” will explore the struggles of veterans and the journey to make Comfort Farms a reality as a healing and therapeutic place for veterans to manage the symptoms of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and Traumatic brain injury (TBI) through a new and innovative approach called Agro Cognitive Behavioral Therapy.
Our approach for managing trauma can revolutionize the way trauma patients are cared for around the world. We have received so many emails, PMs, phone calls and invitations to speak concerning our program, that we decided to create a film that tells the story of how Comfort Farms came to be, the problems we face, and the solutions we provide. 
Carlisle Kellam will direct and shoot a short dramatic documentary film (produced by Dee Thompson and Carlisle Kellam) about Comfort Farms in Milledgeville Georgia—focusing on the struggles of combat veterans and founder/visionary Jon Jackson, a man who is committed to seeking healing for himself and others.
Interviews with veterans, people in the community, therapists, volunteers, farmers, and chefs will show how far Comfort Farms has come in just over 2 years of existence. Also explored will be the idea of the farm as a non-profit seeking to be partially self-sustaining, through sales of all natural produce and meats. It will also show how Comfort Farm's mission is to create a coalition of small family farms across Georgia to serve the community and restaurants seeking local and sustainable products managed by veterans who have been helped by the program. The film will be shown at film festivals and possibly distributed for broadcast.

What We Need & What You Get
By contributing to the funding of Comfort Farms: The Movie you will help spread a profound message of hope and healing. The goal is ultimately for Comfort Farms to be able to help more veterans and hopefully, one day establish more veteran and community-based outreach programs around the country.
Expect an exciting, suspenseful dramatic documentary that really puts the audience in the shoes of its subject.  
With your support, we will be successful 
Our budget to produce this film is $10K. With these funds, we will be able to produce high-quality footage and professional editing and follow along with the intense schedule that Comfort Farms commits to every day. 
Your support will not go unnoticed! We have perks lined up with bumper stickers, t-shirts, exclusive VIP tickets for our upcoming 2019 Boucherie, VIP invitations to a  private film release party, to be an associate producer for the film. At whatever level you can support us, we have a perk for you. 

The Impact
All Americans and especially veterans and their families want to see a drastic change in how veterans are healed. We all want to see our veterans receive the care they deserve without simply relying on the constant use of heavy medications. With your support, you will help us tell a unique story that goes to the root of veterans' issues and how we are able to jumpstart veterans in the service of supporting their communities and creating a system to help small family farms be successful. Veterans want to serve again! This film will create the network of partnerships around the country that will develop the Comfort Farms model in a way that shows dignity and respect to our nations heroes and the struggling communities they are fighting for.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some people can-not assist financially to fund this campaign. So if you would like to help but can-not commit any funds financially please share this link on your social media to help us spread this campaign and help us promote it. We want to spread the message far and wide about the wonderful work we are doing on Comfort Farms.

story:
Introducing SafeHouse Rehab, the world’s first high-tech rehab, leading the way in addiction treatment by taking a radical new approach to recovery. We believe that traditional rehabs have an antiquated view of recovery, and what is needed now is a modern, realistic approach to recovery.

Our leading-edge treatment approach is more effective than conventional treatment models. It uses technologies new to the rehab sector, yet proven in academic studies to restore brain health and cause major changes in physiology that accelerate healing.

Our research, examining rehabs around the globe shows that even the most expensive 5-star luxury rehabs have failed to integrate effective new technology to enhance the recovery experience. We also believe that they don’t provide anywhere near the tools and guidance for clients to help keep them clean and sober for a lifetime.

Here at SafeHouse Rehab our mission is to bring the most progressive thinking to solving the modern challenges of addiction. Our new model of treatment transforms not only our clients’ thinking and behaviour but also their physiology – a first among rehabs anywhere.

Our goal is to optimise our clients’ chances for long term success by giving them the best possible start on a sure road to a lifetime of clean and sober living.

 

New tech applications are the future

The funding we raise will enable us to purchase the very latest technologies available. Our initial goal is to reach £100,000 however the more we can raise the more we can do. We strongly believe that these technologies will have a massive impact on our ability to help our clients with their recovery.

We intend to purchase the following technologies with your help.

The Cocoon Pod

Hyperthermic technology disrupts addiction, enhances detox and reduces withdrawal time.

Academic results on the effects of the Wellness Renewal and Recovery POD conclusively show “the complex physio-therapeutic wellness capsule provides detoxification and reduces the time of withdrawal and improves recovery of patients with alcohol and opiate addictive syndrome.”

We expect that studies commissioned by the manufacturer at Stanford University and at Loughborough University will lend further scientific weight to the evidence.

This technology is the world’s first “multi-sensory wellness system” that represents a proven breakthrough in the spa and wellness space by triggering changes in brain waves and physiology on the strength of its unique hyperthermic effects.

Our plan is to integrate this technology into our rehab treatment program where each client will have multiple sessions as part of their tailored treatment program. Research has shown that this unique treatment module will prove to be especially valuable for clients throughout the entire treatment process.


The I-sopod Sensory Deprivation Tank

Sensory deprivation calms the nervous system and sets the stage for healing.

It's not uncommon for clients to enter into treatment in an overstimulated state. They come to us after having “hit rock bottom” and invariably bring with them a variety of symptoms indicative of extreme stress, including PTSD from chaotic and abusive situations.

Floatation occurs as a result of raising the density of water with Epsom Salts which are reputed to help with detox, while the ambient air and water temperature is calibrated to be perfectly tuned to that of the human body.

Time spent in an I-sopod floatation tank, taking away stressful environmental and bodily cues, can be just what the doctor ordered in the early stages. It will also be exceptionally therapeutic throughout the entire treatment process.

 

NeuroSpa Zero Gravity Chairs

Zero gravity and VR take clients to the next level of sensory experience.

We've chosen the NeuroSpa zero gravity chair to enable clients to reawaken their senses and experience amazement and fun without alcohol and drugs, perhaps for the first time in years.

The chair slides into zero gravity position, and as it does so, acoustic frequencies begin to connect directly with the nervous system, while anxiety and errant thoughts fade to zero as well. This is a fully immersive experience that includes massage for the body and Virtual Reality that fully engages both hemispheres of the brain.

The net effect is somewhat addictive in and of itself, as it relieves the stress put on the body by gravity itself and releases endorphins, natural painkillers that now substitute for the drugs that were once taken to achieve the same effect.

 

Our aftercare program leads the way

We coach and help clients to get and stay clean and go on to live joyful lives.

Traditional rehabs don’t provide anywhere near the tools and guidance for clients to keep them clean and sober for life. We do it right. First, we advise most clients to go into our Stage 2 sober living facility which becomes the affordable transition to everyday living. The simple truth is that the odds of long-term recovery improve the longer clients stay in supervised treatment.

 

And we absolutely outperform traditional rehabs with a structured aftercare program that we call Self Care Coaching for Life. We give clients a complete toolkit that they can use on their own, we help them connect to other recovering people and 12-step groups in their communities, we reach out with video calls weekly, and we connect clients in moderated chats, so they feel a part of, as opposed to apart from.

 

A healthy brain is a priority

All, yes all, clients come in with altered brain chemistry. It’s our job to make sure we monitor their brain health and provide the right nutrition to help rebuild this vital organ to a healthy state. Crucial to restoring brain chemistry to its pre-addictive, healthy level is a diet rich in dopamine, which functions as both a hormone and as a neurotransmitter. It plays several important roles in keeping brain and body functioning at optimum levels. Whereas opioids triggered release of dopamine before recovery, now the same release is made possible with proper nutrition and exercise.

A rigorous fitness program that includes HIIT – high intensity interval training - when clients are ready for it, is a crucial element in recovering both brain and physical health, enabling the body also to release endorphins that has clients feeling better naturally.

Our world-class sporting facilities are designed to keep clients occupied in healthy pursuits, making the most of their time at SafeHouse. The variety of activities available make it perfect for a novice, intermediate all the way through to an advanced athlete.

 

Our sporting facilities include:

  • State-of-the-art Gym
  • Badminton Courts
  • Waterpark
  • Football Pitches
  • Steam Room
  • Sauna
  • Muay Thai Boxing
  • Table Tennis
  • Yoga - Zumba - Dance Studio

 

 

And this is what we are not

  • We are not a traditional rehab. We deploy technology and process solutions that break with the past to lead the way with a modern approach to recovery that better addresses the complex, modern challenges of addiction.
  • We are not a beach resort or a country club rehab. We are integrated into a warm and welcoming Thai community that offers a real-life and safe experience. Although we are a sanctuary from the usual triggers, our clients are nonetheless better prepared for the world outside.
  • We are not just for wealthy people. We are an affordable alternative to high priced rehabs, yet we offer first-class accommodations, world-class sporting facilities and amenities that would be the envy of rehabs anywhere.

 

The team at SafeHouse Rehab

Robert Cook - Founder & CEO - Leads the team of dedicated professionals who implement his vision of a truly modern approach to recovery. He is also responsible for specifying and acquiring the technology to support the vision.

SafeHouse is also privileged to have an amazing team of professionals dedicated to providing care that meets or exceeds standards that fulfill our modern approach to recovery.

To learn more please visit our website - SafeHouse Team

 

Achieving our goal with your help

Our goal is to expand the SafeHouse facility so that we can serve more clients who need and deserve state-of-the art treatment, enabled by the technology and processes we described above.

We need your help in fulfilling our mission of bringing the very best and most progressive thinking to solving the challenges of addiction in the 21st century.

The funding we raise will enable us to purchase the very latest technologies available. Our initial goal is to reach £100,000 however the more we can raise the more we can do. We strongly believe that these technologies will have a massive impact on our ability to help our clients with their recovery.


Your contribution will also help us reach people who need help but can't afford addiction treatment, by posting on Facebook and other social media platforms, as well as the distribution of our newsletters and our 'Busting Addiction and Its Myths' podcast.

 

Other ways you can help

The best way you can help is by purchasing one of our perks, allowing us to reach our goal.
We do understand that not everyone will be able to contribute financially, however that doesn't mean to say that you can't help:

If you like what you see share this page on social media with your friends and family. Spreading the word is another great way to help us reach people who need help.

Also share and visit our website for more information safehouserehab.com

 

We value your privacy

Should you choose to donate anonymously, your name will not appear under "Backers," and we will not mention you in our social media or on our website.

 

 

And we value your time

So thank you very much for taking the time to read about us and consider supporting our mission.

story:
Sooth: natural skin care during chemotherapy

Softness during a hard fight

 

* scroll naar beneden voor de Nederlandse versie. 
Geen creditcard? Maak gebruik van  door te gaan naar: www.sooth-care.com/crowdfunding 

 

Maybe you feel the same way that we do. Maybe you also want help someone battling cancer. Even if you don’t know them personally.

Cancer is all around us. More and more people are being diagnosed with cancer. Have you ever imagined what it would be like if you got this diagnoses yourself? How your world would change? And how much strength it take to fight cancer?

Many people start chemotherapy. Everyone knows that when you start treatment, a huge battle is waiting for you. A struggle to get healthy, to live longer, for more… more of everything and for more time! Time with your loved ones and those around you.

Skin complaints during chemotherapy

Chemo also effects the skin tremendously. For many people extremely dry skin, due to the chemo, is what makes living a normal life impossible.

Clothes are no longer comfortable, you can no longer sleep well, everything itches and it hurts. It takes a lot of extra energy and it does not make you feel comfortable. While all you want is to invest your energy on healing!

That is why we work on bringing Sooth on the market. We would like to help as many people as we can who experience skin problems due to chemo.

With your help, we can support people with cancer worldwide. With your help, we can release a natural cream that gives softness during a hard fight.

Origin of Sooth

Sooth is started by 3 females founders. Friendship is the thriving force behind Sooth. Our first experience with cancer was with our parents. We saw the fight against cancer first hand and we wondered: ‘how could we help and support them?’

When Sandra's mother (Netty) got cancer, her best friend (and co-founder) felt a loss of words. There was so much she wanted to say, but nothing came out. As a token of support she made a comfort butter. Pure love in a jar for Sandra's mom. Every time Netty put it on, she enjoyed the soothing effect. That is what drives us.

We want to share what Netty experienced with the world. You can contribute to that. Give people with cancer back their hope, strength and confidence. Support the launch of the Sooth Face & Body cream.

The product

Our cream is called Sooth, because that's exactly what it does. It provides a moment of peace and relief. Sooth Face & Body Cream nourishes, protects and accelerates healing.

Due to the active ingredients such as probiotics and baobab oil, which have been proven to be very effective in repairing chemotherapy-damaged skin. Sooth contains only natural ingredients.

Support our campaign and our mission

By supporting this campaign, we can make sure that the product becomes available to anyone who has skin problems due to chemo.

With the amount collected, we can produce and deliver the first batch. In addition, it offers us the opportunity to develop other products, such as a special cream for hands and feet. To sum things up, with the amount collected we can:

  • Order the ingredients for the Sooth Face &  Body Cream.
  • Start production of Sooth Face &  Body Cream.
  • Offer softness during a hard fight.
  • Increase our reach, so as people worldwide, who are undergoing chemo, can learn about us.
  • Develop much needed other products that can be used by people undergoing chemo, such as hand cream, foot cream, soap and sunscreen.

Sooth perks

To use  as a payment method please visit: www.sooth-care.com/crowdfunding 
 

 

Sooth: natuurlijke huidverzorging voor de met chemo behandelde huid

Zachtheid tijdens een harde strijd

 

Misschien lijk jij op ons. Misschien wil je graag iemand helpen die kanker heeft.

Kanker is overal om ons heen. Steeds vaker hoor je dat mensen de diagnose hebben gekregen. Misschien heb je je wel eens voorgesteld hoe het zou zijn als jij dit zelf mee zou maken. Hoe je wereld dan zou veranderen en hoeveel kracht er nodig is om hiertegen te vechten.

Veel mensen beginnen aan een chemokuur. Iedereen weet dat als je daaraan begint, er een enorme strijd op je ligt te wachten. Een strijd om gezond te worden, om langer te leven, voor meer van alles en vooral meer tijd! Tijd met je geliefden en de mensen om je heen.

Huidklachten tijdens chemotherapie

Chemo heeft ook een enorme bijwerking op de huid. Velen krijgen een extreem droge huid, door de chemo, wat normaal leven onmogelijk maakt.

Kleren zitten niet meer lekker, je kunt niet meer lekker slapen, alles jeukt en het doet pijn. Het kost veel extra energie, je zit erdoor niet lekker in je vel.  Dat terwijl je juist je energie wilt investeren in de strijdt om te leven!

Dat is de reden waarom wij aan Sooth werken. We willen zo graag zoveel mogelijk mensen helpen met huidproblemen door chemo.

Met jouw hulp kunnen we wereldwijd mensen met kanker ondersteunen. Met jouw hulp kunnen we een crème uitbrengen die de zachtheid geeft tijdens een harde strijd.

Ontstaan van Sooth

Sooth is opgezet door 3 vrouwelijk oprichters. Vriendschap is de kracht achter Sooth. Onze eerste ervaring met kanker begint bij onze ouders. We zagen van dichtbij hun strijd tegen kanker en dachten: ‘hoe konden we ze helpen en ondersteunen?’

Toen de moeder van Sandra kanker kreeg maakte het veel los bij haar beste vriendin (en mede oprichter). Zoveel wat ze wilde zeggen maar er kwam niks. Als steun maakte ze een troostboter, pure liefde in een potje.

Voor de moeder van Sandra. Sandra’s moeder smeerde meerdere malen per dag de troostboter omdat het haar zoveel verlichting gaf! Nu zetten we een stap verder, elke dag weer om de crème op de markt te kunnen brengen.

Jij kunt hieraan je steentje bijdragen en mensen met kanker helpen. Geef mensen met kanker hoop, kracht en hun vertrouwen terug. Steun het op de markt komen van de Sooth Face & Body crème.

Het product

Onze crème heet Sooth, want dat is precies wat het doet. Het geeft een moment van rust en opluchting. Sooth Face & Body crème voedt, beschermt en versnelt de genezing.

Van de actieve ingrediënten zoals probiotica en baobabolie is het bewezen dat het zeer effectief is bij het herstellen van door chemotherapie beschadigde huid. Sooth bevat alleen natuurlijke ingrediënten.

Steun onze campagne en onze missie

Door deze campagne te ondersteunen, kunnen we ervoor zorgen dat het product beschikbaar komt voor iedereen die huidproblemen heeft door chemo. Met jouw hulp kunnen we veel mensen wereldwijd met kanker ondersteunen. Met jouw hulp kunnen we een crème uitbrengen die de zachtheid geeft tijdens een harde strijd.

Het ingezamelde bedrag zorgt ervoor dat we de eerste batch kunnen produceren en leveren. Daarnaast biedt het ons de mogelijkheid om andere producten te ontwikkelen, zoals een speciale crème voor handen en voeten. Alles op een rijtje:

  • De ingrediënten bestellen voor de Sooth Face & Body crème.
  • De productie starten van Sooth.
  • Ons bereik vergroten, zodat we zoveel mogelijk mensen die chemo ondergaan kunnen bereiken.
  • Hoognodige andere producten ontwikkelen, die gebruikt kunnen worden door mensen die chemo ondergaan, zoals handcrème, voeten crème, zeep en zonnebrandcrème.

Crowdfunding perks

Om gebruik te maken van  ga naar: www.sooth-care.com/crowdfunding 

 

Geen creditcard? Maak gebruik van  door te gaan naar: www.sooth-care.com/crowdfunding

Sooth Face & Body Cream nourishes, protects and accelerates healing.Due to the active ingredients such as probiotics and baobab oil, which have been proven to be very effective in repairing chemotherapy-damaged skin. Sooth contains only natural ingredients.Support our campaign and our missionBy supporting this campaign, we can make sure that the product becomes available to anyone who has skin problems due to chemo.With the amount collected, we can produce and deliver the first batch. In addition, it offers us the opportunity to develop other products, such as a special cream for hands and feet. To sum things up, with the amount collected we can:
Order the ingredients for the Sooth Face &  Body Cream.
Start production of Sooth Face &  Body Cream.
Offer softness during a hard fight.
Increase our reach, so as people worldwide, who are undergoing chemo, can learn about us.
Develop much needed other products that can be used by people undergoing chemo, such as hand cream, foot cream, soap and sunscreen.
Sooth perksTo use  as a payment method please visit: www.sooth-care.com/crowdfunding   Sooth: natuurlijke huidverzorging voor de met chemo behandelde huidZachtheid tijdens een harde strijd Misschien lijk jij op ons. Misschien wil je graag iemand helpen die kanker heeft.Kanker is overal om ons heen. Steeds vaker hoor je dat mensen de diagnose hebben gekregen. Misschien heb je je wel eens voorgesteld hoe het zou zijn als jij dit zelf mee zou maken. Hoe je wereld dan zou veranderen en hoeveel kracht er nodig is om hiertegen te vechten.Veel mensen beginnen aan een chemokuur. Iedereen weet dat als je daaraan begint, er een enorme strijd op je ligt te wachten. Een strijd om gezond te worden, om langer te leven, voor meer van alles en vooral meer tijd! Tijd met je geliefden en de mensen om je heen.Huidklachten tijdens chemotherapieChemo heeft ook een enorme bijwerking op de huid. Velen krijgen een extreem droge huid, door de chemo, wat normaal leven onmogelijk maakt.Kleren zitten niet meer lekker, je kunt niet meer lekker slapen, alles jeukt en het doet pijn. Het kost veel extra energie, je zit erdoor niet lekker in je vel.  Dat terwijl je juist je energie wilt investeren in de strijdt om te leven!Dat is de reden waarom wij aan Sooth werken. We willen zo graag zoveel mogelijk mensen helpen met huidproblemen door chemo.Met jouw hulp kunnen we wereldwijd mensen met kanker ondersteunen. Met jouw hulp kunnen we een crème uitbrengen die de zachtheid geeft tijdens een harde strijd.Ontstaan van SoothSooth is opgezet door 3 vrouwelijk oprichters. Vriendschap is de kracht achter Sooth. Onze eerste ervaring met kanker begint bij onze ouders. We zagen van dichtbij hun strijd tegen kanker en dachten: ‘hoe konden we ze helpen en ondersteunen?’Toen de moeder van Sandra kanker kreeg maakte het veel los bij haar beste vriendin (en mede oprichter). Zoveel wat ze wilde zeggen maar er kwam niks. Als steun maakte ze een troostboter, pure liefde in een potje.Voor de moeder van Sandra. Sandra’s moeder smeerde meerdere malen per dag de troostboter omdat het haar zoveel verlichting gaf! Nu zetten we een stap verder, elke dag weer om de crème op de markt te kunnen brengen.Jij kunt hieraan je steentje bijdragen en mensen met kanker helpen. Geef mensen met kanker hoop, kracht en hun vertrouwen terug. Steun het op de markt komen van de Sooth Face & Body crème.Het productOnze crème heet Sooth, want dat is precies wat het doet. Het geeft een moment van rust en opluchting. Sooth Face & Body crème voedt, beschermt en versnelt de genezing.Van de actieve ingrediënten zoals probiotica en baobabolie is het bewezen dat het zeer effectief is bij het herstellen van door chemotherapie beschadigde huid. Sooth bevat alleen natuurlijke ingrediënten.Steun onze campagne en onze missieDoor deze campagne te ondersteunen, kunnen we ervoor zorgen dat het product beschikbaar komt voor iedereen die huidproblemen heeft door chemo. Met jouw hulp kunnen we veel mensen wereldwijd met kanker ondersteunen. Met jouw hulp kunnen we een crème uitbrengen die de zachtheid geeft tijdens een harde strijd.Het ingezamelde bedrag zorgt ervoor dat we de eerste batch kunnen produceren en leveren. Daarnaast biedt het ons de mogelijkheid om andere producten te ontwikkelen, zoals een speciale crème voor handen en voeten. Alles op een rijtje:
De ingrediënten bestellen voor de Sooth Face & Body crème.
De productie starten van Sooth.
Ons bereik vergroten, zodat we zoveel mogelijk mensen die chemo ondergaan kunnen bereiken.
Hoognodige andere producten ontwikkelen, die gebruikt kunnen worden door mensen die chemo ondergaan, zoals handcrème, voeten crème, zeep en zonnebrandcrème.
Crowdfunding perksOm gebruik te maken van  ga naar: www.sooth-care.com/crowdfunding  Geen creditcard? Maak gebruik van  door te gaan naar: www.sooth-care.com/crowdfunding

story:
Schools Need to be Safe in Order to Reopen

As the COVID-19 pandemic continues, while there is hope as the new vaccine rollouts continue, there is still a level of uncertainty as to when it will be safe for people to resume their daily lives, including children and teachers returning back to school. Vaccine distribution is taking some time, and it is uncertain when all demographic groups will be protected. So, how do schools consider safely reopening until widespread vaccines are available, and, how do we continue to keep them safe once the vaccine has been widely distributed?

COVID-19 Testing: Current and Future Needs

While the historical reach and spread of the coronavirus is still relatively unknown, mass testing efforts for active infection, as well as antibody testing, continue to be conducted in an effort to fight the pandemic and save lives. Testing today versus one or more years from now will fall into two main categories: active infection and antibody testing.

Active Infection

Currently, for those that are experiencing symptoms and/or have been exposed to someone who tested positive for COVID-19, point-of-care active infection testing provides information on whether someone has contracted the virus. As vaccines are rolled out, active infection testing will still be needed when someone begins to show symptoms of a flu-like virus.

Antibody Testing

Antibody testing for COVID-19 can help in a number of ways. Since antibodies remain in the bloodstream long after the infection has cleared, antibody testing provides the history of whether someone had the virus. For schools, this helps primarily by providing data on how widely the virus has historically circulated amongst children and staff.  This data in turn informs the school if it has previously experienced a particularly high risk or not and needs to be extra-cautious or can relax rules. Antibody testing can also be used as a low-cost alternative to active infection testing for those teachers and students who have recovered from the virus.

The Vaccine and Antibody Testing's Role

As vaccines are rolled out, antibody tests, such as ours, will help ascertain that the vaccine has worked properly and that vaccinated individuals have developed antibodies and are protected. While there is still uncertainty around how long antibodies from the vaccine last, antibody testing will also play a roll in monitoring how long antibodies last created in response from the vaccine.

DDTD and Donated Antibody Testing to Schools

About Us

Drugs & Diagnostics for Tropical Diseases (DDTD) is a 501(c)(3) San Diego County based nonprofit that focuses on developing ultra-low-cost treatments and diagnostics for diseases that predominantly affect vulnerable populations.

DDTD embraces the idea of eliminating diseases that do not belong in the 21st century. DDTD primarily focuses on Neglected Tropical Diseases (NTDs), a group of diseases that afflicts 1 in 6 people, or approximately 1.4 billion individuals worldwide; as well as diseases that affect impoverished populations. 

Due to the nature of our organization and its focus on developing diagnostics for Neglected Tropical Diseases (NTDs), we are primarily funded through government grants that are specifically earmarked for work on these diseases. Because of our years spent developing tests for NTDs, we have achieved a remarkably sensitive diagnostic development platform and our NTD tests can be more than 10 times more sensitive than comparable devices sold by diagnostic giants.

It was therefore a natural extension for us to customize our platform to the detection of COVID-19 antibodies. True to our mission, we have developed a high-quality, low-cost COVID-19 antibody test that has 90% sensitivity and 100% specificity. We have completed our clinical trial and are submitting an application for Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) to the Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

Donated Testing to Schools

We plan to manufacture an initial batch of 100,000 antibody tests, of which 40,000 will be donated to schools. As DDTD continues to manufacture additional tests, for every two tests sold, we will donate one to schools.

How You Can Support Your Schools

Due to the nature of our organization and its focus on developing diagnostics for Neglected Tropical Diseases (NTDs), we are primarily funded through government grants that are specifically earmarked for work on these diseases. DDTD therefore needs the support of individuals in order to commercialize and donate COVID-19 antibody tests.

DDTD has developed a unique opportunity for you to support our organization's efforts, while at the same time nominating or designating which schools will receive the donated antibody tests. 

Supporters can give at any level, and certain levels provide the ability to nominate or designate a school to receive donated tests (pending school acceptance). Giving levels and benefits are as follows:

Support Levels

$25 - Supports 2 tests for schools

$50 - Supports 5 tests to schools

$100 - Supports 10 tests to schools, enables "nominate a school" to receive a donation

$500 - Supports 50 tests to schools, enables "nominate a school" to receive a donation, recognition of your donation through social media and on the DDTD website

$1,000 - Supports 100 tests to schools, enables "designation of a school" to receive a donation (# of tests donated not guaranteed)

$2,500 - Supports 250 tests to schools, enables "designation of a school" to receive a donation (# of tests donated guaranteed)

$5,000 - Supports 500 tests to schools, enables "designation of a school" to receive a donation (# of tests donated guaranteed), arranged testing onsite at DDTD for friends and family (if in the San Diego area)

$10,000 - Supports 1,000 tests to schools, enables "designation of a school" to receive a donation (# of tests donated guaranteed), arranged testing onsite at DDTD for friends and family (if in the San Diego area), and a presentation ceremony with top school staff (socially distanced) with a plaque in your name to be given with the donated tests. 

For nominations and designations, schools must be open and willing to receive donated COVID-19 antibody tests.  Supporters who give at a level that enables "nominate a school" or "designation of a school" will be contacted directly by one of DDTD's staff to obtain information on their school of choice.

DDTD will also be opening an online portal where schools will be able to sign up to be considered for a donation from the pool of funding we receive that is not designated to specific schools. 

Testing Commercialization and Distribution

COVID-19 antibody test commercialization; which includes manufacturing, production, and distribution, will be highly dependent on the level of funding raised from the Indiegogo campaign. If DDTD can reach our goal of $200,000 by the end of January, we anticipate that we will be able to have tests commercialized and ready for distribution by the end of March 2021. 

Distribution of the donated tests will be first focused on the San Diego area, where on-site coordination with schools that are receiving the tests can be managed. DDTD is moving forward with a Phase II of EUA from the FDA for point-of-care distribution, which, once approved, will enable school nurses to do testing directly and not require an onsite member of our staff and/or coordinate of a medium complexity lab. Once we receive EUA for Phase II, we will begin coordinating shipments of tests directly to schools outside of the San Diego area. We anticipate filing in the Spring of 2021, with the goal of getting tests to schools outside of San Diego before the school year starts in the fall of 2021.
